loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Felisa is 52 years old and has two children who are in school.

Felisa has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Felisa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 51-year old lady, and her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of six children.

Her husband owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures wooden furniture such as sofa, chairs, tables and beds. He has been making furniture for many years and teaching his arts to his son as well.

Now her son has become a fine carpenter and can easily run a separate business, so he opened a new shop. Now he wants to buy all his tools and raw materials for making furniture. Therefore, Safia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can be able to buy raw materials for making furniture. 

Safia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy wooden raw materials for furniture making

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado, está casado y su esposa es comerciante en pequeño, tienen 5 hijos y solamente 3 viven en su casa y estudian 2°, 5° y 8° grado, y nadie más vive con ellos, con su pareja son los encargados del sustento de su familia. 

Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura específicamente en la siembre de maíz, además hace trabajos de albañilería y le ayuda a su esposa en una pequeña tienda que tiene en su hogar, los trabajos los hace en la comunidad. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para terminar de construir un pequeño local para poner la venta y tener más ordenada la mercadería y que tenga más espacio su casa.

Desea terminar de construir el pequeño cafetín para comprar más y con las ganancias remodelar su casa, repellarla y ponerle piso de cemento y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Francisco, 36 years old, finished 3rd grade. He is married and his wife is a small trader. They have five children and only three live in their house and are in 2nd, 5th and 8th grades and no one else lives with them. With his partner, he is in charge if supporting the family.

Since childhood, he has been dedicated to farming, specifically sowing maize. Additionally, he does mason work and helps his wife in the small shop that she has in their home. They perform their jobs in their own community.

The loan that he is requesting is to finish building a small shop where they can sell and keep the merchandise more organized and so that they can have more space in their house.

He wishes to finish building the small cafe to buy more and, with the earnings, remodel his house, put in a cement floor and see his children finish school.

loans.use: to finish building a small shop where he can sell and keep his merchandise more organized and have more room in his house.

loans.name: Lucia De Jesús

texts.es:
Lucia de 62 años de edad, no hizo ningún grado, manifestó que sus padres eran pobres, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tienen 6 hijos y sola una vive en casa y trabaja.

Lucia se ha dedicado toda su vida a los oficios domésticos, además se ha ganado el sustento lavando y planchando ropa ajena y su pareja es el que obtiene y aporta ingresos al hogar. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar semilla, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar pipián y con el resto compra dos de terneros para crecerlos.

Los sueños de ella son gozar de buena salud y que su esposo en las siembras les vaya bien para pagar el préstamo y con las ganancias invertirlas en la próxima siembre de maíz.
texts.en:
Lucia, age 62, did not go to school.  She explains that her parents were poor.  She is married, and her husband is a farmer.  They have six children, and only one lives at home and works.

Lucia has devoted her entire life to doing domestic chores.  She has also earned sustenance by washing and ironing clothes for other people.  Her life partner is the one who gets and contributes income to the household.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy seeds, pesticides, and herbicides to plant pumpkins.  She will use the rest to buy two calves to raise.

Her dreams are to enjoy good health, for her husband’s crops to go well in order to repay the loan, and to use the profits to invest in the next cultivation of corn.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, and herbicides to plant pumpkins and to buy two calves to raise.

loans.name: Huma's Group

texts.en:
Huma is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children; her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Huma runs a small boutique at home; she sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases cloth from the market at a low price, sews it, and then sells it at a higher price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing is due to the attractive designs and colors. 

Her husband affords all the household expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

She wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis. This is the reason she has requested a loan, so that she can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. 

Huma wishes for a bright future for her children, and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more variety of garments for her boutique.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“AUCA education is a dream of many students as it’s the best university in the region. Together with Bard College in USA, the university develops joint research projects, and offers educational exchanges for faculty, staff and students from both institutions. And this is not the only advantage of AUCA. Once you enter, you live with AUCA spirit and become one big family.

My family is a big middle-class family of 7 including my grandmother. The lion's portion of our income is spent on daily necessities, and the other part goes to cover tuition fees for my sister’s college and my brother’s kindergarten. As I became a university student from this year, it has become very difficult for my parents to pay my tuition given their level of income. My grandmother has a small pension, which is not even enough to cover her medical bills as she gets sick very often. In addition to all this, I am the eldest in my family, so my duty is to help my parents improve the family’s financial situation, which can only be achieved by getting a well-paid job after completing my education successfully. Therefore, a KIVA loan and its lenders' support are very important to me, I really appreciate your time and support.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz was born in 1992. He lives with parents in south Tajikistan. Parviz studies at the fifth course of the Medical University of Tajikistan. He is a very clever and hardworking student. Parviz works in a hospital at night. He works in a reanimation unit as a nurse. Parviz dreams of being a high quality specialist in future. He must pay his university tuition and with this aim he is asking for a loan of 900 USD. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz is young and smart man. He is 20 years old. Firuz is not married, and lives with his parents in the south part of Tajikistan. 

Firuz studies at the university. He is a student in the third year at National University of Tajikistan. Firuz studies well. He gets excellent and good marks.

Firuz is asking for a loan because he must pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy and, in advance, thanks Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.en:
Risolatkhon was born in 1969. She is divorced and has a son. She is the only breadwinner for her son and herself. Risolatkhon is a highly educated woman who works in a local school. Risolathon has worked there more than 14 years. She is very hardworking and a smart teacher who does her job well. 

Risolatkhon uses her salary to buy food and clothes for her child. She must buy coal and a stove for her household for the winter season. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy coal and a stove. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and a stove for her household in winter

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Rosalinda requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 57 years old and has three children. She is married, and has one child who is still in school.

Esther is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Esther has been farming sugarcane for three years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Charina works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Charina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her furniture making business.

Charina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for for her furniture making business

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 37 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening.

Jeralyn requested her tenth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional groceries to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dmitrii

texts.en:
Dmitrii is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“I am an ordinary, but very ambitious teenager. My life changed when I was 14 and started break dancing. Dancing taught me a lot of important things in this life. Once I lost a big competition and was sad. My parents encouraged me telling me that, “What doesn’t kill me, that makes me stronger”. I practiced more and began to take part in different contests. The next year I won seven big battles in a row and was announced as “The best break dancer of Kyrgyzstan in 2012”. 

At the age of 15, I met an amazing magician, who surprised me and was presenting smiles for this world. I loved watching at him, but wanted to try to do the same actions at home. I was lucky to become an illusionist myself and taught other guys. We organized more than 50 shows and 3 concerts gathering more than 15,000 people and made 7 videos that year. Such successes directed me onto the charity, so together with organizations such as “Voice of Freedom”, “House of Volunteers”, “El studio”, we have organized many concerts and shows for the children in cancer centers, orphanages and nursing houses.

I think that my mission in this world is not finished and I can do more exciting things along with my study at AUCA. I understand that hobbies are good and free entertainment, but I need to get a higher education to be sure of my future, and hope I will be the best at AUCA, too. Your loan will help me win many more “life contests and battles” that will have positive impact on my community. Thank you in advance.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is married and has five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small gemstones store, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings, necklaces, and embroidery. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for his customers. With only one source of income, her husband has to pay the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children, and household expenses. 

Shahida requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to increase his inventory of gemstones. With the increased income, she hopes that she can make improvements to her house so that her family members can live comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Sot is 41 years old and has five children. She lives in Preah Vihear Province. She grows cassava as her main source of income and sells snacks to earn additional income. 

Sot requested her eighth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat is 41 years old. She is a single mother of her son. Hidoyat is a very kind woman and does her best for the well-being of her son. She is a highly educated woman. 

Hidoyat has worked for more than 14 years in a school. She teaches lower classes. Hidoyat is one of the best teachers and likes her job very much. She has many pupils. Her pupils are clever because Hidoyat tries to give them good knowledge. 

She must buy coal and a stove for her house because in winter season the weather is cold so she must keep her house warm. Hidoyat has not enough saving and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy coal and a stove. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and a stove to keep her house warm

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly, 35, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jelly has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, soap, canned goods and other groceries.

Jelly has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, soap, canned goods and other groceries

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 46 years old and married with three children. One of her children is in school. Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Jenny has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as candies, canned goods, cookies, etc.. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Welsonia

texts.en:
Welsonia is 48 years old and has four children. She is married, and has one child who is currently in school.

Welsonia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for pigs.

Welsonia has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Avita works hard to support her family.

She has a computer shop business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a photo shop. Avita is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional computer set for her business.

Avita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional an computer set for her business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar de 51 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de víveres, ranchos, bebidas y todos los productos de la canasta familiar, desde hace 4 años, vendiendo de contado gran parte y un mínimo porcentaje a crédito a clientes fieles. Sus principales compradores al detalle, son las amas de casa, vecinas que diariamente se concentran en la tienda, para comprar y compartir conversaciones en su corto encuentro. Los artículos que más rotan en su inventario, son el arroz, azúcar, café, carnes frías, etc. Su meta de prosperidad es aumentar sus ingresos con más inventarios de estos productos, para generar mayores utilidades y finalmente cumplir el propósito de lograr que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios profesionales. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará más productos para su negocio, como arroz, azúcar, café, bebidas, cárnicos, etc, con lo cual planea mejorar sus ventas y capitalizar su negocio, porque su mayor desafío es lograr obtener ahorros mediante su  persistente y disciplinado trabajo.
texts.en:
Cesar, 51, has been working for four years selling provisions, ready meals, drinks and all the basic goods that a family needs. He mostly sells to cash buyers but also sells on credit to a small percentage of trusted clients.

In detail, his main customers are housewives, neighbours who gather in his shop every day to buy and to have a chat in their brief meetings. The articles of stock which sell the most are rice, sugar, coffee, cold meats etc. His goal for success is to increase his earnings by stocking more of these products to generate greater profits, and finally achieve his intention of enabling his children to manage to finish their professional studies.

At present he is applying for a loan from kiva, the first financing that they are making to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy more products for his business, like rice, sugar, coffee, drinks, meats, etc. With these he plans to improve his sales and capitalise on his business, because his greatest challenge is to manage to build up some savings through his persistent and disciplined work.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, drinks,  meats etc.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 64 years old, is married, and has eight children.

Joseph likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Joseph plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Joseph’s group will receive inputs to cultivate 10 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Residing from Kampong Speu province, Lim, 38, is the mother of two schoolchildren. She grows rice as the single source of her income and this earns her about 36,000 KHR per day. For Lim, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of five to get new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have a latrine to use just like other families do.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia de 31 años de edad, habita en Cartagena de Indias, linda ciudad e Colombia, donde la playa, la brisa y el mar, alegran la vida de habitantes y turistas. Emilia conforma su familia con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 8 años, con quienes sueña verlos crecer exitosamente, ofreciéndoles una educación de calidad. Hace 2 años inició un negocio mediante el cual vende calzado, ropa, electrodomésticos, en fin todo tipo de mercancía, solicitada por su clientela, y hoy tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio y más rentable, por eso trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 9 de la noche sin detenerse, con el fin de lograr sus sueños de prosperidad. Cuando inició su negocio, Emilia fue impulsada por su suegra, con el fin de que ella lograra un mayor ingreso en su grupo familiar. Hoy su determinación de aumentar su crecimiento hace que se acerque a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento al que aplica en esta organización, con el fin de comprar ropa, calzado, electrodomésticos, etc. apuntándole a nuevos inventarios que logren atraer una nueva clientela y una mayor ampliación de sus ventas, las cuales son directamente proporcional a sus ingresos y mejorarán sustancialmente su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Emilia is 31 years old and lives in Cartagena de Indias, a beautiful city in Colombia where the breeze and the sea makes the inhabitants and visitors happy. Emilia formed a family with her husband and her two children aged 4 and 8 years old. She dreams of seeing them grow successfully providing them with quality education. Two years ago she started a business selling clothing, footwear and household appliances, well all kinds of merchandise requested by her clients. Today her goal is to expand her business and make it more profitable. So she works from 8 in the morning until 9 at night without stopping with the goal of achieving her dream of prosperity.

When she began her business Emilia was driven by her mother-in-law with the aim of creating more income for the family. Today her determination to increase the growth leads her to approach the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with the loan of getting a loan from Kiva, the first that she has asked for from this organization. She will use it to buy clothing, footwear and household appliances, etc. having new inventory so that she can attract a new clientele and increase her sales more. Her sales are directly proportional to her profits and will substantially improve her business and her family life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, appliances, etc.

loans.name: Zhyrgal

texts.en:
Zhyrgal is a freshman at AUCA, Department of Psychology. Here is her story:

“I know that a good education will open many doors for my future plans and career.  I am sorry to confess that the majority of universities in Kyrgyzstan don’t meet the international standards and have problems with the lack of good professors. Only AUCA in our region has ability to provide its students the best education, modern lab, and show the path for the International Internships; that’s why I really need financial aid from Kiva to study at AUCA.

I have some reasons for explaining why my family has financial problems. My mother has brought me up alone, as I haven’t had a father. On another hand, my mother is an accountant, whose salary covers only our daily expenses. Even so, my mother made many sacrifices to allow me to focus on education. I went to school in Tash-Dobo village, but because of the teachers’ deficiency, was forced to move and live with my aunt in Kara-Balta, where I continued my education in another school. 

The life seems to be a struggle for me, as I am a freshman at AUCA. Again, I live separate from my mother in a different town, and feel the lack of money and need someone’s help. But this time we wait for the Kiva lenders’ assistance - people, who we don’t know, but who are not indifferent to the difficult situations of others. 

I extend my big thanks to you.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Judith Pamela

texts.es:
Judith es una joven estudiante de SENATI de la Carrera de Procesos de Producción Textil, actualmente está cursando el tercer ciclo de estudios. Ella vive junto a su madre y sus 5 hermanos, siendo ella la mayor de todos.Sus padres están separados.
A ella siempre le ha gustado todo lo referente a lo Textil y está segura que su carrera no solo la beneficiará económicamente, sino que también le permitirá apoyar a su madre con la educación de sus cinco hermanos menores.
Su mamá es ayudante de costura y con lo poco que gana estuvo apoyando a Judith, pero debido a la situación actual por la que están atravesando, se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un Crédito Educativo para así no dejar de estudiar.
Para ella, la labor de KIVA es muy importante, ya que le permite a los estudiantes como ella que tienen deseos de superación, a no dejarse vencer y luchar por sus metas, que en su caso es ser una excelente profesional en Procesos de Producción Textil.
texts.en:
Judith is a young SENATI student majoring in Textile Production Processes and is currently in her third term at the institute. She lives with her mother and her five siblings of whom she is the eldest. Her parents are separated.

She has always liked everything to do with textiles and she is sure that her profession will not only benefit her financially, but it will also allow her to help her mother pay for the education of her five younger brothers and sisters. Her mother is an assistant seamstress and with the little she earns she has been supporting Judith. But due to the situation they are currently facing it was necessary to apply for an education loan so she wouldn't have to abandon her studies. 

Judith feels that the work that KIVA does is very important because it allows students like her who have the desire to get ahead not to give up and to continue fighting to reach their goals.  In her case, her goal is to become an excellent professional in the field of Textile Production.

loans.use: to pay off debt so she can continue her studies and become a professional in the field of Textile Production Processes.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small crockery store, where he sells utensils and crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons, and buckets. 

He has only one source of income, and he has to afford the expenses of utility bills and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark, according to the living standard.

He wants buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantities to arrange a dowry. Nowadays, the marriage season is about to start; for this purpose, more inventory is required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

Aysha has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so her her husband can buy utensils and crockery items and can generate more income.

loans.use: To buy crockery

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosana is 38 years old and all four children are in school.

Rosana has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosana has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, and groceries.

Edna has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from farming.

Edna aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de 52 años de edad, habita en la bella ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, con su familia. Ella tiene 3 hijos adultos, con quienes sueña sean exitosos.  El 4 de Octubre del año 2010, Graciela inició su negocio de venta de mercancías, aprovechando sus 10 años de experiencia como comerciante, actividad aprendida de su madre, quien se dedicaba al comercio de productos variados.  Graciela empezó probando el mercado y hoy su sueño de crecimiento no se detiene; su meta más adelante es tener un local propio, además de adquirir vivienda para mejorar sus condiciones actuales. En su oferta comercial  Graciela, exhibe perfumes, cremas, ropa, accesorios femeninos etc, mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, a través de los cuales ofrece los artículos. Sus clientes le compran a crédito y ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, con el fin de alcanzar el cumplimiento de sus sueños  personales, familiares y de negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios femeninos e infantiles, ropa y calzado, ajustado a las festividades que se acercan, con motivo de la despedida del final del año 2014 y bienvenida por el comienzo del año 2015. Con esta inversión  su negocio mejorará pues aumentando sus inventarios a la medida del cliente, podrá cumplir con los pedidos que ellos han hecho con los cuales se sentirán muy elegantes, mientras, bailan y disfrutar en familia como lo indican las tradiciones, entre pitos y matracas entre música, sonrisas  y abrazos repartidos al interior de las familias y con sus vecinos y amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Garciela, age 52, lives with her family in the beautiful city of Cartagena.  She has three adult children, and she dreams of them being successful.  On October 4th, 2010, Graciela started a business selling merchandise.  She took advantage of her ten years of experience as a merchant.  She learned this business activity from her mother, who sold various products.

Graciela started testing the market, and now her dream of growing does not stop.  Her goal for later on is to have her own place and to get a house in order to improve her current living conditions.

In her commercial offerings Graciela displays perfumes, creams, clothes, and women’s accessories, etc. through specialized guides or catalogs.  She offers the items through these catalogs.  Her customers buy on credit.  She works from eight in the morning until six in the evenings.  She does this in order to fulfill her personal, familial, and business dreams.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy children’s and women’s accessories, clothes, and shoes for the festivities that are approaching to say good-bye to the end of the year 2014 and welcome the beginning of the year 2015.

With this investment her business will improve.  She will be increasing her inventory to meet her customers’ needs.  She will be able to fill the orders they have made, which will make them feel very elegant when they dance and enjoy the traditions with their families.  These include whistles and noisemakers with music, and smiles and hugs that are shared with the family and their neighbors and friends.

loans.use: to buy children’s and women’s accessories, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca de 33  años de edad, es madre soltera de 1hijo que estudia educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad, la señora posee un negocio propio que se trata de una venta de pupusas y comida que funciona todos los días de semana en horario de 6:00 am a 8: pm está ubicada en su casa de habitación. 

 Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que cuenta con un excelente historial de crédito,  es muy reconocida por las personas de su comunidad, ella se dedicó a trabajar en una tienda cuando era joven y fue allí donde adquirió experiencia, luego comenzó con su propio negocio impulsada por su madre y su padre hasta el día de hoy se mantiene trabajando y con ayuda de su madre juntas  le dan el sustento diario a su familia y garantizan los derechos fundamentales a su hijo.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una nueva estufa y una plancha para hacer pupusas y dos mesas para su comedor, ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y hay una gran demanda de comida y de pupusas para extender su negocio ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tendrá mejores ganancias económicas para solventar con sus compromisos crediticios.

Los sueños de Blanca, son los de ver a sus hijo como un profesional ingeniero en agronomía, también ampliar su negocio y montar una granja de cerdos y adquirir un vehículo para el traslado de la mercadería.
texts.en:
Blanca, 33, is the single mother of one child who's getting a basic education in the community school.  She has her own business selling pupusas and food; it's located in her home and she runs it every day of the week from 6 a.m. until 8.

She's a very hardworking and responsible woman who has an excellent credit record and is very well known among the people in her community.  She decided to work in a store when she was young, and that's where she got her experience.  Later she started her own business, encouraged by her mother and father.  She has kept on working up to the present, and with her mother's help, together they support the family on a daily basis and ensure her son's basic rights.

The loan Blanca's requesting is to buy a new stove and a griddle for making pupusas, and two tables for her dining room.  The end-of-year celebrations are coming up and there's great demand for food and pupusas, so she can expand her business, which has become her main source of income.  That way she'll provide better customer service and earn better profits to pay her credit commitments.

Blanca's dreams are to see her son become a professional agronomy engineer as well as to expand her business, start a pig farm, and acquire a vehicle to transport merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a stove and a griddle for making pupusas, and two tables for her dining room, because of the great demand for food during the holiday season

loans.name: Khann's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Khann is 43 years old and a mother of five children. To earn her family's living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to support her family's needs. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of eight members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have a latrine to use and her family can live in good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Norys Isabel

texts.es:
Noris una veterana mujer, soltera sin hijos que dedica su vida a cuidar a su madre ya que esta es muy enferma y requiere una persona que este constantemente con ella, para poder conseguir recursos la señora Noris monto una modistería en su casa donde gana los recursos necesarios para  sobrevivir junto con su madre y en vista de que requiere medicamentos y cuidados especiales casi toda su ganancia la invierte en ella.
Noris presenta una dificultad y es la falta de capital para invertir en su trabajo que es lo único que les da de comer a ella y su madre y quiere solicitar un pequeño monto para comprar hilos, telas y elásticos, siendo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda su gran sueño y anhelo en la vida.
texts.en:
Noris is an old-timer, single without children who dedicates her life taking care of her mother who is now very sick and requires someone to constantly be with her. In order to generate resources Noris opened a sewing workshop in her house where she makes the resources needed to survive together with her mother who needs medication and special care. Almost all her income is invested in her.

Noris has a problem and it is the lack of capital to invest in her work which is the only way she has to provide the food for her and her mom. She wants to request a small amount of money to buy fabric, thread and elastic. Improving the condition of her house is her great dream and hope.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and elastic for her sewing business, as she is a single woman who has to take care of her sick mother.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.fr:
Mme CLAUDINE est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 02ans.02 vont  à l'école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme fait la location des matériels pour les cérémonies (mariage, baptême, funérailles) depuis 04ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s'acheter 01bache et 40chaises pour la location.
Mme veut agrandir son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudine is married and the mother of three. Her eldest child is 12 years old, and the youngest two years old. Two of her children  attend  school. She has six dependents.

Claudine has been selling supplies for formal occasions (weddings, christenings, funerals) for four years. She stocks up at her neighborhood market. She would like to buy one tarp sheet and 40 chairs for renting out. Claudine would like to develop her business thanks to her revenue. Her aspiration is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy a tarp sheet and 40 chairs for renting out.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase housewares for her house.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth es propietaria de una papelería ubicada en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar donde habita con sus dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 24 años. Ella forma parte de un grupo cristiano, en el cual sostiene relaciones con una amplia comunidad, de allí fue donde nació la idea de generar ingresos respondiendo a las necesidades, deseos e intereses de sus porenciales compradores, que hace 2 años se convirtieron en su clientela fija. Hoy tiene un local en su propia vivienda donde en una vitrina exhibe articulos de papeleríoa, y que debe adecuar en cada temporada. Aprovechando que se acerca la época de Diciembre, Yanteh debe ajustarse a la exhibición la cual debe ser consecuente con la papelería navideña, articulos sencillos y económicos que impacten a su clientela, pues los aguinaldos despiertan la necesidad de compra de sus clientes., que son principalmente vecinos del sector donde se encuentra ubicada. Su meta es lograr el crecimeinto de su negocio y apoyar la educación de calidad de sus hijos, aunque su gran desafio sea el no tener recursos suffiente spara lograrlo. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financimeinto que hace ala Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpará  papeleria navideña, globos, escarcha, accesorios femeninos y en general articulos a la medida de la temporada. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, porque venderá mucho mas e incrmentará su rentabilidad sobre las ventas, haciendo  de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Yaneth is the owner of a stationery store located in the city of Cartagena where she lives with her two children who are 20 and 24 years old. She is part of a Christian group which maintains relationships with a broad community. It was there that the idea of generating income by responding to the needs, desires, and interests of their potential customers was born.  Two years ago they became regular customers.

Today she has a shop at her house where she displays stationery items in a showcase. She needs to adapt it to each season. Now that December is approaching, Yaneth must stock up with Christmas stationery; simple and inexpensive items that her clients will want since bonuses awaken their need to go shopping. Her clients are mostly the neighbors from her community.

Her goal is to grow her business and to provide a quality education for her children, but her big challenge is not  having enough money to do this. This is the very reason why she is asking for a KIVA loan which is the first one with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy Christmas stationery, balloons, glitter, women's accessories, and other seasonal items. This investment will allow her business to improve because she will sell  much more and increase her profits, making her KIVA loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy stationery products and general merchandise.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is 32 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. Melvin works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, biscuits, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as rice and frozen goods. 

In the future, Melvin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Maria Veneranda

texts.es: Doña Maria se levanta temprano todas las mañanas para comercializar sus productos a todos los estudiantes que pasan por su pequeño negocio. Esta soltera y es madre de tres jóvenes ya independientes. Algunas veces en su negocio le apoya su hija, y sus otros hijos le apoyan en los gastos de su casa. Requiere el préstamo para comprar Arroz, Azúcar, Aceite, Jabón, Gaseosas y fresquitos. Con este préstamo lograra incrementar su inventario y podrá suplir la demanda de sus clientes. Dentro de su plan futuro esta incrementar el tamaño de su pulpería y lograr ofrecer una amplia variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria gets up early every day to sell her products to all the students who pass by her small business. She is the single mother of three children who are now on their own. Sometimes her daughter helps her with the business and the other children help with household expenses.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, soft drinks, and lollipops. The loan will allow her to increase her inventory and satisfy her client's demand. Her future plans include increasing the size of her store and offering a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, soft drinks, and lollipops.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.en:
Shiringul is married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children. She also supports four members of her family. She has a fabric store and has been in the business for 14 years. This business is the main source of family income. 

This is her fourth loan with IMON INTERNATIONAL, and she plans to use it to purchase more fabrics to sell. Shiringul has successfully repaid her previous loans and her future hopes are to improve business and also improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is 51 years old. She is a higher educated woman. Mahbuba is married and has two adult children. She has worked for more than 25 years in a school. She is an experienced teacher. Mahbuba teaches Russian language and literature. She is a clever woman. Mahbuba’s husband works in a primary organization. They also have grandchildren. 

Mahbuba and her husband try hard for the well-being of their children and grandchildren. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy coal and wood to keep her house warm in the winter season. She really needs to this loan because her grandchildren are little, and she must offer a warm temperature house for them.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood to keep her house warm in the winter season

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.en:
Gulniso is a 47-year-old married mother, and a very enterprising woman. 

For more than 3 years, she has worked in a museum. Her honesty, responsibility and punctuality have been the reasons for her job promotion, and she believes she does well because she always gives the best of herself. 

Gulniso is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their support, she will be able to make improvements to her house, such as painting the walls and repairing the bathroom. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life.

She will continue to work hard to give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 29 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 27 octobre 2007. Les femmes ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Coumba, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont une fille. Elle fait du commerce de vêtements pour enfants. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 03 ans. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de la ville pour les écouler dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Elle achète des habits pour une valeurs globale de 75000 F. Les prix des tenues varient entre 1750, 2000 et 3500 F. Elle les revend au prix de 2500, 3000 et 6000 F.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte acheter un mouton et une chèvre pour les élever et les revendre plus tard mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This 29-member group belongs to the banc villageois which was created on 27th October 2007. The women of this group get along very well. Their main business activities are trading and raising livestock.

Coumba, the woman standing to the far right with her hand raised, is 27 years old. She is a married mother to five children; four sons and one daughter. She earns a living through selling children's clothing, which she has been doing for the past three years. She gets her supplies from the town market and then sells them on at the weekly markets. In total, she spends 75,000 F on children's clothing. The prices of these clothes vary between 1750, 2000 and 3500 F. She then resells these clothes for 2500, 3000 and 6000 F.

With the profits from this loan, she is planning on buying a sheep and a goat which will raise herself and then resell. She will also use the profits to see to her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 37 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il regroupe les femmes du village et des environs. La majeur partie s'active dans le petit commerce et l'embouche.
Sokhna, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont les quatre sont déjà mariés. Actuellement, elle vit avec les quatre autres et a 04 petits fils. Elle fait comme activité de l'embouche et est aidée en cela par son fils. Elle donne l'argent à son fils qui s'approvisionne dans les marché hebdomadaires. Elle va acheter un veau à 150000 F, elle va investir en aliments pour bétail 15000 F par mois et en frais vétérinaires 1750 F. Elle compte revendre entre 300000 et 350000 F. 
Les bénéfices vont compte acheter un autre bœuf pour développer son activité.
texts.en:
This group of 37 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on June 4, 2011. It is composed of women from the village and around it. The main part is active in small-scale commerce and in fattening livestock. 

Sokhna, standing at the right of the photo with a hand raised, is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children, of whom four are already married. Currently, she lives with four others and has four grandchildren. She has a business fattening livestock, and her son helps her with it. She gives money to her son who gets supplies at the weekly market. 

Sokhna is going to purchase a calf at 150,000 francs. She is going to invest in feed at 15,000 francs a month and in veterinary fees at 1,750 francs. She is planning on reselling the livestock at 300,000 to 350,000 francs. The profits are planned for purchasing another head of cattle to develop her business.

loans.use: to fatten livestock

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Speu Province, Nov is 27 years old. 

To earn a living, Nov grows rice. This is her only source of income and earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is Nov's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the group leader of a group of three. 

She will spend her entire loan portion on buying a water filter as she wants her family to have clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

Arlene aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gaudencia Grace

texts.en:
Gaudencia Grace is 49 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Gaudencia Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Gaudencia Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Gaudencia Grace has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, detergent bars, diapers, snack food, canned goods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Gaudencia Grace would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khemesse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 06 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il regroupe des femmes du village et des environs. Elles font du commerce et de l'embouche.
Awa, assise à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles et 04 garçons. L'aîné à 30 ans et le benjamin 20 ans. Elle fait comme activité le commerce. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle achète 150000 F de bissap dont la bassine varie entre 2000 et 2500 F à l'achat et le revente lui revient à 4000 à 5000 F. Du mil à 175000 F dont 150 F le Kg à l'achat et la revente à 200 F le Kg. Du niébé à 95000 F dont le prix varie entre 250 et 300 F le Kg à l'achat et le prix de vente entre 400 et 500 F le Kg.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va acheter des moutons pour renforcer son activité. Dans le passé, elle avait acheté un bœuf.
texts.en:
This group of six members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on June 4, 2011. It is composed of women from the village and around it. The women work in commerce and in fattening livestock. 

Awa, sitting at the right of the photo with a hand raised, is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children (3 girls and 4 boys). The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 20. Her work involves commerce. She gets her supplies from the weekly markets. She purchases 150,000 francs of bissap (dried hibiscus flowers) at 2,000-2,500 francs per tub to resell at 4,000-5,000 francs; 175,000 francs of millet at 150 francs per kilo to resell at 200 francs per kilo; and 9,500 francs of black-eye peas at 250-300 francs per kilo to resell at 400-500 francs per kilo. With the profits, she is going to purchase sheep to bolster her business. In the past, she had purchased a steer.

loans.use: to purchase millet, black-eye peas, and dried hibiscus flowers

loans.name: Ayudemonos Group

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de desayuno.
Ella es responsable, emprendedora, buena madre, luchadora y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ una zona caracterizada por el crecimiento poblacional, migrantes del lugar de la tribu ‘Ayorea’ y mineros relocalizados de occidente, realizan el creciente comercio. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Judith es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (tercera de la izquierda, usa blusa azul con flores blancas). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos, ambos estudian en la escuela, toda la familia vive en un cuarto propio que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. La necesidad por cumplir sus metas la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de desayuno; cada mañana ella se encarga de visitar a todos los comerciantes en su puesto de trabajo para dejarles su desayuno que consiste en tojori (leche con maíz), acompañado de cuñapes (pan de queso) ó zonzo (yuca con queso), entre otros. Su sueño es llegar a tener su propio snack y variar toda clase de desayunos para la venta. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una cocina, mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes en su lugar de trabajo. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que lleva realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Judith solicita un préstamo para la compra de cocina, mesas y sillas para vender desayuno en su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Judith, 32, lives with her companion.  She has two children, ages 15 and 7, and her business is selling breakfast.  She's responsible, enterprising, persevering, and hardworking, and a good mother.

She carries out her business in the Plan 3000 zone, an area known for population growth.  Migrants from the area of the Ayorea people and miners relocated from the western region are responsible for the commercial growth.  The area has a warm and humid tropical climate with a constant temperature of 30 degrees centigrade throughout the year.  

Judith is dark and of average height, and she wears her black hair long (third woman from the left, wearing a blue blouse with white flowers).  Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish.  She lives with her partner, who earns a living in construction, and her children, both of whom attend school.  The entire family lives in their own room, with potable water and electricity.

The need to achieve her goals led Judith to form a bank with people who have businesses--such as a neighborhood store, a butcher shop, sandwich sales, plaster crafts, soft drink sales, a bookstore, and clothing sales--to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Judith's business is selling breakfast.  Every morning she visits all the business owners where they work to leave them a breakfast consisting of "tojori" (milk with corn) with "cuñapes" (cheese bread) or "zonzo" (yuca with cheese), among other dishes.  Her dream is to have her own snack stand and sell all types of breakfast.

She wants to expand her business by buying a stove, tables, and chairs to serve her customers where they work.  This is her second loan sequence in the three years she has had this business.

For those reasons Judith is requesting a loan to buy a stove, tables, and chairs to sell breakfast in the workplace.

loans.use: to buy a stove, tables, and chairs to sell breakfast

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Roselyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenepher

texts.en:
Jenepher is 24 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in school. Jenepher works very hard to provide for them.

Jenepher runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Jenepher has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Jenepher would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from a cafeteria. 

Loreta requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. She hopes to save enough money for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Geleceria is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a fishing business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending.  

Gleceria requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, soap, pasta, oil, beverages, paper and candy to stock her store

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es: Robinson de 69 años de edad es el propietario de un taller de reparación de electrodomésticos, ubicado en Soledad , el cual inició su funcionamiento e el año 2010, cuando recibió su pensión de jubilación y decidió continuar de manera independiente aprovechando su capacidad técnica y habilidades en el campo eléctrico; sus taller abre las puertas de  lunes a sábados, en los horarios de 9 a 7 de la noche; los repuestos para el mantenimiento y reparación de artículos los compra en almacenes especializados donde encuentra precios que le facilitan el ser competitivo. Sus clientes, quienes son sus vecinos del barrio,  llevan a su taller abanicos, lavadoras, planchas, y en general electrodomésticos menores, para aumentar la vida útil de estos artefactos. En la actualidad Robinson está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos de electrodomésticos en mayor volumen, con esta inversión tendrá un mayor inventario de repuestos, que son los insumos que utiliza Robinson para hacer su trabajo con excelencia y aumentar las posibilidades de aumentar el volumen de su clientela, incrementar sus utilidades y resolver el desafío de ofrecer, cada vez más, una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Robinson is 69 years old and is the owner of an electrical appliance repair workshop located in Soledad. He started the workshop in 2010, when he received his retirement pension and decided to independently continue taking advantage of his technical abilities in electronics. 

His workshop is open Monday through Saturday from 9 AM to 7 PM. He buys the replacement parts for the maintenance and repair of items in specialty stores, where he finds prices that let him be competitive. His customers, who are his neighbors from the neighborhood, bring fans, washing machines, irons, and small electrical appliances in general to increase the shelf life of the devices. 

Currently, Robinson is applying for a Kiva loan – the first loan that he requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo – with which he will buy replacement parts for electrical appliances in greater volume. With this investment he will have a larger inventory of replacement parts, which are the supplies that Robinson uses to do his work with excellence. This will give him more opportunities to increase his customer volume, grow his utility, and overcome the challenge of continuously offering a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for electrical appliances in greater volume.

loans.name: Kimleang's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Speu Province, Kimleang is 43 years old and a mother of five children. She earns an income to support her family through rice cropping. 

This is Kimleang's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of two to get a loan, and she will spend her loan portion on buying a water filter. 

She hopes that with this her family can live in a healthier way than before.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Oisara

texts.en:
Oisara is widowed and has three children. She lives in the north part of Tajikistan. She sells children clothes in a store in a local market, which she has been doing for 15 years. She has regular customers, thanks to her good work and responsibility. 

Oisara requested a loan for 3,000 Somoni, which she will use to buy children clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: to purchase children clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 47 years old, married and had four children. She sells rice within her locality. Merlita also cultivates her half hectare of rice field.

Merlita plans to purchase four sacks of rice to sell, but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She knows that this amount of loan will enable her to increase her sales and income.

Merlita is looking forward for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is 48 years old and has two children in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Julieta has been in this business for three years and is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more fish to sell to customers. Julieta would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Conrada works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Conrada is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish for retailing for her fish-vending business.

Conrada has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish for retailing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more men's  and women's wear for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 35 years old and married with one child in school. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia de 33 años , habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 7 años,  en unade las ciudade Colombia: Cartagena de Indias, ubicada a orillas del mar Caribe. Hace 4 años, estudiando la necesidad del sector donde habita,  decidió dedicarse al comercio de ropa, calzado, perfumería, accesorios femeninos etc., vendiendo de contado y a crédito, durante todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, comprando de contado en almacenes del mercado de la ciudad, que le ofrecen precios competitivos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio peo su mayor desafío es lograr recuperar la cartera de cuentas por cobrar de manera tan oportuna como lo requiere el servicio que debe prestar a su cliente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  perfumes, desodorantes, pulseras, calzado, cremas y artículos de aseo personal en general. Con esta inversión sus invedes más lindas ntarios se incrementarán y esto es justamente lo que marcará el mejoramiento de su negocio, pues a partir de ello, quiere incrementar la calidad en la educación  de sus hijos que es una de sus más anhelados sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 33, lives with her spouse and her two children, ages 3 and 7, in Cartagena de Indias, a city located on the shores of the Caribbean Ocean in Colombia.

Four years ago, having examined the needs of the area where she lives, she decided to earn a living selling clothing, footwear, perfume, women's accessories, and so forth.  She sells in cash and on credit every day from 8 in the morning until 8 in the evening.  She buys in cash from stores in the market in her city, where she gets competitive prices.

Her goal is to expand her business, but her biggest challenge is being able to recover her investment by charging in a timely manner, as her customer service requires.  This is why she's requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy perfume, deodorant, watches, footwear, creams, and a variety of personal care products.

The investment will expand her inventory.  This is precisely what will mark the improvement of her business, with which she wants to improve the quality of her children's education--one of her most desired dreams for prosperity.

loans.use: to buy perfume, deodorant, bracelets, footwear, creams, and personal care products

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es: Norlan es de la comunidad La Joya-Teustepe, está casado es de oficio agricultor. Todas las mañanas Norlan se levanta para dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y frijol. Solicita el crédito para pagar la limpieza de dos manzanas de tierra donde piensa cultivar frijol de apante también para comprar los insumos abono y pagar la mano de obra de todo el trabajo de siembra. Norlan dice que el crédito será de mucho apoyo ya que en este momento todavía no se ha sacado la cosecha de postrera del frijol y por lo cual necesita este crédito.  También nos cuenta que quizás después que cancele este crédito obtendrá uno nuevo para comprar dos terneras para crianza las cuales le traerán buenos beneficios.
texts.en: Norlan, from La Joya-Teustepe, is married and operates a farming business.  He grows maize and beans.  He is applying for a loan that he will use for his next planting.  He will buy fertilizer and other supplies and pay the labor he needs to carry out the work.  Norlan says that the loan will help him a lot because he hasn't yet harvested his last bean crop.  Once he repays this loan, he will apply for another to buy two calves, an investment that will bring him big benefits.

loans.use: to plant his next bean crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large volume of palm oil to resell in order to increase his earnings.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 29 years old and married. She lives in the Gurjaani district, Kakheti region. She lives with her husband and pensioner parents-in-law. Her husband drives a minibus and generates small monthly income. Lali works at local pharmacy. 

As the existing income is not enough to cover every day costs, Lali decided to start an additional business to increase family income. She requested a loan from the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, for 2,000 GEL, which she will use to purchase a stock of clothes and linens to sell at higher price. Lali will be able to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes and linens

loans.name: Maybele Group

texts.en:
Maybele is a group of three energetic Filipino citizens, who left their home country to work as housekeepers in Lebanon to improve their families' living situations.

Helen is the featured borrower of Maybell group, who decided, with the other group members, to join together and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop both their living and businesses in a well-managed way.

Helen is a 39-year-old divorced mother of two children, who left her beloved children in the Philippines and came to work as a housekeeper to provide them with the necessary education and living needs. Because of her limited monthly income, and since her children's living expenses are increasing, Helen decided to start her own business, so that she can benefit from an additional income, to make sure she can develop her family's living situation.

Her acquired loan will be invested in starting her own makeup and mobile phone prepaid cards sales business, in addition to her current housekeeping job. She is the first lady on the far right side of the picture with a yellow top, while Emilie is the lady in the center and Zeraida is the first from the left.

loans.use: To start her own makeup and  mobile phone prepaid cards sales business, in addition to her current housekeeping job

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 58-year-old married father of three children, a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, Ahmad is working hard to provide his family with better living conditions.
He is the sole earner of his family. Two years ago he started transporting people in an attempt to increase his income and improve his living.
Today, Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field Al Majmoua to renovate his house to make it a healthier place for his family, especially before the coming autumn and winter seasons. 
He hopes to expand his business more in the future to keep his family satisfied.

loans.use: to renovate his house to make it a healthier place for his family, especially before the coming autumn and winter seasons.

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif is 45 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. His wife is ill and can not work. He lives in Abeshron region with his family but for over 22 years they are IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Agdam City. He has been a truck driver for over 21 years. Vasif engages in transporting sand, gravel, stone, etc. with his truck. 

Vasif requested a loan for 1,350 AZN, which he will use to repair his truck tires so he can continue to work.

loans.use: to repair his truck tires

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: A finales de año, la venta de ropa y los servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, usualmente se incrementan, porque hay más dinero circulante, mayor número de visitas, procedentes  de otros lugares llega a los hogares y  muchas fiestas y celebraciones, grados, matrimonios, primeras comuniones, celebraciones navideñas y despedida de año que finaliza e inicio del nuevo año. Esta es la razón por la cual Cindy, debe estar preparada en capacidad física y de respuesta para generar más ingresos y aprovechar el impulso de las ventas de temporada. Cindy es una mujer de  xx años, que inició su negocio hace 3 años, con el fin de genera ingresos y apoyar la gestión de proveedor de su esposo, quien anteriormente trabajaba él solo, en beneficio de su familia.  Cuando Cindy inició su negocio lo hizo de manera incipiente, hoy ha agregado, dulcería, ropa y venta de refrigerio a su antiguo servicio de alquiler de lavadoras. Su meta de crecimiento no se detiene, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa solicitada por su clientela  y 2 lavadoras más, pues sus clientes muchas veces se van sin recibir este servicio. Con esta inversión ampliará el número de clientes y responderá de manera efectiva a la necesidad de ventas que generan más ingresos y por ello su negocio mejorará notablemente.
texts.en: Clothing sales and washer rentals normally increase at the end of the year because there is more money around, more family get-togethers and a general air of good cheer.  Cindy hopes to make the most of the increase in demand to grow her clothing sales and machine rental business.  She started the business 3 years ago because she wanted to help her husband with the family's household expenses.  Cindy started with very little but has grown her business from only renting washing machines to renting refrigerators, as well, and selling clothing and other merchandise.  She is just as ambitious for the future and is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan in order to buy 2 new washers and clothing for which she already has orders.  The investment will allow her to draw in more customers, grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy 2 washers for machinery rental business.

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 33 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il regroupe les femmes du village et des environs. Elles s'activent dans le petit commerce et l'embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle fait comme activité le commerce de mil et de niébé. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. En parallèle, elle fait de l'embouche. Elle compte acheter pour 125000 F de mil à savoir entre 150 et 175 F le prix d'achat du Kg, revendu entre 225 et 250 F le KG. 25000 F pour l'achat de niébé détaillé comme suit 150 à 175 F le Kg revendu entre 250 et 350 F. Elle va aussi acheter un mouton pour une valeur de 25000 F qu'elle compte revendre entre 40000 et 50000 F. Les 25000 F qui vont rester du financement lui serviront de fonds de roulement et à l'achat d'aliments pour bétail.
Les bénéfices vont servir à acheter des moutons ou un bœuf qu'elle va remettre à ses enfants qui vont se charger de les mener en pâturage.
texts.en:
This group of 33 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on June 4, 2011. It is composed of women from the village and around it. The women work in small-scale commerce and in fattening livestock. Fatou, standing at the right of the photo with a hand raised, is 49 years old. She is married and the mother of five children, including three girls. 

Her work involves commerce in millet and black-eye peas. She gets her supplies from the weekly markets. She intends to purchase 125,000 francs of millet at 150-175 francs per kilo to resell at 225–250 francs per kilo; and 25,000 francs of black-eye peas at 150-175 francs per kilo to be resold at 250-350 francs. She is also going to purchase a head of sheep at 25,000 francs that she plans on selling at 40,000-50,000 francs. 

The remaining 25,000 francs of the loan will used as working capital and for animal feed. The profits will be used to purchase sheep or cattle that she will turn over to her children, who are responsible for taking them out to pasture.

loans.use: to purchase millet and black-eye peas

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi jeune fille de 21ans se bat pour assurer son bien être. Pour cela, elle revend des pagnes au bord de la route et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, madame Afi demande un premier à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. A l'avenir, elle souhaite développer son activité et assurer sa santé. Elle a démarré en 2012.
texts.en: Afi is a young 21-year-old girl who is working hard to ensure her well-being. In order to do this, she sells pagnes (high colourful and decorative West African clothing) at the roadside and gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. As the end-of-year festivities approach, Afi is requesting a first loan from WAGES in order to be able to satisfy her customer demand. In the future, she would like to expand her business and ensure her health. She started her business in 2012.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Patman

texts.en:
Patman is 32 years old, widowed, and has four children. She lives in Zugdidi district. Her children receive a small orphan pension from the government.  Patman works as a baker and earns a small monthly income, which is not enough to cover every day costs. 

Patman decided to start an additional business and requested a loan from the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, for $2,000, which she will use to purchase clothes to sell. This loan will give her a chance to increase her income and improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Hanh
