texts.en: Mrs. Hanh  is 49 years old .There are seven people in her family. Cultivation and husbandry are her main income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family’s member, especially the kids.  She has daily income from garden such as vegetable, chicken and pig.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en: Mrs. Thinh  is 50 years old. She is married and has four children, three of them have a job. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family. Her income is mainly from farming  so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is 45 years old. There are four people in her family.Fishing and husbandry are main income source of her family. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from selling fish, which her husband caught. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Mrs. Le is a hardworking woman, 51 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without hygienic latrine. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. She is able to repay the loan monthly from her small business.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en: Mrs. Nhu is a hardworking woman, 27 years old. She is married and has a baby. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing  so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Villa Union Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de cinco años y su negocio es la venta de ropa, juguetes y productos de temporada.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable y buena madre. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’, caracterizada por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas de clima tropical, húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Guadalupe es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo crespo, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español (de pie blusa animal print). Su vida la realiza con su hijo que todavía no esta en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia de la familia construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Sus deseo de superación la impulsaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, tejido a máquina, venta de accesorios de celulares, venta de muebles, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero y venta de salteñas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, juguetes y productos de temporada de forma ambulante en ferias y mercados. Ella vende productos según la temporada, por ejemplo; en época navideña compra juguetes, adornos navideños, árboles de navidad, luces, etc., por mayor para ofertarlos en las ferias y mercados, pasada esa fecha realiza compras para las fiestas de carnaval como; disfraces, globos de agua, pistolas de agua, en ambas fechas también ropa. Su marketing ronda según la fecha y la fiesta. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda en un lugar fijo y comercial para ya no seguir ambulando, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de mercadería (juguetes y ropa) para ofertarlos antes de las fiestas de fin de año y continuar con su actividad. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Guadalupe solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y juguetes de temporada para ofertarlos en las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a 41-year-old, single woman who has a five-year-old son. Her business is the sale of clothes, toys, and seasonal products.

She is independent, entrepreneurial, hardworking, responsible, and a good mother. She conducts her business in the “plan 3000” area, known for its growing commerce in all areas. The area has rainy, tropical weather and a constant temperature of 30°C [86°F] throughout the whole year.

Guadalupe is dark-skinned, medium-statured, and has long, curly, black hair and a robust physique. Her native language is Quechua and she speaks Spanish. In the photo, she is standing and wearing an animal print blouse. She shares her life with her son who is not in school yet. They live in their own family house, made of brick, and they have potable water and electricity. 

Her desire for self-improvement motivated her to form a group of people with businesses such as: selling empanadas, cosmetics trade, selling seasonal clothes, machine knitting, selling cell phone accessories, selling furniture, selling quilts, making leather purses, and selling meat pies. She formed this group to request a loan and improve the group’s activities. 

Her business is the sale of clothes, toys, and seasonal products. She sells them as a street vendor in fairs and markets. She sells products according to the season. For example, in the Christmas season she buys toys, Christmas ornaments, Christmas trees, lights, etc. on wholesale to sell them in the fairs and markets. After Christmas, she buys things for the Carnaval celebrations such as costumes, water balloons, and water guns. In both seasons she sells clothes. Her marketing revolves around the date and the holiday.

Her dream is to have her own store in a fixed, commercial location so that she can stop moving around. She wants to buy merchandise (toys and clothes) on wholesale to offer them for sale before the New Year and continue to her business. This is the second sequence of loans she has had with the institution in the 15 years that she has been in this occupation.

It is for these reasons that Guadalupe is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothes and toys to sell them during the New Year’s celebrations.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes and toys to sell them during the New Year’s celebrations.

loans.name: Karen Joy

texts.en: Karen Joy is 18 years old and from Baggao, Cagayan. She is taking up a BS in Information Technology. Her family earns income from their sari sari store. With the little income they earn, her parents find it difficult to make ends meet. That’s why she wants to avail herself of a 10,000 PHP education loan to help her parents. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan, for she knows that her parents can’t provide for all her needs.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Depuis 2005, madame Akouvi revend des vêtements et chaussures pour enfants au marché. Son premier crédit lui permettra d'acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère agrandir l'activité et assurer l'auto-suffisance alimentaire de la famille. Elle a 02 enfants de 23 et 16ans en charge.
texts.en: Akouvi has been selling clothing and shoes for children at the market since 2005. Her first loan will enable her to buy more merchandise so that she can reply to her customers' needs. She hopes to expand her business and to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency. She is responsible for 2 children aged 23 and 16.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for children.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 40 years old and single. He is a Palestinian refugee, who has been living and working in a Palestinian camp with limited access to several working sectors and domains. Two years ago he started providing several NGOs working with Syrian refugees with clothes, which was his first step towards starting his own clothing business. He got a lot experience in this area and made a lot of connections with several wholesale traders to benefit from better prices and quality.

Mohamad is suffering from the limited number of customers inside the camp, which he wants to increase through diversifying his products with different winter designs and collections, especially for the coming Christmas season. He is requesting his second loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to purchase a new winter collection of clothes. He hopes to continue developing his business and expanding it through diversifying his products and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter collection of clothes

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Mrs. Oanh is 26 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them .Small business is the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is 29 years old, married and has four children, all of them are schooling. She works very hard to feed &education her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from husbandry.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Mrs. Minh is a hardworking woman, 27 years old. She is married and has a baby. She has operated a clothes selling business for 5 years. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living condition and health for her family, especially her children. Her income is mainly from business and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong is a hardworking woman, 34 years old. She is married and has three children. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is mainly from business so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is a hardworking woman, 29 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in a small house and without hygienic latrine. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 50 years old and has one child. She lives with her son and pensioner mother-in-law in Tskaltubo district. Liza owns two cows, which she milks every day and produces dairy products to sell locally. This is the only source of income for her family. 

Liza decided to start an additional business and and requested a loan from the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, for 2,400 GEL, which she will use to purchase a stock of shoes to sell among her villagers at higher price. This loan will give her a chance to increase her family income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of shoes to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ester works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ester is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits for retailing for her fruit-vending business.

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for retailing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Mraia de 60 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y tien dos hijos adultos. Ella para beneficiar los iongresos de su hogar cuenta con un negocio mediante el cual comercializa ropa a la medida de las solicitudes de su clientela y del requerimiento de la temporada, desde hace 2 años,  cuando sus hijas empezaron a apoyarla con un capital semilla, para que iniciara una actividad generadora de ingresos, aprovechando que Maria siempre ha dsisfrutado de ser comerciante.  En su vivienda tiene una vitrina en la que exhibe productos de papaelería, accesorios, femeninos, bolsas, de regalo cartulina y ofrece tambien el servicio de fotocopiaje, Todos sus articulos los vende de contado , en la jornada de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche durante todos los dias de la semana. Sus vecinos son sus principales clientes y de ellos y sus necesidades y deseos está pendiente para invertir y ofrecer en sus inventarios lo que impacta la decisión de compras. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crdikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa alusiva a la temporada y dar respuesta a sus solicitudes de pedidos. Con ello incrmentará sus ventas porque su clientela esta´ra pendiente de lo que llega al negocio de Maria en este periodo, para de inmediato comprarlo y con ello Maria generará muchos mas ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 60, lives with her husband and two adult children.  She has operated a retail sales business for 2 years.  Her daughters provided seed money for the business.  She has a display case in her house where she displays her merchandise.  She also provides photocopier services.  She sells all her products for cash.  She works from 8 in the morning to 8 in the evening, every day of the week.  Her neighbors are her main customers and she buys the products that they most ask for.  Maria is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that she will use to meet local demand for seasonal clothing.  The investment will allow her to increase her sales because her customers are depending on her to provide the merchandise they want.

loans.use: to stock her retail sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Mico Salasala Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her mid-forties, is married with four children; one of them is still in school, and three are grown-ups. She has been running a business of selling traditional chicken for one year now. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Amina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy traditional chicks and chicken feed. She dreams of improving her lifestyle.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group "Mico Salasala", which has a total of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone credit, prepaid charge cards and smart cards for mobile phones.

loans.name: Fatou Ngom's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 27 octobre 2007. Les femmes de ce BV font de l'embouche et du commerce et on une très bonne relation.
Astou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle fait du commerce de légumes au marché du village. Elle va acheter un demi sac de choux à 10000 F, 01 sac de manioc à 12000 F; patate 5500 F; poivron 2 Kg à 2000 F; piment 1 Kg à 1500 F; aubergine à 2500 F. Le reste lui sert de fonds de roulement. Ces articles, elle va les revendre au détail sur la place du marché du village.
Avec les bénéfices générés, elle compte acheter des moutons pour faire de l'embouche.
texts.en:
This group of 21 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on October 27, 2007. The women of this BV fatten livestock and do commerce, and they get along very well. Astou, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 27 years old. She is a married mother of six children, including three girls. She does commerce in vegetables at the village market. 

She is going to purchase a half-sack of cabbage for 10,000 francs; a sack of cassava for 12,000 francs; some sweet potatoes for 5,500 francs; 2 kg of bell peppers for 2,000 francs; a kilo of chili peppers for 1,500 francs; and some eggplant for 2,500 francs. The rest will be used as working capital. These items will be sold retail locally at the village market. With the profits generated, she is planning on purchasing some sheep to fatten.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is from Kamenka. He is 36 and is married with two children. Alexei owns a lot of land in town, and he built 7 big spacious greenhouses on his property. A few of them have heating systems. Alexei grows predominantly tomatoes and cucumbers. 

Alexei used to be carefree when he was younger. He was married and had a son. However, he couldn't make a living and eventually got divorced. When Alexei got married for the second time and started his greenhouse business, he changed radically – he works hard and takes good care of his first child and his younger daughter. Recently he constructed a small playground with a slide in the yard for her. 

Recently Alexei bought additional 7 acres of land from his neighbors. Sensing the potential to grow his business, he now wants to construct two additional greenhouses on his new piece of land and install heating in them right away. The amount he is requesting to implement the project is 40,000 UAH..

loans.use: to construct two additional greenhouses on his new piece of land and install heating in them.

loans.name: Salustiano

texts.es: Salustiano es originario de la comunidad del rancho se dedica a cultivar Maíz, Frijol y Trigo aunque su actividad principal ha sido el cuido de ganado de ordeño. Don Salustiano en su crédito anterior que obtuvo fue para comprar dos terneros para engordarlos también para comprar un insumo que utilizaría para la siembra del maíz, este crédito que le fue de mucho provecho ya que obtuvo un poco de ganancia con la venta de los terneros de engorde así como también obtuvo buena cosecha de maíz. Don Salustiano necesita otro crédito ya que quiere comprar cuatro terneras de desarrollo que le están vendiendo y así aumentar su hato de ganado ya que actualmente ordeña 9 vacas y lo que él quiere es irlas reproduciendo. Luego que cancele este crédito quizás obtenga un nuevo crédito para mejorar los potreros de la finca.
texts.en: Salustiano grows maize, beans and wheat.  His main source of income, though, is dairy farming.  Don Salustiano received a past loan, part of which he used to buy two calves and the rest to buy farming supplies for his maize crop.  The investment paid off: he sold the calves and harvested his crop at a profit.  Don Salustiano needs another loan that he will use to buy four young calves.  He has 9 cows now and the calves will eventually support his dairy business.  Once he repays this loan, he hopes to apply for another to grow his farming business.

loans.use: to buy calves for livestock business.

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en: As a married parent of 3 children, Mary-Ann works hard to support her family. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.  Mary-Ann is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more supplies for her manicure and pedicure business. Mary-Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Patirisha

texts.en:
Patirisha is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Patirisha would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Patirisha can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Patirisha, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is an agricultural entrepreneur from Bolshaya Kardashinka. He has been running his greenhouse business for about 20 years now. On his 0.35 hectares of land he grows early and late crop vegetables – tomatoes and cucumbers.

Ivan is planning to invest 40,000 UAH in the purchase and installation of a heating system and construction of an additional greenhouse. 

Ivan is ambitious and full of energy – he is hoping to continue expanding and developing his business in the future, re-investing his income in further growth of his greenhouses and sales of grown produce.

loans.use: to purchase and install a heating system and construct an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Yarelys

texts.es:
La señora Yarelys es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica al comercio,  sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio propio que consiste en venta de tajaditas al mayor y por menor, actividad que realiza en su domicilio y también vende de manera ambulante.
Doña Yarelys cuenta con 6 años de experiencia y sus  ventas las realiza de lunes a sábados de cada semana, sus clientes son personas que tienen negocios como pulperías, mercaditos, etc. esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de plátanos verdes, bananos, bolsas, aceite, sal, etc. que son la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar las tajaditas que luego distribuye, con esta inversión espera que su venta aumente al tener suficiente producto y asi poder salir adelante con su familia. 
Uno de sus sueños es que su negocio sea uno de los más reconocidos de la zona y que su familia este bien.


Danlí, Honduras – Octubre del 2014
texts.en:
Yarelys is an enterprising woman who works in trade. She makes a living from her own business which consists in the sale of  fried plantain, both wholesale and retail, from her home and as street trade.

Yarelys has six years of experience and she works from Monday to Saturday every week. Her clients are people who have their own businesses like grocery stores, small markets etc.  

She is asking for the loan to buy green bananas, bananas, bags, oil, salt etc. which are the ingredients which she uses to make the fried plantain which she then sells.

She hopes that, with this investment, she will have sufficient products to increase sales and thereby get ahead with her family. One of her dreams is that her business will be one of the most well recognised in the area and that her family are well.


Danlí, Honduras – Octubre del 2014

loans.use: to buy green bananas,, bananas, bags, oil, salt etc. for her business.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives and runs her farming business in the village of Kardashinka. She is married with grown children. 

Irina owns a few greenhouses on 15 ares of land. Irina has been in this business for 13 years. She grows cucumbers, tomatoes and pepper for sale. 

She is planning to invest the funds she receives from Kiva in the construction of new greenhouses to replace the old collapsing ones. She is also hoping to build an additional greenhouse on an available piece of land.  Irina is hoping to receive 35 000 UAH from Kiva for these purposes.

loans.use: to build new greenhouses to replace the old collapsing ones and to build an additional greenhouse on an available piece of land.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria operates a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Victoria requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Aleksey

texts.en:
Aleksey is 39 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his family and retired mother in the house build by his father in Ddmashen of the Gegharkunik region. He has a farm where he takes care of two cows, a calf, a bull, and 20 chickens. On his plot of land, he cultivates potatoes, which, along with milk, are the main products that he sells from his farm. Aleksey sells his potatoes to re-sellers. The autumn-winter seasons are the best periods for sales, since people buy a large number of potatoes to store for the whole winter.

Aleksey is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase potato seedlings since in his region all farmers stock these vegetable seeds beforehand for spring sowing. At this time, potato seedlings are cheaper and more available for farmers like Aleksey.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings

loans.name: Yeimy

texts.es: Yeimy, una habitante de un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, tiene 23 años de edad y junto con su hermano tienen una microempresa de productos alimenticios elaborados a base de maíz precocido.  Ellos elaboran por paquetes arepas rellenas, caribañolas de queso y carne, picadas para eventos, y deditos. Este negocio empezó a funcionar hace un año y siete meses,  con tanto éxito que Yeimy quien trabajaba en una empresa decidió dedicarse únicamente al negocio puesto que ella contrato a un empleado cuando estaba prestando sus servicios en aquella empresa pero no obtuvo los resultados esperados,  fue desde entonces que todos sus esfuerzos se han visto acoplados en este negocio. Yeimy tiene su capital aparte del de su hermano, ellos se organizaron de ese modo. Las ventas las realizan a crédito o contado puerta a puerta y también a distribuidores, en el horario de lunes a sábado de 6a.m. a 10p.m. Las compras las realiza a almacenes, distribuidores de productos especializados.En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adquirir una amasadora, una mesa de empaque  e insumos, que repercutirá en aumentar su capacidad de producción y con ello un incremento en sus ventas y ganancias.  Yeimy tiene unas  metas para cumplir con sus propósitos de crecimiento personal ella a futuro desea independizar y formalizar su negocio, y abrir nuevos mercados y tener otros puntos de atención.
texts.en:
Yeimy lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla. She is 23 years old and has a micro business with her brother in which they make food products from precooked maize. They make packaged,stuffed arepas, and yucca fritters stuffed with cheese and meat which are bite-size for parties and events. They started this business one year and seven months ago and it was so successful that Yeimy decided to leave her job and do this full-time. She had an employee while she was at her other job but this was not working out so well so she decided to focus all her efforts on this business. 

Yeimy's capital is separate from her brother's; they organized the business in this way. Sales are made door-to-door on credit or for cash, and sometimes they sell to distributors too. Their hours are from Monday through Saturday from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. They buy their supplies from stores that are distributors of specialized products. 

She is currently applying for a KIVA loan which is her first one with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy a kneading machine, a packing table, and supplies which will help to increase production capacity and thereby increase sales and earnings.  Yeimy has some goals to achieve in her intention to grow personally. She hopes to become independent in the future and formalize her business, opening new markets and focusing on additional aspects of the business.

loans.use: to buy a kneading machine, a packing table, and supplies.

loans.name: Keila

texts.es: Keila de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares y ofrece servicios técnicos inherentes a ello desde hace 14 años, pues aprendió de su esposo que es experto en el mantenimiento de  equipos celulares y entre los dos decidieron iniciar su negocio. Su meta mas adelante, es tener un almacén de mayor tamaño y comprar una vivienda  para aumentar su bienestar y el de su familia. En sus inventarios Keila exhibe celulares protectores y ofrece el servicio de impresión y fotocopiajes. Sus principales clientes están ubicados alrededor de su barrio y son vecinos y familiares que por allí se concentran. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es lograr la plena satisfacción de su clientela y para ello requiere actualizar sus inventarios, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año que llega con muchas fiestas; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios de celulares, celulares modernos, protectores, screen etc. Con esta inversión logrará tener en su oferta nuevos modelos de celulares, que son muy  solicitados por su clientela especialmente por los jóvenes, haciendo que su credikiva mejore así su negocio.
texts.en: Keila, 28, has operated a business selling cell phone services and accessories for 14 years.  Her husband knows the business and the two of them started the business together.  For the future, Keila wants to open a larger store and buy a house.  She sells cell phone accessories and provides photocopying services.  She draws her customers from the local neighborhood.  Her main challenge is meeting the needs of her customers.  She says that demand will be especially high over the coming holiday season and she wants to stock her business with the products that her customers most want.  She will use this Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan to buy cell phone accessories, the newest-model cell phones and other related merchandise.  The investment will allow her to grow her business.

loans.use: to support her phone services business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Tuguegarao City, Cagayan. She operates a sari sari store and her husband is a tricycle driver. Even though both parents are earning an income, it is sometimes not enough to meet the needs of their children and their daily expenditures. 

Marilou requested a loan for 200,000 PHP, which she will use to help send their daughter to college The education loan will pay for her tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Mushkinisoi

texts.ru: Мушкинисои 22 летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она не замужем. Мушкинисои живет вместе с мамой. Она не имела возможности окончить среднюю школу, и была вынуждена бросить учебу, чтобы работать для улучшения условия их работы. Мушкинисои пару лет назад решилась научиться шить. Она записалась в ученицы в одном из ателье города. Мушкинисои научилась шить и кроить женские платья. Уже 2 года она самостоятельно берет заказы на шитье платьев. Мушкинисои хочет купить новую швейную машинку. Она уверена, что с новой машинкой она будет работать гораздо быстрее и удовольствие от работы она получить больше. С такими намерениями она смело обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите ее!
texts.en: Mushkinisoi is a 22-year-old resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is not married. Mushkinisoi lives together with her mother. She did not have an opportunity to complete secondary school and had to abandon her studies in order to work and improve her conditions. Mushkinisoi decided to start sewing a couple of years ago. She enrolled to be a student at one of the city's ateliers. Mushkinisoi learned how to cut and sew women's dresses. She has been independently accepting order for sewing dresses for 2 years already. Mushkinisoi wants to purchase a new sewing machine. She is convinced that she will work a lot faster and get more satisfaction from her work with a new sewing machine. With these intentions, she bravely requested a loan. Please support her!

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to continue her business

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Wakoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de tubercules et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente DIOMINE, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de tubercules. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’ignames chez les grossistes à Dioïla. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri Group is made up of married women. The average age of each group member is 34 years old and on average each member has three children. They all live within traditional family frameworks in the village of Wakoro in Dioïla Cercle, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They make a living through selling cereals, condiments, tubers and various other items. This will be the fourth group loan for the women of Tiessiri Group. In order satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Diomine, the woman sitting second from the left in the first row, is illiterate. She currently earns a living from selling tubers. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing sacks of yams from the wholesalers in Dioïla. She will then sell them at market and out of her own home to a mixed customer base. She plans on making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will go towards paying for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase tubers (yams)

loans.name: Yabom

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Yabom. She is married and has three children aged 23, 21 and 10 years. In 2004, Yabom established her used clothes ("junks") business. She began her business because she had no formal education, so she decided to do business to keep the family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business.

Yabom would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy bales of used clothes to increase her profit. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Yabom plans to open another big shop to attract more profits. She is very serious and committed. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to increase her profit.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old, married, and has children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Gloria requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Manuel Evaristo

texts.es: Patacones, frituras, chorizos, carnes y bebidas, son los productos que vende Manuel desde hace 11 años, atendiendo su impetu natural como comerciante, que lo guió a emprender su propia aventura organizando en un local la venta de productos alimenticios, mente los cuales,  ofrecer diversas alternativas de consumo de productos rapidamente preparados. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y trabaja de lunes a sabados en un horario que inica desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 12 de la noche. Sus princiaples clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, que dia a dia, se acercan a sus instalaciones para consumir los deliciosos productos, que con sus manos prepara. Su meta es lograr aun mas reconocimiento y su gran desafio, es la gran informalidad que prevalece en el sector donde habita. Las condiciones de su negocio necesitan ser mejoradas y por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financieminto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará sillas, mesas, una estufa e insumos, con esta inversión su negocio tendrá una buena presentación, lo cual impulsará sus ventas, que es el propósito de Manuel para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel has sold "patacones" [fried plantains], fried food, chorizo, meat, and beverages for 11 years.  Taking advantage of his natural impetus as a merchant led him to start his own venture.  He sells food in a retail space, offering a variety of alternatives of fast food.

He makes sales in cash, working from Monday through Saturday from 8 in the morning until 12 midnight.  His main customers are his neighbors and friends who go to his facilities every day to eat the delicious food he makes himself from scratch.

Manuel's goal is to earn even more recognition.  His biggest challenge is the extensive unreliability that prevails in the area where he lives.

Manuel needs to improve his business conditions, so he's applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He's going to buy tables, chairs, a stove, and ingredients.  With this investment his business will have a good appearance, thus driving his sales, which is Manuel's goal for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, a stove, and food supplies

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
"Rebecca is 45 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rebecca has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she describes her last harvest as good, she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rebecca also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Rebecca's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 58 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Pedrita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, shampoo, etc.

Pedrita has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Pedrita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 41 years old and has one child in school.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Dedoplistskaro district, Kakheti region. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two hectares of land, where they grow wheat. 

Marine decided to start a trading business and generate a stable income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase clothes and will resell them at a higher price. 

Marine will have a chance to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothes and generate her own stable income.

loans.name: Ahla Haya Group

texts.en:
The Ahla Haya Group consists of six women from Sana'a, Yemen and they requested a total loan from AMB for 330,000 YER. Hayat is the leader of the group. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is small. The house where Hayat and her family lives is old and needs to be renovated. Hayat and her family feel inconvenienced inside the house because it is not safe as well as not suitable for healthy living. 

Hayat decided to make the necessary renovations for her house but she does not have enough money to do. She requested a loan from AMB for 80,000 YER, which she will use to purchase construction materials to make the necessary renovation for her house. She hopes to renovate her entire house to make a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Norma Marlene

texts.es: Norma de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, la clienta es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, Norma  solicita un préstamo para poder comprar  más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 37 years old and she lives in her own house along with her three daughters; the applicant is a hard-working woman who dedicates fully to her business. All of this with the sole wish of moving ahead and to provide a better life for her family.

She owns a fruits and vegetables stall which is located in the market close to her home of residence she has lived in for several years. Norma is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables wholesale, that way she can provide a better way of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Jorge Boanerges

texts.es: Jorge de 60 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida y su hijastra, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad muebles, tiene 15 años de dedicarse al negocio y ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos, Jorge está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Jorge is 60 years old, and lives in his own home with his spouse and step-daughter. He owns a carpentry workshop in which he makes and sells a variety of furniture. For 15 years he has been in this business and he has many regular customers. Jorge is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business by purchasing wood, nails, glue, varnish, scrap and other materials to attract more customers so he can accomplish his goal of improving he and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase wood, nails, glue, varnish, scrap and other materials.

loans.name: Ilse

texts.es: Ilse, tiene 53 años de edad, nos cuenta que desde sus 8 años de edad aprendió a cocinar menús familiares.  Se dedico a este oficio en el año 2004, comercializando pasteles, arroces, sancochos, entre otros platos típicos.  Con las ganancias obtenidas compró perfumes, cremas, artículos de tocador, cosméticos y calzado,  los cuales vende a sus clientes que están ubicados en el barrio que reside al sur occidente de Barranquilla. Ilse es madre de 2 hijas y 2 hijos.  En su polifacético negocio su horario laboral es de 7 a.m. a 2 p.m. todos los días, sus compras las hace de contado en graneros del centro de la ciudad y también mediante revistas especializadas.  Sus ventas las hace a crédito y también de contado a sus vecinos y conocidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, también para  compra de colonias y perfumes.  Esta inversión le generará mayores ventas puesto que se acerca la temporada decembrina y con ello mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ilse is 53 years old and tells us that since she was eight years old she learned to cook her family's recipes. In 2004 she began to cook as an occupation, selling turnovers, rice dishes, stews and other typical dishes. With her earnings she bought perfumes, creams, toiletries, cosmetics, and shoes which she sells to her customers who are located in the neighborhood south west of Barranquilla where she lives.

Ilse is the mother of two daughters and two sons. She works at her multifaceted business from 7 a.m. until 2 p.m. every day. She buys on credit from stores in the center of the city and also through specialized magazines. She sells on credit and for cash to her neighbors and acquaintances.

She is currently applying for a KIVA loan, which is the first one with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy ingredients to make her dishes, and also to buy colognes and perfumes. This investment will generate more sales and more income since the December holiday season is approaching.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the dishes she makes, and also to buy colognes and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis, su idea de negocio inició a partir de las necesidades de recursos de su grupo familiar, ella realizó capacitaciones para aprender a confeccionar y desde entonces hace 7 años tiene su negocio, en el que además elabora calzado y vende CD.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes del barrio en el que reside que esta situado en el sur occidente de Barranquilla,  a ellos les brinda facilidades de pago.  Sus compras las realiza de contado a almacenes en el centro. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en insumos para la confección de ropa, cuero, suelas y perforadora, siendo esta una temporada en la que la producción se incrementa gracias a las festividades próximas.  Denis tiene 47 años, y es madre de 2 hijos y 4 hijas, y su meta familiar es velar porque sus hijos sigan estudiando y tengan un futuro promisorio.  Motivada y en pro de la búsqueda de un bienestar familiar desea que su negocio crezca y mejoren sus finanzas.
texts.en:
Denis's business idea emerged from her family's need for resources; she got training to learn how to make clothing and has had her business for seven years since then. She also makes shoes and sells CDs. Her main customers are her neighbors and people who pass through the neighborhood she lives in, which is located in the southwestern area of Barranquilla. She provides her customers with payment assistance and makes her purchases in cash at the stores in the center of the city.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she will receive from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in supplies to make clothing, leather, soles and a drill, since this is a time when production is increased due to the approaching holidays.

Denis is 47 years old and she is the mother of two sons and four daughters. Her goal for her family is to make sure that her children keep studying and have a promising future.  Motivated and seeking to support her family's well-being, she wants her business to grow and their finances to improve.

loans.use: to invest in supplies to make clothing, leather, soles and a drill

loans.name: Daneys

texts.es: Daneys, tiene mas de 40 años de vivir en Barranquilla, es chef de cocina y ha trabajado en varios restaurantes de la ciudad; aprovechando las relaciones sociales para comercializar productos, empezó hace 20 años, vendiendo ropa y calzado además de su otra actividad laboral.  Ella ofrece sus productos a sus compañeras de trabajo y vecinos del barrio donde reside al sur occidente de Barranquilla y les brinda facilidades de pago.  Se dedica a esta actividad de lunes a sábado de 7a.m. a 7p.m.  Realiza sus compras en almacenes del centro de Barranquilla de contado. Daneys tiene 52 años y es madre de dos hijas, ella desea ampliar su negocio y a futuro mejorar su casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de ropa para dama y niños y calzado, con el fin de tener stock para la temporada decembrina y obtener buenas ganancias, con lo que mejorará su negocio.
texts.en:
Daneys has lived in Barranquilla for more than 40 years. She is a chef and she has worked in several restaurants in the city. Taking advantage of the social relationships to market products, she began 20 years ago selling clothing and footwear, aside from her other job.  She offers products to her work partners and residential neighbors in the south-western part of Barranquilla; she also facilitates payment plans. She works in this field from Monday to Saturday from 7 AM to 7 PM. She performs all of her purchases in warehouses in downtown Barranquilla, in cash. 

Daneys is 52 years old and she has two daughters; she wishes to expand her business and thus make improvements to her house in the future. She is currently applying for a Credikiva, this is the first loan she requests from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchasing of women’s wear, children’s wear and footwear in order to have a supply for December and thus obtain good profits; this will improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Nelly's Group

texts.en:
Nelly is a 50-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of thirteen farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Nelly has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Nelly described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Nelly’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 30 лет, вдова, есть дочка - ходит в садик, ждет еще ребенка. Анара живет с дочерью и родителями. У нее среднее образование. Главной ценностью жизни Анара считает благополучие своей семьи, процветание бизнеса и счастье дочери. Благодаря целеустремленности, трудолюбию и нацеленности на результат, Анара на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 2 лошади и 10 овец. Дополнительно Анара занимается полеводством, выращивая на своем участке мерою 5,0 ГА клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 18 овец. Она намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Anara is 30 years old, a widow, has a preschool-age daughter and is expecting another child. Anara lives with her daughter and parents. She has a secondary education. Anara considers the welfare of her family, a flourishing business and her daughter's happiness to be the main valuables in life. Thanks to her drive, hard work, and focus, today Anara has 2 cows, 2 horses and 10 sheep. Additionally, Anara is involved in farming, growing clover on her 5.0 hectares of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 18 sheep. She intends to increase her livestock headcount, which will certainly lead to increasing her family's capital.

loans.use: to buy 18 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount and her family's income

loans.name: Kubanychbek

texts.ru: Кубанычбек, 39 лет, женат, многодетный отец 5 детей. Образование-высшее, по специальности эколог, 3,5 года он проработал по специальности. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей большой и дружной семьи он занимается животноводством, в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 35 овец, 10 коз, он разводит лошадей, у Кубанычбека - 6 лошадей. Для содержания скота есть все условия, летом скот отгоняется на пастбище, зимой содержится в теплых сараях. Ежемесячный доход Кубанычбека составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS) в том числе от заработной платы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кубанычбек обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 жеребцов, так как он мечтает собрать табун лошадей. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Kubanychbek is 39 years old, married, and the father of five children. He has a higher education with a specialization in ecology. For 3.5 years he has made his living in this speciality. As an additional source of income for his large and friendly family, he raises livestock. On his homestead, he has four cows, 35 sheep, and 10 goats; and he breeds horses. Kubanychbek has six horses. He has all the conditions to care for livestock; in the summer he puts the livestock to pasture and in the winter he tends them in warm barns. Kubanychbek's monthly income amounts to about 19,000 som (KGS) including his salary.

With the aim of further developing his business, Kubanychbek applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two stallions, since he dreams of raising a herd of horses.

He plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding his business and improving the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy two stallions in order to increase the headcount in his herd of horses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, sweets, sweat bread, etc.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Siemona, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de l’essence, de savon et de la galette.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAH, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte acheter des sacs de sorgho sur place.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Barouéli à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de caprins.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 46 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Siemona, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, gasoline, soap, and galettes. 

The women of the group DANAYA are on their 10th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, MAH, who is the person standing first from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of grains. She intends to purchase sacks of sorghum locally. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Barouéli. She plans on making a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in raising goats.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has no children. In 2013, Fatmata established her provisions, cements and drinks business. She began her business with the hope of getting a permanent source of income to provide livelihood and other support to her family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 920,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more stocks such as 100 bags of cement, dozens of sardines, Peak milk, soft drinks, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and to develop her business.

In the future, Fatmata plans to purchase two plots of land around the Waterloo highway. Very hard working and committed, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as 100 bags of cement, milk, sardines, Peak milk.

loans.name: Bagymgul

texts.ru: Багымгул, 41 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. Багымгул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав в 2000 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Багымгул есть 4 коровы и 30 овец. В огороде есть 40 слив. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. Доходы от кредита Багымгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а также сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bagymgul is 41 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in agriculture. Having started this business in 2000, today Bagymgul's business contains 4 cows and 30 sheep. She also has 40 plum trees in her garden. Her monthly profit is about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy one cow. Bagymgul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and also making repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Siemona, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de fruits et légumes, de l’habillement et de l’argile.
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habit pour enfant. Elle compte acheter des complets pour enfant chez les grossistes à Baroueli.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de caprins.
texts.en:
The group DJEKAFO is composed of married women, who average 39 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Siemona, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, fruit & vegetables, clothing, and clay. 

The women of the group DJEKAFO are on their 9th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, FANTA, who is the person sitting first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of children’s clothing. She intends to purchase children’s outfits from wholesalers in Baroueli. She sells retail, at her home and sometimes door to door, to a mixed customer base paying with cash. She plans on making a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be invested in raising goats.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
Lucero tiene 65 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Lucero se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 07 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea compra de patos, gallinas, cuyes; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar y diversificar su stock de animales y hacer crecer de esta forma su negocio; además de satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucero is 65 years old, has no children and lives in her own house with her common-law spouse in a rural part of the Oyotún district. It's located in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. Her community basically works in agriculture, livestock, and business.

Lucero has worked in the raising and selling of barnyard animals for 7 years, a business that she operates at her home. She's requesting a loan to acquire working capital; since she wants to purchase ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. The loan will help increase her investment, with the aim of boosting and diversifying her stock of animals and thus make her business grow. Additionally this would satisfy the needs of her customers, which would would allow her to improve her income in the short-term, bolster her profits and thus raise she and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a larger number of animals.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es: Oscar de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un negocio de reparación y venta de relojes entre otras cosas, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace mas de 20 años, El cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como relojes, control para televisión, baterías, etc. para poder tener mejores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar is 47 years old and he lives in his own home with his wife; he owns a small repair business and he sells watches, among other things. His business has been located in the municipal market for over 20 years. The client is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies in bulk, such as watches, TV remotes, batteries, etc. to increase earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies in bulk such as watches, TV remotes, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bicycle accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование высшее, Айнура работает преподавателем математики в школе. Также занимается животноводством, она добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 3 коровы, 15 овец, 14 коз и 6 лошадей. В Банк «Бай - Тушум» Айнура обратилась за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На прибыль от кредита Айнура планирует увеличить своё хозяйство. Она поделилась, что в будущем планирует сделать капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ainura is 32, married, and the mother of four children. She has a university degree and teaches mathematics at a high school. She also raises livestock with excellent results and currently has 3 cows, 15 sheep, 14 goats, and 6 horses. She applied for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock and will use her profits to expand her farm. She intends to make major repairs to her home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Mile 35 Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 30s, is married with one kid who is still in school.  She has been running a genge duka (vegetable stand) for three years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Anna's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the genge duka.  She dreams of owning a beauty salon.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "MILE 35," which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the genge duka

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a 48-year-old married mother of six children. Due to the increasing cost of living, she started selling perfumes and accessories  two years ago to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Najla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new attractive perfumes and accessories to satisfy her customers. She wants to achieve her dream of visiting holy and religious places.

Najla hopes to open her own perfume and accessories shop in the future to increase her income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and use her profit to visit holy and religious places.

loans.name: Qimatguli

texts.ru:
Киматгули молодая девушка из района Рудаки. Ей всего 22 года. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Киматгули дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Этой деятельностью она занята уже 5 лет. Киматгули сейчас работает дома, но надеется в будущем собрать средства и открыть собственное ателье. Она поставила себе цель и верит, что сможет достичь его.
   На данный момент дом Киматгули нуждается в срочном ремонте. Впереди холода и она не уверена что их дом будет готов к такому морозу. Киматгули видит один выход из данной ситуации. Она намерена получить кредит и срочно отремонтировать дом. Вы можете помочь ей!
texts.en:
Qimatguli is a young woman from Rudaki and is only 22 years old. She is not married and does not have children. Qimatgul sews women's clothing at home and has been doing so for five years. She works from home now, but hopes to raise the money to open her own workshop in the future. She set this goal for herself and believes that she will achieve it.

Qimatguli's house is currently in dire need of repair. She is not sure that her house is ready for the cold weather and sees only one way out of this situation. She intends to take out a loan and quickly renovate her house. You can help her!

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUITOUGOU est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Siemona, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de l’argile, de savon et de la galette.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUITOUGOU sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente ATOUMATA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’argile pour poterie. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’argile sur place.
La vente se fait en espèce à Baroueli à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUITOUGOU is composed of married women, who average 42 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Siemona, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, clay, soap, and galettes. 

The women of the group DJIGUITOUGOU are on their first solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, ATOUMATA, who is the person standing in the middle in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of pottery clay. She intends to purchase sacks of clay locally. She sells to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Baroueli. She plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase pottery clay

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 49 years old and has nine children. Shirly is married and has eigtht of her children are in school.

Shirly is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Shirly has been in this business for 6 years now, and has sustained it by borrowing 7 times from NWTF in the past. 

In the future, Shirly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hecilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Hecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling coconut wine. Hecilia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Hecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gulkhan

texts.ru: Гулхан досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулхан есть 4 коровы и 24 овцы. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulkhan repaid her previous loan, having used it for the intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Gulkhan currently has 4 cows and 24 sheep and earns 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, she applied for an additional loan with Bai-Tushum Bank for 80,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows and increase her livestock headcount. She plans to use her earnings from using the loan to invest in additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en:
Burastan is an agronomist living in Haytagh village, Armavir region. She runs her small farm and lives with her only son, Grigor. Burastan's husband is a migrant worker, who left the country with the hope of finding a well-paid job and sustaining his family.

Burastan owns a greenhouse where she cultivates strawberries in summer and greens in the winter season. To prepare her greenhouse for the cold season, Burastan has applied for this loan. She hopes to receive this loan and purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and fertilizer.

Burastan relies on lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 56 years old and married with six children. One of her children is in school.  Agustina works very hard to provide for them.

Agustina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, etc.  She has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзада, 46 лет, не замужем, детей  нет. У Гулзады средне-специальное образование, она работает в библиотеке. Ежемесячный доход составляет более 11,000 сомов (KGS). Гулзада решила улучшить жилищные условия и сделать ремонт в ее квартире, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS), чтобы купить входную дверь, обои, краску, гипсокартон и прочие строительные материалы. Таким образом Гулзада отремонтирует и утеплит квартиру.
texts.en: Gulzada is 46, not married, and has no children. She has a vocational education and works in a library, earning 11,000 som (KGS) per month. Gulzada decided to improve her living conditions and repair her apartment, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank. She will buy a door, wallpaper, paint, drywall, and other building materials. This is how she will repair and insulate her apartment.

loans.use: to buy a door, wallpaper, paint, drywall, and other building materials in order to repair her apartment

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 49-year-old married father of four children and a Palestinian refugee who has worked for twenty-seven years in agriculture and in making charcoal.

Bilal is trying desperately to expand his business, so he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary wood materials to increase his charcoal production. This loan will help Bilal increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary wood materials

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 42 years old and he lives in Vanadzor City in the Lori region. He lives with his wife and small child. He has already 15 years of experience in the fruit and vegetable trading business. In his own small shop he sells a great assortment of fruits; especially the assortment of citrus fruits is a lot. He buys citrus fruits from the Republic of Georgia and he drives there in his own car twice a month. He has a lot of customers who regularly do their shopping from him because Andranik always has fresh and tasty fruits in his shop. Andranik’s wife is unemployed and, being the only bread-winner in his family, he does his best to provide his family with good living conditions.

This loan, in an amount of 300,000 Armenian drams, Andranik asks for in order to buy new assortment of citrus fruits for which he will again drive to the Republic of Georgia.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of citrus fruits.

loans.name: Kubanychbek

texts.ru: Кубанычбек, 45 лет, женат, 6 детей. У Кубанычбека среднее образование, на протяжении 20 лет вместе с супругой активно занимаются животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Кубанычбека есть 1 корова, 1 лошадь, 10 овец и 10 коз. Он очень трудолюбивый, ответственный и целеустремленный. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Кубанычбек обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кубанычбек планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса.
texts.en: Kubanychbek is 45, married, and has six children. He has a high school education and has been raising livestock with his spouse for 20 years. He currently has a cow, a horse, ten sheep and ten goats. He is very hardworking, responsible, and driven. In order to expand his farm, Kubanychbek applied for a loan of 85,000 som (KGS) to buy five calves and increase his livestock headcount. He plans to use the profits to continue investing in his business.

loans.use: to purchase five calves in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic materials to make bread, because it is more profitable to buy wholesale than retail, so it will benefit her household economy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: hacer sumidero e instalar inodoro, mejorando la higiene en el hogar que es de suma importancia para la salud familiar..

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Emily, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 40 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  She is married and has 2 children.

Emily is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Emily says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Emily will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of 3 solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.fr: Âgée de 27ans, Mabelle revend des perles au marché depuis 2009. Elle est à son cinquiéme crédit à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir l'activité et se prendre en charge.
