texts.en: Mabelle, aged 27, has been selling beads at the market since 2009. She is on her fifth loan at WAGES. The profit will enable her to expand her business and to support herself.

loans.use: to purchase beads

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is a 42-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Emily has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Emily described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Emily’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Haja Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Haja.  She is married, and has 2 children aged 10 and 3yrs. 

In 2014, Haja established her electrical goods and building material business. She began her business with the hope of getting a permanent source of income to provide a livelihood and other support to her family. Working 7 days a week and 19 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Haja would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to purchase building materials and electrical items like cartons of bulbs, adaptors, and a large quantity of cement. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her business capital. 

In the future, Haja plans to open another outlet and to complete building her house.  

As a married parent of two children, Haja works hard to support her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items and building materials.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su familia, es soltera y no tiene hijos, sus actividades económicas son la comercialización de ganado y la agricultura, su familia también desempeña estas actividades, ya tiene 4 años de estar trabajando en dicho negocio, en la zona es muy reconocida, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.
Invertirá en ganado y abono para el cultivo de maíz, fortalecerá el negocio y obtendrá mejores ingresos, con los que cubrirá sus gastos personales y apoyará a su familia, espera no tener dificultades que le impidan cancelar su deuda.
Sus sueños son seguir trabando para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her family. She is single and has no children. She has worked for 4 years raising cattle and growing crops, along with her family. She is well known in the area, and has never had difficulties previously. She will buy cattle, and fertilizer for her corn crop. This will strengthen her business and allow her to earn more income, which she will use to pay her personal expenses and support her family. She does not expect to have any problems that will prevent her from repaying her loan. Her dream is to continue working to provide the necessities for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle, and fertilizer for her corn crop. This will strengthen her business and allow her to earn more income

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr: Chauffeur de profession depuis 1986 Mr Fousseni exerce son activité à KPALIME et dans les villages de la localité. Il désire un premier crédit pour acheter de la peinture et du moteur pour sa voiture. A l'avenir, Mr Fousséni âgé de 50ans désire acheter une nouvelle voiture et assurer le bien - être de la famille. Marié, il a 05 enfants dont 03 scolarisés.
texts.en: A chauffeur by trade since 1986, Mr. Fousseni operates his business in KPALIME and in the villages in his area. He would like an initial loan to purchase some paint and an engine for his car. For the future, Mr. Fousseni, aged 50, would like to purchase a new car and to ensure his family’s well-being. He is married and has five children, of whom three are in school.

loans.use: to purchase a motor and some paint for his car

loans.name: Fabiola Estefania

texts.es:
Fabiola es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y trabaja como cajera de un restaurante.
Ella es independiente, inteligente, responsable y muy trabajadora, su negocio es la contabilidad, y lo realiza en una churrasquería ubicada en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’, lugar caracterizado por la existencia de restaurantes de comida tradicional y la elaboración de la famosa ‘Chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima cálido semitropical.
Fabiola es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español. su vida la realiza con sus abuelitos y sus dos hermanos menores porque sus padres se encuentran trabajando en el país de Italia, viven en una casa a medio construir que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su sueño es tener una profesión y un trabajo estable para ayudar a su familia. Debido a la necesidad de trabajar, estudio secretariado en un instituto del lugar y consiguió trabajo en un restaurante cercano, con sus ganancias cubre sus necesidades y su padres mandan dinero para sus hermanos menores, actualmente, estudia contabilidad en la universidad y trabaja el resto del tiempo. Ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en la casa de sus padres que es donde vive, para dejar de usar el pozo de agua que tiene actualmente. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año y medio que trabaja como cajera.
Es por esos motivos que Fabiola solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su baño, cocina y lavandería.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a 22-year-old young woman. She is single and does not have any children. She works as a restaurant cashier.

She is independent, intelligent, responsible, and very hard-working. She works with accounts at a barbecue place in the "Sacaba" area, which is known for its restaurants that prepare traditional food and the famous "Chicha" (a fermented corn drink). It has a temperate, semitropical climate.

Fabiola is of medium height, olive-skinned, with long brown hair. Her native language is Quechua, and she speaks Spanish too. She lives with her grandparents and her 2 younger siblings because her parents are working in Italy. They live in a partially completed house with electricity and well water.

Her dream is to have a profession and a stable job so she can help her family. Because she needed to work, she completed a secretarial course at a nearby school and landed a job at a local restaurant. With her earnings, she covers her necessities, and her parents send money for her younger siblings. Currently, she is studying accounting at the university and works the rest of the time.

She wants to install potable water in her parents' house, which is where she lives, so they can stop using the well that they currently have. This is the first loan she will receive from the institution in the year and a half in which she has worked as a cashier.

For these reasons, Fabiola is requesting a loan to install potable water in her bathroom, kitchen, and laundryroom.

loans.use: to install potable water in her bathroom, kitchen, and laundryroom

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Smallholder farmers in Kenya, like Edwin (pictured), continue to languish in poverty due to the unwilling nature of formal financial institutions to set up shops in remote areas. They say the rural population is unevenly dispersed and the farmers make low incomes, irregularly. 

Supported by Kiva, Juhudi Kilimo penetrates remote regions to finance agricultural assets and farm inputs to improve productivity and profitability of rural enterprises.

In this case, Edwin is seeking a loan of KES  65,000 to purchase potatoes and beans to grow and harvest on his horticultural farm. He will also use the money to buy pesticide to ensure that his crops are not attached by bugs predominating the farms in the area. 

Income from this venture will help Edwin repay the loan, take care of his wife, and take his four children to school. Edwin's family will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their kind hearts, to spare their needs and help Edwin raise money to move his family forward.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, beans, and pesticide for his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice.  Lucia is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to  buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall for her food vending business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda, a 44-year-old married woman, has been selling groceries in Kitengela town for the last 15 years. The business has been profitable and from the income, she has been able to provide the basic needs of her family. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family and together they have been blessed with 2 children. She also supports 4 members of her family.

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy more stock of tomatoes and potatoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Aidolly

texts.en:
Aidolly is 27 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Her husband is an electrician. She manages their household while operating her business so she can augment their income and help meet their daily needs.

Aidolly operates a souvenir shop. Coron is one of most popular and beautiful islands of Palawan. Both local and foreign tourists love the pristine beaches in Coron.  Her regular customers are the locals and foreigners who visit the island almost the whole year round. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations and increase her sales, Aidolly requested a loan for 35,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more souvenir items such as weaved hats, bags, and wooden sculptures. This loan will boost her earnings as she increases her items in preparation for Christmas. Aidolly hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Aidolly meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase souvenir items to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is from Laguna, Philippines. She is married and has children. She has been employed by a garment factory in Cavite for two years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Maricel works as a clothing packer. She ensures that items of clothing are packed in the correct way ready for distribution. The type of packaging used depends on the type, value, fabric and destination of the garments.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Maricel, is their salaries do not meet family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit. This situation makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Maricel is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem repaying them because loan payments are deducted every pay day.  She looks forward to your positive response and any loan money will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for their household expenses and she will also help her mother.

Maricel wants to have her own house and manage a business someday. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for her family's needs and help her mother.

loans.name: Monjama J

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Monjama.  She is married, and has 1 child aged 9yrs. 

In 2012, Monjama established her provisions, and cosmetics business. She began her business after she was trained in a salon as a hair dresser. She decided to open her own shop in order to better herself and the only child she has for now. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Monjama would like a loan in the amount of 300,0000 SLL.  She requires a loan in order to buy more packets of cereal, nutria, expression hair, cartons of paste cream, soap, hair oil and hair spray. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 429,000 SLL. 

In the future, Monjama plans to open a boutique and to import goods of different types for wholesale. She is very hard working and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more packets of cereal, nutria, expression hair, cartons of paste cream, soap, hair oil and hair spray.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, necesita de un nuevo financiamiento para tener todo listo para su próxima siembra de maíz, comprara insecticidas, abono, semilla y pagara los costos de mano de obra para realizar las diferentes actividades relacionadas con el cultivo de maíz, busca continuar con su negocio para tener alimento para su grupo familiar y comercializar otra parte.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior su cosecha tuvo buenos resultados, la circunstancias familiares se mantienen y su nivel económico es más digno.
texts.en:
Mario needs another loan in order to have everything ready for his next corn planting season. He will purchase insecticides, fertilizer, and seeds, and pay for labor to complete the various tasks related to his corn fields. He wants to continue his business so he can feed his family and sell the remainder.

With the help of his previous loan, his harvest was successful. His family circumstances remain the same, and his economic level is more respectable.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, fertilizer, and seeds, and to pay for labor related to his corn fields

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Arsenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like like shampoo, soft drinks, diapers, spices, and other groceries for her store.

Arsenia has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Arsenia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, soft drinks, diapers, spices, and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin, se encuentra preparando todo para realizar su próxima siembra, por lo que requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que dará un buen desarrollo al cultivo de maíz y pipián.
El apoyo brindado con el financiamiento anterior ha dado buenos resultados como estabilidad en el negocio y en los ingresos, la cosecha no tuvo problemas de plagas y fue muy abundante. La familia se mantiene unida y brindándole apoyo para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Marvin is preparing everything for the next planting season, and he needs another loan to purchase farming supplies so he can successfully grow corn and pipián [a type of squash].

The support from his previous loan provided good results, including stability for his business and income. The harvest did not have problems with plant diseases, and it was very abundant. His family remains united and offers him support to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies so he can successfully grow corn and squash

loans.name: Abod1 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Abod 1.  It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Badria is the leader of the group. She is 47 years old, married and a mother of three sons and four daughters. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Her husband is an unemployed. The income of her family is from one of her sons and from one of her daughters who are an employed with small salaries. The house where Badria and her family live lacks of a lot of home appliances and furniture and most of them are very old. Badria wants to furnish her house but she doesn't have enough money to do. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture for her house.

Badria looks forward to purchasing all home appliances and furniture for her house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of three children. 

The man shown in the photo is Robina’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Robina has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Robina is hopeful that this loan will prove a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 48-year-old married mother of four children. She has been involved in a bakery business for many years with the support of her husband, who is shown in the photo with Khalida. Her husband assists her in packing and selling the items in the shop near their house.  They serve their community well. To expand their business, Khalida requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy bakery ingredients such as baking powder, salt, sugar, oil, and eggs in large quantities. She hopes that this will help them boost their earnings and help support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for bakery items such as baking powder, salt, sugar, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 47-year-old married mother of nine children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) started auto rickshaw driving about 15 years ago. But due to some damages he needs to pay for the rickshaw's repair and maintenance. Therefore, Abida has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. This is her third loan and she has a good repayment record. She is thankful to Kashf Foundation for her previous loans. She is hopeful that with the help of this loan her husband’s business will prosper and their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to pay for rickshaw repair and maintenance

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is a divorced mother who is raising her daughter. 

Muhayo has her own business arrangement: she has been selling a variety of fabrics in the local market for more than 2 years now. She is a very hardworking woman. 

Muhayo is developing her business little by little. She has regular customers who buy from her at her stall in the market. 

Muhayo would like to both increase her working capital and maximize her profits. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS in order to buy a variety of fabrics to sell. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 37 years old, married and has a ten years old child. Corazon helps her husband in their fishing business. This is their source of income for more than 10 years now.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy new boat engine and propeller. A loan will enable them to improve their fishing business as well as their income.

Corazon hopes of improving fishing venture and even save money for the schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy new boat engine and propeller

loans.name: Nhóm 03_Thôn 5_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Tuyết is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 thôn 5 Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Tuyết is 60 years old and she is married with 4 children.  Mrs. Tuyết has a manufacturing business making rice vermicelli noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

This is Tuyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: Bán bánh cuốn

loans.name: Nhóm 02_Thôn 5_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Thương has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make buttered popcorn to sell.

Thương is 28 years old and is married with two children..
Thương is the group leader of the Nhóm 02_thôn 5_Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

This is Thương first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thương has been involved in this business for five years.
The main hardship that Thương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make buttered popcorn to sell.

loans.name: Armando Javier

texts.es: Armando es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres y  que termino la secundaria hace 2 años y  que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo ingresar a la universidad, el se encuentra trabajando de albañil y adicional a esta actividad se dedica  a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en una chanchera y es su madre quien le da cuidando sus animalitos, la aspiración de Armando es que su negocio sea rentable y de ahí espera poder pagar los gastos que implica entrar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Armando is a 20-year-old young man. He lives with his parents and finished secondary school two years ago. Due to a lack of economic resources, he couldn't attend college.

He is working as a construction worker and also raises animals.

He will use to loan to purchase pigs to keep in a swine barn, and his mother will care for the little animals. Armando's dream is that his business be profitable, and from there, he hopes to be able to pay college tuition.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is 47 and wants to improve her dairy farming with courage and determination that will lead to success. Purity has been a very hard-working farmer for the past 10 years and has gained so much experience over the years. Purity practices mixed farming, that is, she grows crops and keeps dairy cows and has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her animals. Although Purity has been making profits through dairy farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious woman. Demand for milk has been so high and her dairy cows cannot produce enough because of lack of good animal feed. For this reason she is kindly requesting a loan to buy animal feed.Through the loan, Purity will be assured of increased milk production which will translate to more profits and cash. Through the use of good feed for her cows, Purity will be able to satisfy the demand of milk in her village and this will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Purity's plan is to be able to increase her dairy farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 57-year-old widowed mother of one child. She is the sole earner of her family, thus she started selling food ten years ago to cover the needs and expenses of her child.

Today, Nada is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with new kinds of food to satisfy her customers, as she wants to achieve her dream of visiting holy places. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her child's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her ingredient supplies

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is 23 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Mahbuba has been busy with a sewing business for more than 8 years. She sews variety of women dresses. Mahbuba has a rental space in a shop.  She develops business little by little. 

Mahbuba is going to open her own workshop and in this way to improve business. Mahbuba is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy sewing machine and to pay for the rent of her new workshop. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to pay for rent for a new workshop

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is from Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Herson and they have three children. She has been employed by a garment factory in Cavite for almost two years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Lydia is a clothing presser. She presses fabrics or garments during the production process (known as under-pressing) as well in the final stages of production (usually in a garment-finishing department). Sometimes, she helps in the sewing process and other production processes if necessary.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Lydia, is their salaries don't cover family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit. This situation makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Lydia is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. She looks forward for your positive response and any loan will surely be of great help. She will be incorporating the loan as her starting capital for her sandal-making business.

Lydia wants to give her children a better future through all her hard work. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To increase her capital for starting a business making sandals.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 30 year old married man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He has two children. Anthony is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of his income.
Anthony works really hard in order to support the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children. Anthony is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for his fishing boat, and plywood, nails, bamboo and other materials for repairs. This loan will enable him to improve his fishing business as well as his income.
Anthony hopes to make his business a success and profitable. Moreover, he wants to save some money for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his fishing boat, and plywood, nails, bamboo and other materials for repairs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Juanita is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Walter Alcides

texts.es:
Walter, tiene como actividad económica la compra y venta de loza, su tiempo lo dedica a su negocio y su familia, su abuela le enseño todo lo relacionado con esta actividad, trabaja independiente desde hace 5 años, en ocasiones es apoyado por su familia, la ventaja es que es un negocio rentable y ya cuenta con clientes establecidos; Walter es casado, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 5 meses de nacido.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar barro crudo, nacazcol y arcilla para elaborar sus propias piezas de loza, también adquirirá piezas ya elaboradas para quemarlas o cocerlas, tendrá mayor productividad y podrá cumplir con los pedidos de temporada, con lo que sus utilidades incrementaran y serán de ayuda para cancelar los gastos familiares y  las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
Sus sueños son tener recursos económicos para diversificar su negocio y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Walter makes a living by buying and selling pottery. He dedicates his time to his work and his family. His grandmother taught him everything he knows about this art.

He has worked independently for five years; sometimes he is helped by his family. The good thing is that it is a profitable business, and he already has regular customers.

Walter is married. He lives with his wife and a 5-month-old son.

He will use to the loan to buy unprocessed clay and nacazcol [a black dye] to make his own pottery pieces. He will also purchase already-made pieces that he will fire himself. He will have better productivity and will be able to meet the season's demands. His profits will increase and help cover family expenses and the loan debt.

His dreams are to have the economic resources to diversify his business, and to have more customers.

loans.use: to purchase unprocessed clay and black dye to create his own pottery; also to purchase already-made pieces to fire himself

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten and later sell

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor on her street.  Shehnaz  is a responsible mother of 4 children. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry, etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 55000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn good amount of income to cover her overhead.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 37-year-old married woman pictured her with her husband. They have been involved in the business of rice trading for many years. Her husband is well known in the field of rice purchasing and sales. They are earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband takes orders from customers and provides them with different varieties of rice in their respective cities. Shamim is a responsible mother of four children and needs more income to cover the daily expenses of her family members. That is why she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more rice to increase their sales and earnings.

loans.use: to buy more rice to increase sales and earnings.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 36 years old, married to Vivian and blessed with two school-age children. For the last 10 years, he has run a transport business and also has practiced crop farming, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.
	 		
He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to service his motorcycle and also buy seedlings.                                                                                           
 
Gideon  will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and also buy seedlings.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in Sevan city, in the Gegharkunik region. 

For many years, Samvel and his wife have run his fruit and vegetable trading business. He rents a stall at the city’s wholesale market, where each sort of vegetables and fruit is nicely and cutely sorted in the boxes and on the shelves. In this way, Samvel makes his stall more attractive for his customers, who are a lot. 

Samvel already paid back his first Kiva loan, thanks to which he now has a rather developed and profitable business. His family is very large (he has five sons) and, as he says in order to sustain his large family’s big needs, he works without holiday and until late in the evening. Samvel buys his entire stall assortment from the nearby villages and he also brings some part of it from Yerevan city.

Samvel asks for a loan of AMD 600,000 (Armenian drams) in order to refresh his stall’s assortment of fresh vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to refresh his stall’s assortment of fresh vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Jorge Wilmer

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijas de 3 y 1 años de edad, es el responsable de costear los gastos familiares; su negocio es brindar el servicio de peluquería y barbería, lo posee desde 14 años, su primo le enseño está actividad, actualmente ya tiene su propio local y clientela establecida.
Comprar geles para el cabello, talcos, guillette´s y le dará mantenimiento al equipo de trabajo, ofrecera mejoror atención a sus clientes, ganar mayor popularidad, mejorar su situación financiera y seguir pendiente del cuidado de su familia.
Su propósito es mantener su negocio en el mercado para tener su fuente de ingresos activa y poder resarcir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his life partner and their two daughters, who are ages three and one. He is responsible for covering his family's expenses. His business is a barber shop, which he has owned for the past fourteen years. He learned the business from his cousin, but now he has his own retail space and a well-established customer base.

He will use this loan to buy hair gel, powder, and razors, as well as to maintain his work equipment. This will allow him to give his customers better service, and in turn gain more popularity so that he can continue taking care of his family.

Hi goal is to keep his business running so that he has an active source of income and he can pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy hair gel, powder and razors and maintain his equipment.

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
O Sr. Armindo de 35 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario 1 è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è negociante informal de diversos tecidos de roupa, actividade que esta que vem fazendo a mais de 10 anos, suas vendas è feita porta a porta uma vez que ele  nao possue estabelicimento comercial.
Com o  valor do emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar diversos tecidos de roupa para aumentar o volume do seu negoccio.
texts.en:
Armindo, 35, is married and a father of three children, two of whom are in elementary school and one of whom is too young to go to school. He is an informal salesman of various clothing fabrics, an activity which he has had for over ten years. His sales are made door-to-door as he does not have a commercial property.

He will use this loan to buy various clothing fabrics to increase the volume of his business.

loans.use: to buy various clothing fabrics to increase the volume of his business.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.pt:
O Sr. Feliciano de 52 anos de idade casado e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 3 estao afrequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario 3 sao independente e vivem nas suas casas. Ele e seguranca na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 7 anos  è tambem negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade que esta a explorar na sua casa.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, varoes, blocos, janelas, portas e  pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao  da sua casa.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 52, is married and a father of six children. Three of his children are in elementary and secondary school, and three are independent and live in their own houses. He has been a security guard at a banana production company for more than seven years. He is also an informal businessman selling basic products. He is exploring this business activity at home. 

With this loan, he will buy construction materials (cement, rods, blocks, windows, and doors) and pay workers. This will allow him to continue construction on his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, rods, blocks, windows, and doors) and to pay workers.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is 32 years old, married and has one child.  Her family is IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from her native land of Kalbadjar city.  Now she lives with her husband and son in the Abseron region. Her son is in 5th grade at school.  Samira no longer works in a consulting, but has gone to school to learn cosmetology.

Today Samira rents a stall in a beauty salon for women. Samira wants to increase her business. So that she needs 2350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy supplies, cosmetics, hairdryers and etc. for her beauty salon. This is her third loan.  Samira has repaid all loans on time.  

She is thankful for the aid from Komak and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies and cosmetics to increase business

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a 5- year-old married woman and the mother of four grown up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a hardworking woman.  

Arceli supports her in husband in their fishing venture. This business has provided them the income that they need for more than 33 years. 

Arceli is requesting to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and outriggers. This loan will allow them to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Arceli hopes of making their fishing business more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and outriggers

loans.name: Cordillera Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de 23, 15 y 13 años de edad, y su negocio es la pastelería.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por la diversidad cultural, etnias del lugar como la ‘Ayorea’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país se asentaron en el lugar, pero también llegaron familias afectadas por las sequías, cambas pobres, collas nacidos en los más remotos rincones del país y fueron arribando al nuevo barrio guaraníes y chiquitanos entre muchas otras etnias. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Isabel es de tez morena, cabello negro y gris, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio (la primera de la izquierda, pantalón azul y blusa amarilla).  Su vida la realiza con sus tres hijos, porque se separó de su esposo, la familia vive en una casa propia de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica. La necesidad de alimentar a su familia generando mejores recursos económicos la hizo formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la pastelería; hace más de dos años comenzó su negocio casero de venta de queques, aún sigue siendo casero pero ya más organizado. Al principio las ventas eran muy pocas, pero han ido aumentando. El negocio aún no ha pasado de micro empresa, debido a que un familiar cercano es diabético, poco a poco desarrolló productos especializados para diabéticos, para que no se sientan excluidos y puedan disfrutar de la fiesta. Para esta navidad tiene su ya tradicional queque de navidad, con frutas, pasas, nueces, ciruelas, café y ron! Pero también esta incursionado en los queques navideños bajos en azúcar y queques navideños sin gluten. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y entregar pedidos al por mayor a tiendas, mercados y supermercados. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina y demás ingredientes por mayor para aumentar su producción y llegar a más clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel, 49, is married and has three children, ages 23, 15, and 13.  Her business is a bakery.  She's independent, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking, and she's a good mother.

Isabel carries out her business in the Plan 3000 zone, an area known for cultural diversity.  Area ethnic groups such as the Ayorea people and miners relocated from the western part of the country settled in the area, as did families affected by droughts, poor Bolivians, Colla people born in the most remote corners of the country, Guarani people, and Chiquitano people, among many other ethnic groups.  The climate is warm and tropical, with an average temperature of 30 degrees centigrade throughout the entire year. 

Isabel is dark and of average height, and has black and gray hair (the first one on the left, with blue pants and a yellow blouse).  Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for business.  She lives with her three children because she's separated from her husband.  They live in their own house, which is made of brick, and have potable water and electricity.

The need to earn a better income to feed her family led Isabel to form a bank with people with businesses--such as mobile phone sales, chicken meat sales, flower sales, tea service, tailoring, and making empanadas--to request a loan and prosper in their businesses.

Isabel's business is a bakery.  She started a home business selling cakes more than two years ago.  She's still a home business but is more organized.  In the beginning sales were scare, but they have increased.  It's still a micro-business.  A close family member is diabetic, so little by little she developed specialized products for diabetic; that way they don't feel excluded and they can enjoy the celebrations.

For this Christmas she has her now-traditional Christmas cake--with fruit, raisins, walnuts, plums, coffee, and rum!  But she's also making low-sugar cakes and gluten-free cakes.  Her dream is to expand her business and fulfill wholesale orders from stores, markets, and supermarkets.

For those reasons, Isabel's requesting a loan to buy flour and other ingredients wholesale to increase her production and reach more customers.  This is her third loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has been in this business.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients wholesale to increase production and reach more customers

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, ha logrado con ayudad del préstamo anterior mantener su negocio funcionando, sus ingresos y ventas están mejorando.
Con el objetivo de tener una mejor situación económica y cubrir las necesidades básicas familiares, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, aceite, quesillo, tomates, repollos, bebidas y otros materiales para elaborar la venta de pupusas y tortillas. Está luchando por reunir capital para establecer una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Reina was able to keep her business running with the previous loan.  Her income and sales are improving.

She wants to have a better financial situation and cover her family's basic needs, so she opted for a new loan to invest in buying corn, oil, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, beverages and other ingredients for her pupusa and tortilla business.

She's working hard to get together the capital to set up a store to sell basic staples.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, beverages, and other ingredients to make pupusas and tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy waxes, detergents and car tyres so he can meet his customers' demands and carry on working.

loans.name: Reyna Inocenta

texts.es:
Reyna, disfruta de su vida junto a dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, sus hijos mayores ya se han independizado, como una madre responsable y dedicada a buscar la forma de salir adelante con su familia hace 30 años hizo la apertura de su negocio, que consiste en la crianza de cerdos y realizar cultivo de granos básicos, así puede tener alimento para su familia e ingresos al comercializar el resto de la cosecha y los cerdos, no tiene un horario definido.
Fortalecerá su negocio comprando fertilizantes, abono y concentrado para cerdos, le permitirá tener una mejor cosecha de granos básicos, espera aumentar sus ingresos vendiendo a mejor precio los granos básicos y cerdos, pues así cancelara el crédito y costeara los gastos familiares.
Su principal objetivo es mantener su negocio lo más estable posible para tener una mejor situación económica con la que asegurara un buen desarrollo académico a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reyna is enjoying life together with her two children aged 10 and 8 years old. Her older children all are independent. Like any responsible and dedicated mother she looks for ways to get ahead with her family.

Thirty years ago she started her business, which consists of raising pigs and growing basic grains. Selling the rest of the harvest and the pigs allows her to feed her family and have income. She has no set timetable. She will strengthen her business buying fertilizer, manure and concentrated feed for pigs which will allow her to have a greater harvest of basic grains.

She hopes to increase her income selling her pigs and basic grains at the highest price and then she can pay off her loan and pay the family expenses. Her main objective is to maintain her business as stable as possible to enjoy a better economic situation which will allow good academic development for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and concentrated feed for pigs, which will allow a better basic grain harvest.

loans.name: Eduardo Luis

texts.es:
Eduardo, es casado, en su hogar no hay hijos, vive con su esposa, ambos trabajan para cubrir los gastos de su hogar; Eduardo cultiva granos básicos y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, su padre le enseño todo lo relacionado con el negocio, ya tiene mucha experiencia que respalda la buena administración de las ganancias, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar ganado, lo cuidara y después lo venderá a sus clientes, espera recuperar lo invertido con ganancias mayores para facilitarle el pago de sus compromisos económicos.
Sus objetivos son ampliar el negocio, tener clientes satisfechos y tener un nivel de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and lives with his wife. They don't have any children. They both work in order to cover their household expenses. Eduardo grows basic grains and also works raising livestock. He learned all about this business from his father and already has lots of experience, which helps him administer his earnings wisely. So far he has not run into any problems.

He will use this loan to buy livestock. He will take care of it and later sell it to his customers. He hopes to recover his investment and make a higher profit in order to pay off his financial obligations more easily. His goals are to expand his business, keep his customers satisfied, and achieve more comfortable living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, está satisfecho con el servicio que le brinda la institución, comenta que con el crédito anterior ha tenido oportunidad de comprar herramientas y repuestos para vehículo, hizo  mejoras en el espacio que está ubicado su taller, teniendo así la facilidad de brindar un buen servicio, mejores ingresos y una vida más cómoda, su situación familiar ha cambiado actualmente ya está acompañado.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar juego de llaves, adictivos, bujías, luces, etc., así tendrá equipado su negocio, espera mantener la fidelidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is satisfied with the services provided by the organization. He says his previous loan gave him the opportunity of buying tools and spare auto parts. He made improvements in the space where his shop is located and thus managed to provide better service and achieve better income and a more comfortable life. His family situation has changed since his previous loan, since he now lives with his girlfriend.

He is requesting a new loan to buy a set of wrenches, motor oil and additives, spark plugs, lights, etc. This will allow his business to be well stocked. He hopes to maintain his customers' loyalty.

loans.use: to stock up on wrenches, motor oil, spark plugs, lights, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Ataobung Bazar Women Shg Group

texts.en: “Weaving pretty shawls makes me happy and I am proud to see my weaving display in the market with so many ladies admiring it,” said Binasakhi. She is the featured borrower of the group pictured with her hand raised. She took a loan from WSDS in the previous years to promote her weaving business. “I am now able to stand on my own feet and I give my thanks to WSDS.” She is now able to pay her household expenses without any difficulties. Her husband is a driver and is away from home most of the time. She stays strong and looks after the children alone at home. She sends her children to school and weaves during daytime while the children are at school. She also enjoys spending time together with her children to build a close parent-child bond and a bond among her children. She is realistic when it comes to parenting and gives her best to support her children. She will buy stock of yarn for weaving with the loan to produce more shawls for selling. She wants to save up for the children’s school admission fees for the new session and to buy new textbooks. She is excited to get the loan and wishes good luck to the lenders. The rest of the group members are all diligent and engaged in weaving, poultry and piggery businesses for sustenance. All the group members are striving to become self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy yarn to make pretty shawls to sell in the market.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Nazir  is a married woman. She earns a living hand embroidering.  She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to build a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment; which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat  is 28 years old, and married.  She is the mother of 4 children. Her husband has been working in animal sales for many years.  Musarat fully supports and assists her husband with his work. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR.  She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle to sell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
O Sr. Pedro de 24 anos de idade casado e pai de um filho que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele e Operario Agricola na empresa de producao de Banana. 
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (pedra, area, cimento, barratos e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar com a construcao da sua casa e fechar o credito em tempo recorde para possuir mais financiamento na Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Pedro, 24, is married and a father of one child, who is in primary school. He is an agricultural worker at a banana production company.

With this loan, he will buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, bars) and pay workers to continue construction on his house.

In the future, he plans to finish construction on his house and pay back his loan in record time to apply for further funding from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, bars) and pay workers.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a responsible, protective, and vigilant mother of two very young daughters. She has been able to support her family thanks to her mixed farming business. With it, she has built her home and has overcome the economic adversities that have presented themselves to her. She always works to improve her quality of life and to provide a better education to these two darling girls who see in their mother a great heroine who works and works for their well-being. 

For 10 years Irine has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Irine, however, is taking this a little step further. Irine is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Rizalita

texts.en:
Rizalita is from Cavite, Philippines. She is married, and she and her husband have 2 children, both of whom are already in college. 

Rizalita has been employed as a Sewer in a garment factory in Cavite for 2 years now through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*. She does the sewing and designing of clothing apparel according to the company's or client’s demands. She sews clothes using a sewing machine and other stitching machines, but she often hand-stitches the edges and linings as well.

One of the main dilemmas for employees like Rizalita is the improper balance between salaries and family expenses. As a result, they have no access to savings or credit - a situation that makes them vulnerable to usurious money lenders, who take their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Rizalita is asking for your assistance in preventing her from being exposed to predatory lenders. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, which she was able to successfully repay since the loan payments were deducted every payday. 

Rizalita plans to use her loan to pay for the tuition fees of her children. She looks forward to your positive response; any amount you might contribute will surely be of great help. 

Rizalita dreams that her children will be able to complete their studies and become successful in the future. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the school fees of her children studying in college.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 7 and 26.  Four of them go to school.  She works with her husband selling food and has been running her business for 10 years. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and beans to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy land to build on.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a labores domésticas; su fuente de ingresos es la venta de pan y café en el mercado municipal, labor que desempeña todos los días, realiza dos recorridos para lograr atender a todos sus clientes, lo cual es una dificultad para él. 
Será de ayuda para comprarse una motocicleta, con la que se movilizara mucho más rápido, pudiendo llevar más cantidad de sus productos de una sola vez, su objetivo es atender mejor a sus clientes y atraer a otros nuevos clientes, mejorar las ventas y la situación financiera familiar.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para mejorar la alimentación y salud familiar, así como también comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
José is in a relationship and his life partner is a homemaker.  His source of income is selling bread and coffee in the town market, a job he does every day.  To serve all his customers he makes two trips, which is a hardship for him.

Buying a motorcycle for himself will be a big help.  He'll be able to get around much more quickly and carry more of his products at the same time.  His goal is to provide better customer service, attract new customers, and improve his sales and his family's financial situation.

José's dream is to keep on working to improve his family's nutrition and health, and to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so he can get around much more quickly and carry more products at the same time

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, ha recuperado el crédito anterior, lo invirtió en alimento para cerdos y ganado, con buenas utilidades, las cuales está utilizando para cancelar sus deudas y mejor la calidad de vida familiar.
Está buscando apoyo por medio de un nuevo préstamo para comprar concentrado para cerdos y ganado, de esta manera sus animales estarán saludables, le será más fácil comercializarlos en el mercado, además podrá mejorar la producción lácteos para alimentar a su familia.
texts.en: María has repaid the previous loan which she invested in feed for her pigs and cattle. She made good profit which she used to pay off her debt and improve the family's life. She is looking for help by way of a new loan to buy concentrated feed for her pigs and cattle so that her animals will be healthy. It will be easier to sell them in the market and she will also have better milk production to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for pigs and cows and by doing this have healthy animals.

loans.name: Sandra Doris

texts.es: A sus 34 años de edad Doris  es madre soltera, su hijo tiene 14 años de edad y se encuentra asistiendo al colegio, Doris vive con su hijo y con su abuela,  Doris se dedica a la crianza de animales, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para criarlos en terrenitos por los que paga arriendo, la aspiración de Doris es comprar más terneros y así hacer que su negocio más rentable para por medio de estos ingresos darle la educación a su  hijo.
texts.en:
Doris is a 34-year-old single mother. Her son is fourteen years old and is going to school. Doris lives with her son and her grandmother. She works raising animals.

She will invest this loan in buying calves, which she will raise in the small plots of land for which she pays rent. Doris' goal is to buy more calves and make her business more profitable, so that she can use her income to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Makanga Group

texts.en: Alefa is a married woman, 38 years old, who supports her family by selling goat meat in the market and she is a mother of two children. She is a hard worker and has been operating her business for five years. Alefa is requesting this loan to bulk buy goats in order to reach more customers in her locality. With the knowledge she gained on business management from Microloan Foundation, she believes she will diversify her business with a grocery store when she makes enough profit. As a woman, she has managed to pay school fess for her children with the previous profits and she is self-reliant.

loans.use: To purchase goats

loans.name: Romao

texts.pt:
O Sr. Romao de 39  anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos  uma esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è colaborador na empresa de producao de banana com cargo de  operario Agricola 
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, arros, area, arames, janela, porta e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Romao, 39, is married and a father of two children. One of his children is in primary school and the other is too young to go to school. He works at a banana production company as an agricultural employee.

He will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, frames, sand, wire, a window and a door) and to pay workers to start construction on his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, frames, sand, wire, a window and a door) and to pay workers.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 36-year-old single Syrian man. He has worked as a tailor since 2008 with 6 years of experience to cover his needs and expenses.
Hussein is a hard worker and has a good reputation among his customers. 

Today, He is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car that will facilitate his business. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car for his tailoring business

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en: Abdumajid is a kind man. He is married and always tries for the well-being of his children. Abdumajid’s son Isroil is a student of the third course. He studies in Russia. He will be a pilot after graduating from the university. Isroil studies well. He gets excellent marks. Abdumajid must pay for his son’s tuition but his salary is not enough to do so. He is asking for a loan to pay for his son’s tuition. He awaits your mercy. He dreams of seeing his son become a high quality specialist.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for his son

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a woman with all the spirit for work, who resides in a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. This is a region with good weather patterns that favor crop and animal farming. She resides with her 40-year-old husband and they are blessed with three beautiful children. 

Lydia has been actively involved in mixed farming for the past 10 years and she sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at a local market and to her neighbors. She passionately loves poultry farming. The biggest challenge she is currently facing is lack of quality breeds of poultry that are disease resistant and grow well. To solve this problem she is kindly seeking a loan from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase additional poultry that grow well. Having additional poultry will provide her with practical benefits since she will be able to increase her egg productivity and also sell good quality poultry meat. Through the loan she will increase her profit margins and this will translate to better living conditions for her family. Lydia believes that through proper feeding of her poultry with high quality feed, they will grow even better. Other than profits from poultry she will benefit from chicken manure which contains the highest amount of nitrogen compared to other livestock manure. 

Lydia is comfortable with the repayment period and monthly installments and promises to make payments all throughout the repayment cycle.

loans.use: to buy quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: Marus

texts.en:
This woman lives in the frontier village of Sarigyugh in the Tavush region. Her name is Marus and she has big and lovely family. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. 

Marus, when young, worked at the village kindergarten, then at the village farm, but now she, with her retired husband, is engaged in farming and agriculture. In her farm she has four cows, 90 chickens and also a large plot of land, which gives harvests of persimmons, apples, figs, beans, garlic and onions. She also sells milk, meat, a lot of eggs and poultry. Marus says that she is happy to see how her son helps her in farming, and she says it is great to realize that the farm that she established with her husband many, many years ago and through many hardships, won’t be left without care.

Now she asks for this loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to make her farm richer by buying one more cow and animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one cow and animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is 30 years old. He is married with three children aged between 3 and 8 years. Two of them go to school. He has a book shop and has been selling through this business for six years. With the loan, he would like to buy more books and files for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more books and files for sale.

loans.name: Maria Olimpia

texts.es:
María, tiene un negocio de venta de artículos varios y una pupuseria, su negocio nace por necesidad de cubrir las necesidades familiares; es casada, vive con su esposo de 45 años y dos hijas de 20 y 15 años de edad, su esposo se encarga de atender la tienda mientras que sus hijas le colaboran en la venta de pupusas.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas, condimentos, bebidas, harina, aceite, golosinas, etc., tanto para mejorar el inventario de la tienda como para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera mejorar la atención a sus clientes, tener mayores ventas y una mejor situación económica.
Los sueños que la Sra.: María tiene son tener un negocio más grande y dar apoyo a sus hijas para que estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
María has a business selling a variety of items and a pupusa business.  Her business was born of the need to cover her family's necessities.  She's married and lives with her husband, 45, and two daughters, 20 and 15.  Her husband is responsible for running the store while the daughters help her sell pupusas.

María will use the loan to buy cheese, chicharrones, beverages, spices, flour, oil, snacks, etc., both to improve her inventory in the store as well as to make pupusas.  She hopes to improve her customer service, increase her sales, and have a better economic situation.  

María's dreams are to have a bigger business and to support her daughters so they can go to college.

loans.use: to buy cheese, chicharrones, beverages, flour, oil, snacks, etc., both to improve her store's inventory and to make pupusas

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 60 years old, married and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for nine years. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay college fees for her daughter. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to improve her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es:
José, tiene una familia integrada por su esposa, dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, todos dependen económicamente de José; en su comunidad es reconocido por cultivar granos básicos y vender medicina de manera ambulante, son actividades que aprendió por la necesidad de salir de problemas económicos, lo respaldan 8 años de experiencia, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra de 4 qq de abono para la milpa y antibióticos, vitaminas, etc., para fortalecer la venta de medicina, con la fe puesta en Dios y la buena administración espera mejorar el negocio, tener nuevos ingresos y dar condiciones de vida más dignas a su familia. Los riesgos en el cultivo son las plagas y en la venta de medicinas es la competencia y las fechas de caducidad de los productos.
José anhela tener un negocio mucho más amplio, una situación económica favorable con la que cancelara sus deudas y dará educación a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The members of José’s family, his wife and two children ages 5 and 2, depend on him economically. In his community he is known for growing staple grains and selling medicine as a street vendor. He learned this work out of economic necessity. He has eight years of experience, and his working hours are from 7:00 am to 2: 00 pm.
He will invest in 4 quintals of fertilizer for his corn fields, and also in antibiotics, vitamins, etc., to strengthen his medicine sales. By having faith in God and running his business well, he hopes to improve the business, make more income, and provide his family with better living conditions. The risks to his crops are pests, and the risks to his medicine sales are competition and product expiration dates.
José dreams of having a much larger business, a good economic situation so he can pay off his debts and give his children an education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to invest in 4 quintals of fertilizer for his corn fields, and also in antibiotics, vitamins, etc., to strengthen his medicine sales.

loans.name: Maria Candida

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender ropa de forma ambulante, lo realiza en un horario de 9:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., actividad que desempaña desde su niñez, pues con su madre aprendió a realizarla ya que le ayudaba a vender ropa; María vive con su esposo, dos hijos, su nuera y tres nietos, todos aportan para cubrir los gastos familiares.
El préstamo que requiere será de ayuda para comprar blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc., con variedad de estilos, colores y tallas, tendrá más productos para ofrecer  a sus clientes, busca mejorar las ventas y ganancias.
María tiene como sueños establecer un bazar para ofrecer otro tipo de mercadería a sus clientes y estar más al pendiente de su familia.
texts.en:
María works selling clothing items as a street vendor. Her work schedule is from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm, and she has been doing this ever since she was a child, since she learned from her mother, whom she would help sell clothing. María lives with her husband, two children, a daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. They all contribute and help cover the family's expenses.

The loan she is requesting will help her buy assorted blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. in different styles, colors, and sizes. This way she will have more products to offer her customers. She wants to improve her sales and her profit.

María's dream is to open a store where she could offer her customers other types of merchandise and spend more time with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing items in a variety of styles, colors, and sizes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stylish and new ready-made women clothes to resale for her customers.

loans.name: Filimone

texts.pt:
O Sr. Filimone  de 51 anos de idade casado e pai de 10 filho dos quais 4 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e os 6 sao independente e vivem nas suas casa . Ele e pensionista Militar.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (pedra, area, cimento, barratos e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes de habitacao.
texts.en:
Filimone, 51, is married and a father of ten children. Four of his children are in primary and secondary school, and six are independent and live in their own houses. He is a military pensioner. 

With this loan, he will buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, and bars) and pay workers to continue construction on his house. 

His greatest challenge is to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, sand, cement, and bars) and to pay workers.

loans.name: Nia Moja Group

texts.en:
Jemima is in her early 50's. She is married with 5 children, one of whom is still in school while the other 4 are grown-ups.  

Jemima has been selling charcoal for 2 years now. She works every day from 7am until 6pm, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Jemima's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She has already successfully repaid her first loan which she used to increase her stock of charcoal. She used her profits to not only pay the college fees for her child in school but also cover the household expenses.  

Jemima will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to meet customer demand. She dreams of expanding her sales of charcoal to different areas.

Jemima will share this loan with her loan group "NIA MOJA" which consists of 9 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes sells frozen foods, a variety of vegetables and ingredients within her local community. She is 41 years old, married and is blessed with four children. The couple has been working hard to sustain their daily necessities in life.  Mercedes is also engaged in hog raising as an additional source of income.  

With her determination to increase her income she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000.  She will use this loan to buy a  variety of vegetables, ingredients and frozen foods to sell.  Mercedes hopes and prays that she will keep her business profitable.  In this way, she could sustain her family's basic necessities and send her youngest child to school.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, ingredients and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Leticia Nathaly

texts.es:
Leticia, utilizó el préstamo anterior para reparar el freezer que utiliza para almacenar las bebidas que ofrece en la venta de pupusas, así como también materia prima para elaborar dicha venta, el impacto es positivo pues su capacidad de pago ha mejorado, su estilo de vida familiar es más confortable y ha incorporado la venta de comida.
Nuevamente está solicitando capital para comprar carnes, quesillo, harina, aceite, verduras, bebidas, etc., para elaborar la venta de comida y pupusas, con la nueva inversión espera ir ganando popularidad y mejorando la situación económica familiar.
texts.en:
Leticia used her previous loan to repair the freezer she uses to store the drinks she sells with her pupusas. She also bought ingredients to make her food. The loan had a positive impact on her business because her payment ability has improved, her family's lifestyle is more comfortable, and she has incorporated other food sales to the business.

She is requesting capital again to buy meats, cheese, flour, oil, vegetables, drinks, etc. to continue selling pupusas and other foods. She hopes this new investment will allow her to gain more popularity and continue improving her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, cheese, flour, oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
