Jena is a 37-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store. Her husband also earns an additional income through fishing.

Jena needs additional capital for the ventures. She is requesting to take a loan to buy more stock of rice, canned goods, noodles, soap, detergents, condiments, and a new boat engine for the fishing boat.

This loan will definitely help her and her husband with the improvement of their businesses, thus generating more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, canned goods, noodles, soap, detergents, condiments, and a new boat engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Gildreth

texts.en:
Gildreth is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Gildreth is engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Gildreth is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items for the business. This will enable them to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Gildreth hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items for her fishing business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Mercy. She used her first Kiva loan to start running her Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan helped her to purchase a trading booth, which she uses to serve her customers’ money sending needs. She also bought a mobile phone, which she uses to facilitate her transactions. Mercy wants to let her Kiva lenders know that opening her own business has empowered her and she is able to contribute to her household and send her 4-year-old son to nursery school.

Mercy is now applying for a second Kiva loan, which she plans to use to finance her business by adding to her working capital float. This is the money that she uses to serve customers on a daily basis. These funds will ensure that Mercy has enough money to fulfill her customers’ transactions. This then helps to increase her commissions, which she depends on for her income. This also makes sure she never has to turn away customers who need to transact.

Mercy is positive that once she receives her loan, her revenue will double and she will be able to improve her education through distance learning. She would like to go back to school and get a Bachelors degree so that she can be a good example for her son. Mercy thanks the Kiva lenders for their support with the growth of her Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: to finance her mobile money transfer business by adding to her working capital float.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen  is a 49-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Hellen has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Hellen described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Hellen's Group will be able to plant a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Mannon

texts.ru:
Маннон простой житель одного из районов Республики Таджикистана под названием Конибодом. Конибодом не малый район, но не оживленный. Многие мужчины из Конибодома находятся заграницей на заработках. Маннон женат и имеет двоих детей в возрасте 5 и 3 лет. Он не смог и не стал оставлять семью, чтобы уехать заграницу на заработки. На сегодняшний день Маннон имеет магазин, где занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров и стройматериалов. В продаже ему помогает младший брат. 
  Маннон обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить грузовую машину марки "Лабо". Параллельно с торговой деятельностью Маннон будет предоставлять услуги по перевозке больших грузов на грузовой машине. Он будет получать дополнительный доход и что поможет семье улучшить финансовое положение.
texts.en:
Mannon is a simple resident of one of the districts of the Republic of Tajikistan called Konibodom. Konibodom is not a small area but it is also not vibrant. Many men from Konibodom have gone abroad for work. Mannon is married and has two children aged five and three. He could not, and did not, leave his family to go abroad for work. Currently, Mannon has a store where he sells household goods and building supplies. His younger brother helps him with sales.

Mannon applied for a loan in order to buy a Labo brand truck". In parallel with his trade activities, Mannon will offer transportation services of heavy loads on a truck. He will generate additional income and that will help the family to improve their financial position.

loans.use: to purchase a Labo brand truck

loans.name: Malyka

texts.en: Malyka is a 23-year-old accountant in a company and she is also a fourth-year student at university. She is from the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Being an accountant, she can earn approximately $3 per day. Due to a shortage of finances to pay her tuition fee for the last year at university, Malyka would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to graduate successfully in order to build her future. After graduation, she wants to find a better job to save money to run her own business

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Sreyneak

texts.en:
Sreyneak is a 20-year-old single teacher and also a second-year student at a university.  She is from the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia.  She has been a teacher since 2013, earning approximately $4.33 per day.  

Due to a lack of finances, Sreyneak would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fee. This loan will help her to achieve her future dreams.  After graduation, she wants a proper job with reasonable salary so she will be able to save money to have a new house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Muhrinigor

texts.en:
Muhrinigor comes from southern Tajikistan.  She is a very hardworking woman.  Muhrinigor is divorced and has no children.  She is 34 years old. 

Muhrinigor has been busy with farming business.  She grows variety of vegetables. She sells the harvest in a local market. 
Muhrinigor lives with parents and sisters. The members of her family are 7.  Muhrinigor has additional income from sewing.  She sews for her clients different items clothes. 

Muhrinigor is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.  

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy catering equipment and start a catering business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a married woman and the mother of four children from Iloilo, Philippines. Josie and her husband have been in the fishing business for several years now. 

Josie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and outriggers. This loan will help Josie and her husband in improving their fishing business thus increasing their income. 

In the future, Josie wants to expand their fishing venture so that it will generate more revenue necessary for their needs, especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and outriggers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a resident of Laguna, Philippines. She has children and she is working in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Juliet is a Roving Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operations and collects other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Juliet, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and having no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Juliet is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in paying them back since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for her tricycle unit.

Juliet wants to be free from all her debt and become financially stable someday. She dreams of giving her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.



** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for her balance on her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 38 years old and a single mother of two children. She does poultry farming and has been in this business for two years.

She plans to use this loan to buy more chicks for rearing, chick feeders and feed as well. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and supply chicken to the market and hotels, make more income and be able to provide for her family and live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing, poultry feeders and poultry feed.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 54 years old, married, and has five children. One of her children is in school.

Vivencia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Vivencia requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Vivencia has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
Omar, cultiva maíz y pipián,  el maíz lo vende en diferentes etapas que son jilote, elote y en grano, ya tiene 12 años de tener su negocio propio, para trabajar alquila los terrenos, su familia trabaja junto a él, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, sus labores inician a las cinco de la mañana y finalizan a las dos de la tarde. Omar esta soltero, es un joven que vive en una misma casa con su madre y hermanos.
El capital será de ayuda para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que podrá preparar la tierra para cultivar maíz, le permitirá tener trabajo permanente en la época de verano y distribuir el producto a sus clientes en el mercado, los riesgos son las diferentes plagas que afectan los cultivos.
Omar sueña con alquilar más tierras para diversificar y ampliar sus cultivos, así como también mantener la estabilidad de su negocio y continuar ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Omar grows corn and squash. He sells the corn in various forms such as baby corn, fresh ears of corn and corn kernels. He has now had his own business for 12 years. For work he leases the land. His family works with him. He learned this trade from his parents. His work begins at five in the morning and ends at two in the afternoon. Omar is a young, single man, living in the same house with his mother and siblings.

The capital will be useful to buy agricultural supplies so he will be able to prepare the land for growing corn. It will allow him to have permanent work for the summer season and distribute the product to his customers at the market. The risks are the various pests that affect the crops.

Omar dreams of leasing more land in order to diversify and expand his crops and the stability of his business, as well as continue supporting his family financially.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies so he will be able to prepare the land for growing corn.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 54 years old and she lives alone in Kapan city of Syunik region.  Marieta graduated Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute with the specialty of engineering and for many years she worked in her profession in her city at different factories. For 12 years Marieta has worked at the Kapan city combine. 

Marieta is divorced and she brought up her son alone.  He is now in the military.  Marieta currently has some health problems, but has not had a medical examination because of lack of money.

In order to find out the reason for the weakness and pain that she feels constantly, she asks for this loan in an amount of 210.000 Armenian drams, to receive a full medical examination and find out the reason for feeling unwell.

loans.use: to take a full medical examination and find out why she doesn't feel well.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Wonderful Lenders! The above picture presents to you Naomi, who is a hard-working, creative, and ingenious woman and a passionate farmer. She is a mother of two lovely children. She hails from the Thika area of Kenya, a region known for growing pineapples. Naomi was raised in challenging circumstances and her basic needs were never covered, so she vowed she would turn her life around and live a comfortable life. That is why she started mixed farming, and she has been farming for the past 20 years. Through dedication, hard work and commitment, she has been able to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

Although she makes some profit, she has the challenge of an inadequate water supply for irrigating her crops and even for her home consumption. Most of the rain water is wasted, and Naomi wants to harvest that water. That is why she is kindly requesting a loan to buy a water tank. The Thika area has no piped water, and this means that you have to travel for long distances in search of “this precious commodity.” But, with the loan, she will be able to store water for home consumption. The loan will also help Naomi irrigate her farm. She plans to use the sprinkle irrigation method, so that there will be a high production level on her farm. 

Naomi always says water is a very precious commodity and should not go to waste. Having access to funds is very challenging for African women, but with partners such as Kiva and Juhudi Kilimo, Naomi is sure that her dreams will become a reality and she will be able to improve her living conditions. The profits from increased production of crops will be used to repay the loan and also to improve her living conditions. She also plans to buy more water tanks so that she can harvest as much water as possible. Naomi awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en: Donathille is aged 44. She is married with seven children aged between 5 and 20 years, all of whom go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been selling for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize, beans and sorghum to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Gyavaz

texts.en:
Gyavaz lives in Hatsik village, Shirak region. She is the mother of three children and lives with her children, husband, and father-in-law.
 
Gyavaz and her whole family are involved in cattle breeding. The livestock includes cows, calves, and hens. She uses the milk gathered in cheese and butter production and sells it in nearby counties. 

To sustain her livestock and be able to gather more income, Gyavaz asks this loan. She plans to purchase two cows and two calves. She will be very grateful to lenders for supporting her loan and helping her to develop the farm.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and two calves.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma and her son have been running their farm for many years. Their two sons work and live in Russia and time by time support their parents financially. The farm that Emma and her husband run includes livestock of cows, calves, sheep and hens. They also keep two colonies of bees, as well as cultivate wheat, barley and grass as forage for the livestock.

Emma, to be able to enlarge the cultivation and make her farm more profitable, is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizer for land cultivation. She hopes for the lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fuel and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Aniett Oskaya

texts.es:
Desde sus estudios secundarios Aniett siempre le gustó la idea de conocer los mecanismos de cómo se trabajaba la comercialización y crianza de los productos pesqueros; por eso decidió estudiar Ingeniería en agricultura ya que le ayudaría a conocer, desarrollar y  aplicar la Ciencia y tecnología en los ámbitos de las explotaciones agrícolas y ganaderas que existen en el país. Actualmente cursa ya su último año y se siente muy contenta con el conocimiento que ha adquirido le ayudara a desarrollarse como profesional y de esa manera seguir trabajando en pro del medio ambiente serán parte esencial de sus señas de identidad, así como la tolerancia, la innovación, la creatividad, y el conocimiento de las implicaciones sociales del desarrollo tecnológico, junto a una decidida voluntad de continuar el aprendizaje a lo largo de la vida.
 
Aniett desea culminar sus estudios lo más pronto posible para poder sacar su título como ingeniera en agricultura y encontrar un trabajo acorde a su profesión, de esa manera podrá desarrollar sus habilidades como profesional. Aniett solicita el crédito para la obtención de medios que le facilitaran la realización de su trabajo de investigación, necesita comprar una computadora y una cámara profesional con infrarrojo, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que este préstamo le ayudara a convertirse en una profesional titulada en donde podría optar a otras especialidades, Aniett cuenta con el apoyo de su mama que es contadora y el de su esposo.
texts.en:
Since she was in secondary school, Aniett always liked the idea of learning about the mechanisms involved in the trade and breeding of fishery products. Therefore, she decided to study agricultural engineering because it would help her to learn, discover, and apply science and technology in the area of agricultural and livestock farms in the country. She is currently in her last year and she is very happy with the knowledge which she has acquired. It will help her to develop as a professional and continue working for the benefit of the environment. That will be an essential part of her identity, along with tolerance, innovation, creativity, and knowledge of the social implications of technological development, as well as a strong desire to continue learning throughout her life.

Aniett would like to finish her studies as soon as possible so that she can get her degree as an agricultural engineer and find a job within her profession. She will then be able to develop her professional abilities. She is applying for a loan to obtain materials which will help her to realize her research project. She needs to buy a computer and a professional camera with infrared. She is putting her faith in this financing, as this loan will help her to become a professional with a degree to pursue other specializations. Aniett has the support of her mother, who is an accountant, and that of her husband.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a professional camera with infrared.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit, a farmer from Horom village, lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Anahit's son, after not finding job here in Armenia, moved to Russia with the hopes of a well paid job. Time by time he sends financial support to the family.

To sustain their living, and help her son with daily costs, Anahit runs a farm. She keeps livestock of cows, sheep and hens as well as cultivates potatoes and wheat. Anahit sells the gathered agricultural products in nearby communities and markets.

The requested loan is vital for this hardworking woman to make some investments on the farm. She plans to purchase a cow, wheat seeds and fertilizer and enlarge the farm.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ingaz2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ingaz2. It consists of four women who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Akla is the leader of the group. She is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of 6 children. Her oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest one is 10 years old, living with her family in their own house. Her husband is a pensioner and she works as a tailor inside her house. 

Akla wants to provide her children with the necessary needs but the income of her and her husband doesn't enable her to do so. Her children need a computer to use it in their studies and to learn some of computer programs and applications. For this reason, Akla applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a computer for her children.

Akla hopes to furnish her house to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for her children.

loans.name: Meerimbek

texts.en:
Meerimbek is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is his story:

“I have a lot of dreams. One of them was to study at AUCA. As a proverb says: 'Dreams come true,' and I believe in it. I dreamt about AUCA’s education from the seventh grade and had taken extra English classes to get ready for the entrance examinations. So, I am on my way and don’t want my plans to be destroyed.

"I have a big family of six. Two elder sisters are students in different universities and I became the third student in my family this year. My father is a seller in the market and doesn’t have a stable salary. It’s hard for him to pay three students’ tuition fees and daily necessities. We live with a hope that one day three of us will graduate from university, will find well-paid jobs and will support our family. I am too thankful to have such an opportunity and this Kiva loan will help us in such difficult times.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Jorge Abel

texts.es:
Jorge, tiene como negocio una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y crianza de ganado, ya cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, su esposa le ayuda en las diferentes actividades de su negocio, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m., por el momento no representa problemas en el negocio.
Utilizará el financiamiento para comprar bebidas, pan, huevos, golosinas, granos básicos, etc., y concentrado para el ganado, ofrecerá productos nuevos y a mejor precio, con ello busca tener más ventas y ganancias con las que ira cancelando su deuda y dando a su grupo familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Jorge sueña con seguir trabajando para lograr construir una casa nueva.
texts.en:
Jorge's business is a store selling basic products, as well as raising livestock. He has twenty years of experience. He lives with his wife and his two children, ages 4 and 6. His wife helps him with various business activities. His schedule is from 6:00am to 6:00pm. At this time, he does not have any problems with his business.

He will use this loan to buy drinks, bread, eggs, candy, basic grains, etc. and feed for his livestock. He will then offer new products at a better price. He is looking to have more sales and earnings with which he can pay off his loan and give his family a better lifestyle. His dream is to continue working so he can build a new house.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, eggs, candy, basic grains, etc. and feed for livestock so he can offer new products at a better price.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Salome is in her early 50's and is married with 3 children, all of whom are still in school.  

Salome has been a food vendor for 14 years now. She works every day at her mama lishe (food stall) from 5.30 am to 6.30 pm and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Salome's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. She has successfully repaid all of her previous loans which were used to increase supplies for her mama lishe. Salome is doing great with her loans, and she appreciates Kiva and its lenders for all of their support.  

Salome has used her profits to both pay school fees and cover household expenses. She plans to use this current loan to buy any out-of-stock items she needs for her mama lishe business. She dreams of one day owning her own catering business.

Salome will share this loan with her loan group "Pamoja" which consists of 3 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the out-of-stock items for her mama lishe business.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos de 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar,  ya que en esos tiempos solo trabajaban mucho la agricultura  y los padres  no los ponían a estudiar.

 Esta acompañado,  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y son padres de 10 hijos, de los cuales 7 viven con él y 3 están en la escuela y 4 que le ayudan en la agricultura y tres que están trabajando y en hogares apartes, con Santos solo viven  los 7 hijos,  la esposa y un nieto.

Santos  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 8  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño el papá,  para que en un futuro se pudieran defender; el lugar de trabajo  está a  15 minutos y él viaja a pie, en horario de las 6 de la mañana hasta las doce del mediodía 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar la semana de una persona  que le ayude a trabajar en la milpa, ya que un  hijo salió fuera del país y siente que se atrasara para sacar la cosecha, por eso necesita a una persona que le ayude en ausencia de su hijo.  El crédito anterior lo ocupo para comprar tubos de la energía electrifica,  ya que en la casa no tenían  y de donde pasaban los cables necesitaban cuatro tubos para pasar los cables cerca de la casa,  esto le ayudo mucho ya que hoy Santos ya tiene la energía eléctrica en su casa.
texts.en:
Santos is 55 years old and wasn't able to go to school, since back then children were put to work on the farms and parents didn't send them to school.

He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife, who is a homemaker. They have ten children together, seven of whom still live with them. Three of the seven attend school and four help him farm. The three that live on their own have other jobs. One grandson also lives with them.

Santos has been working as a farmer since he was eight years old. He learned from his father, who taught him so that he would be able to fend for himself in the future. His place of work is fifteen minutes away and he walks there. His schedule is from 6:00 am to noon. 

He will use the loan he is requesting to pay the weekly salary of a laborer to help him with his corn fields. One of his sons is out of the country and he thinks he might fall behind in the harvest. That is why he needs another person to help him during his son's absence. 

Santos used his previous loan to install electricity in his home, which they didn't have. He had to buy four tubes to connect to the nearest utility wires. This helped him very much, and today he has electrical power at home.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nhóm 04_Thôn 5_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Tươi is the group leader of the Nhóm 04_thôn 5_Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

Tươi is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children..  Mrs. Tươi operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.  This is Tươi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Tươi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main harship that Tươi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tươi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: Buôn bán tạp hóa

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо молодая женщина, которая  живет в сельской местности. Дилрабо 30 летняя замужняя женщина и имеет 2 детей. Муж сезонно едет в РФ на заработки. Но так как его заработка недостаточно содержать семью,Дилрабо частично работает в одном закусочном официанткой в местном столовой.Но её зарплата слишком маленькая и она не сможет себе позволять покупать товары на бытовые потребности на пример мебель.И так она решила обратиться за помощью в "Арванд". На полученные деньги Дилрабо хочет купить двухместный диван и шкаф. Она благодарна "Арванд"у за финансовую поддержку малоимущим слоям населения.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is a young woman who lives in the countryside. Dilrabo is 30-year-old, married woman and has two children. Her husband seasonally travels to the Russian Federation for work. But since his earnings are insufficient to support the family, Dilrabo works part-time as a waitress at the local canteen. But her salary is too small and she can not afford to buy goods for the household such as furniture. And so she decided to apply for help to Arvand.

With the earned money, Dilrabo wants to buy a double bed and wardrobe. She is thankful to Arvand for the financial support of the poor population.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Bermet

texts.en:
Bermet is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is her story:

“I am a flexible, smart and quick-witted person. I had good grades at school and now I am a freshman at one of the prestigious universities in Central Asia. AUCA provides an orchestra of experiences for its students, who graduate with the ability to direct the future they want for themselves. I am lucky and happy to be here with other bright minds.

My parents are proud of me and support me in everything. It was difficult for them to let me go to study at AUCA, whose tuition fee is so high for my family. We had been told about the Kiva loan to pay for my tuition and decided to apply for this loan. I express gratitude to the Kiva lenders for their understanding and help, which is so necessary for me now.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая мама и любящая жена. Ей всего 21 год. Ее муж занимается ремонтом квартир. Шахноза 4 года занимается кройкой и шитьем национальной женской одежды. Она любит свою работу и идет наравне с тенденциями моды в Таджикистане. На сегодняшний день многие предпочитают надевать платья с вышивкой. Шахноза до этого времен только шила платья. Теперь у Шахнозы есть возможность купить компьютерную вышивальную машинку, чтобы повысить доходность и увеличить количество клиентов. С такими планами Шахноза смело обратилась к нам за кредитом.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a young mother and loving wife. She is 21 years old. Her husband does household repairs for a living. For four years, Shahnoza has been involved in cutting and sewing national women's clothing. She loves her work and stays with the fashion trends of Tajikistan. Currently, many prefer to wear dresses with embroidery. Shahnoza previously only sewed dresses. Now, Shahnoza has the opportunity to buy a computerized embroidery machine, in order to improve profitability and to increase the number of her customers. With these plans, Shahnoza boldly applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Eliezer Obed

texts.es: Eliezer, tiene 25 años, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive con sus padres en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Anteriormente estudiaba y ayudaba a su padre en la agricultura. Hace 5 años tiene su propia finca de café como una fuente de ingresos, la cual asiste y la ha mantenido en buen estado mediante la inversión de prestamos. El café lo vende en oro a intermediarios de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar abonos, foliar y pago de mano de obra para corte de café. Su plan es crecer como productor de café y su sueño es llegar a tener una familia digna.
texts.en:
Eliezer is 25 years old and single with two children. He lives with his parents in a small village near Gracias, Lempira. Previously, he was studying and helping his father with the farming. For the past five years now, he has had his own coffee farm as a source of income, which helps. He has kept the farm in good condition with the investment of loans. He sells the green (unroasted) coffee beans to brokers in the area. 

The loan he is requesting is his fourth cycle and is for 15,000 Lempiras. With this he will buy fertilizers and liquid plant food, as well as pay for manual labor to harvest the coffee. His plan is to grow as a coffee producer and his dream is to come to have a decent family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, liquid plant food to apply to his coffee crops, and to pay manual labor costs for harvesting.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello, world. Meet Margaret. She is a smallholder farmer from Gitugi in Thika, Kenya. She is the mother of 6 lovely children. 

Like many farmers in the region, Margaret keeps a dairy cow. Thika has a thriving market for dairy products, and Margaret has been able to sustain herself through dairy farming for 10 years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with her farm animals that goes deep; to the extent that she names each of them. 

Margaret has aspirations to expand her dairy farm, but, due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. 

From Kiva lenders, Margaret is kindly requesting a loan of 30,000 KES so she can purchase a chaff cutter. This is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into small pieces before it’s mixed with forage and then fed to livestock. This method prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food, hence increasing the cow's milk production. With the money from her additional sales of milk, Margaret will be able to service her loan on time. 

As well, with the increased income made possible with the loan, Margaret will be able to meet the cost of high quality production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Margaret will not take such measures. And, in the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Kochari

texts.en:
Kochari, who has been married for 25 years, has three children, one of whom is now in his second year of college, while another has graduated and is now a doctor. The family lives in Absheron region, but 22 years ago they became  IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their home, which was in the city of Djabrail.

Kochari has been in the repair-construction business for 17 years and loves his job. He has applied for his second loan in the amount of 1300 AZN  to buy new materials to repair his home.

Kochari says, “Dear Kiva organization and dear lender, you helped me a lot. Thank you”.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the quality of his home.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is a married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has a nine-year-old child. Airene and her husband are engaged in the fishing business. For more than a year now, this business has provided them the income that they need. 

Airene is asking for a loan to buy new fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Airene hopes to make their fishing venture sustainable and productive. Moreover,she wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy new fishing boat.

loans.name: Luana

texts.es: Luana, es una emprendedora mujer de 30 años, que reside en una vereda de un municipio en Bogotá, estudió artesanías en la escuela de Artes y Oficios Santo Domingo y dio inicio a este rol gracias a créditos otorgados por instituciones de desarrollo empresarial.   Hace 4 años elabora prendas en línea ecológica utilizando insumos de reciclaje combinado con metales preciosos como la plata, acero  y oro. Realiza sus compras de contado en distribuidoras de joyeros y en  petieciclado. Las prendas  que ella elabora son aretes, pulseras, anillos y broches,  ella se encarga de diseñar, cortar, ensamblar y pulir la joya para ofrece este producto en un local compartido con otros artesanos y deja sus productos en consignación. Ella  vende de contado y por pedido, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m,  a sus clientes interesados en joyería contemporánea.  En la actualidad Luana está aplicando a un crdikiva, primer crédito otorgado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que será inverido en en  la compra de un stand para presentar sus productos en Corferias en la feria expoartesanias y  comprar publicidad (tarjetas de presentación). Luana desea fortalecer su unidad de comercialización y expandir el mercado, así mismo pretende posicionar su marca y dar a conocer su negocio por el país. Su meta a nivel familiar es tener una estabilidad económica y  la oportunidad de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Luana is an enterprising 30 year old woman. She resides in a rural settlement in Bogota. She studied arts and crafts in the Santo Domingo Arts and Trade school. She started working in this area thanks to loans granted by some business development institutions. 

For the last 4 years, she's being making ecological clothing articles. She uses recycled supplies combined with precious metal such as silver, steel, and gold. She shops paying cash to the jeweler and recycle distributors. She makes earrings, bracelets, rings, and brooches. 

She designs, cuts, assembles, and polishes the jewel to offer the product in a store that she shares with other artisans. It is a consignment store.

She sells by order and for cash to the clients who are interested in modern jewels. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.

 In the present, Luana is applying to Credikiva, the first loan granted by Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, she'll invest it in the purchase of a booth to present her products in Corferias, a crafts fair, and she'll also buy business cards. 

Luana wishes to strengthen her business and get a bigger market. She also wants to position her brand so her business can be recognized nationwide.

Her goal is to have a stable income and be able to keep studying.

loans.use: to buy a booth in the crafts fair and to get advertisement material such as business cards.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Nora graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Methodology and Teaching of Elementary Classes. Now she already has 30 years of pedagogical experience. She works at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. She also gives paid private courses of mathematics at her house, both for the pupils who have some difficulties in teaching process and also to prepare the pupils of elder ages for the entrance examinations. 

Nora will be happy if Kiva lenders give her this loan, which she wants to spend on the purchase of a computer and also some methodological literature, which is necessary during her teaching activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and methodological literature, which is necessary during her teaching activities.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school.

Elsa is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Elsa requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her banana farm.

Elsa has been farming banana for 15 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her banana farm.

loans.name: Tynarbek

texts.ru: Тынарбек, 29 лет, женат. Сейчас Тынарбек занимается полеводством на арендованном участке мерою 1,0 Га, где выращивает помидоры и перец. Также в хозяйстве есть 8 коров, 14 овец. Свой бизнес он начал в 2010 году. Ежемесячный доход Тынарбека составляет около 20,000 сом. По характеру он человек очень честный, целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян перца, помидоров и капусты, а также клеенки для парника. Доходы от бизнеса Тынарбек собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие полеводческой деятельности и купить грузовой автомобиль.
texts.en:
Tynarbek is 29 years old and married. Now, Tynarbek raises crops on a rented plot of land measuring 1.0 hectare where he grows tomatoes and peppers. Similarly on his homestead he has eight cows and 14 sheep. He began his business in 2010. Tynarbek's monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som. By character, he is a person who is very honest, determined and hardworking.

With the aim of further expanding his business, he applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase seed peppers, potatoes and cabbage, and also oilcloths for a greenhouse.

Tynarbek is going to invest profits from the business in further developing his crop growing activities and to purchase a truck.

loans.use: to buy oilcloth for building a greenhouse and seeds to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his home.

loans.name: Jose Isidoro

texts.es:
José, tiene una granja de gallinas ponedoras y vende huevos al por mayor desde hace 12 años, motivado por las enseñanzas de un amigo y el deseo de superación inicio su propio negocio con 100 gallinas, actualmente son 500 gallinas; don José, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, su esposa se dedica a la comercialización de gas propano y bebidas.
Utilizará el préstamo para invertirlo en concentrado y profilácticos para las gallinas, dará mejores cuidados a  sus animales, espera aumentar la productividad de huevos, evitar enfermedades en las gallinas, así como también tener mayores ventas y ganancias.
José sueña con tener más gallinas, incluir otro rubro para fortalecer el negocio e ir mejorando el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Jose has a farm of laying hens and has been selling eggs wholesale for 12 years. Motivated by his desire to get ahead and after being taught the trade by his friend, he started his own business with 100 hens. He now has 500. 

Jose is married and lives with his wife and two grown-up sons. His wife makes a living selling propane gas and drinks. 

He will use the loan to buy concentrate and prophylactics for his hens and take better care of his animals. He hopes to increase the rate of egg production, avoid illness amongst the hens and make more sales and profits as a result. 

Jose's dream is to have more hens, get another field and keep improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy concentrate and prophylactics for his hens so he can take better care of his animals.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, trabaja elaborando y vendiendo pupusas, tortillas y ropa, es casada, vive con su esposo, hijos y nietos, todos colaboran para mantener el negocio funcionando, la venta de ropa la realizan de manera ambulante. La buena administración le da oportunidad de seguir mejorando su negocio.
María invertirá en nuevos estilos de prendas de vestir y calzado, pretende ofrecer mercadería nueva y con mejores opciones de compra para sus clientes, espera fortalecer su negocio para aprovechar las diferentes celebraciones que hay en estos meses.
Anhela tener su negocio con bases más fuertes para tener una mejor situación financiera con la que cumplirá responsablemente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
María works making and selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans), tortillas and clothes. She is married and lives with her husband, children and grandchildren. The whole family helps up out to keep the business going. The family works as street vendors to sell the clothes. Good management allows María to continue improving her business.

María will invest this loan in new styles of clothing and footwear. She intends to offer new merchandise and better buying options for her customers. María wants to strengthen her business in order to take advantage of the approaching festivities.

María really wants her business to be stronger in order to enjoy a better financial situation. She will then be able to complete her duties responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy new styles of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic supplies to maintain his cacao plantings.

loans.name: Mohammad Anas

texts.en:
Mohammad Anas is a 26-year-old single man who has owned a generator for six years. He has his own electricity connections business as the State electricity is unstable in Lebanon.

Today, Mohammad Anas is acquiring a youth loan to expand his business through buying necessary cables, which will allow him to supply more customers with electricity connections.

Mohammad Anas hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary cables to provide electricity to more customers.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
El señor José Carlos de 62  años de  edad, vive en San Lorenzo  Valle, al sur de Honduras  y tiene casa propia vive junto con sus hijos y se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de leche, ganado y también tiene un negocio de papelería donde vende libretas, cuadernos, lápices, pegamentos, etc.
Don  José Carlos sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y demás personas de San Lorenzo quienes le prefieren por sus porque les  ofrece buenos productos y buenos precios es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don  José Carlos está solicitando el préstamo para comprar 2 Vaquillas de buena raza y luego poder y vender la leche que producen.
Don José desea que su negocio crezca y así  mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
José Carlos, 62, lives in the San Lorenzo Valley in southern Honduras. He has his own house where he lives with his children. For twenty years he has worked selling milk and cattle. He also has an office supply shop where he sells notebooks, notepads, pencils, adhesives, etc. His customers are all of his neighbors and the rest of the people in San Lorenzo, who prefer him because he sells good products at good prices. He is a self-motivated man with the desire to get ahead and strive day after day to improve his quality of life.

José Carlos is requesting the loan to buy two young heifers of good breeding to later sell the milk that they produce.
He wishes for his business to grow and improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy two cows for one of his businesses.

loans.name: J Damascene

texts.en:
J Damascene is 34 years old. He is married with 5 children, aged between 3 and 12 years, all of whom go to school. 

J Damascene sells food products at the market and has been running his business for 10 years now. With the loan he has requested, he would like to buy more beans for resale. 

J. Damascene plans to use the profits from his business to both reinvest in his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Sr. De Qoyllority Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE QOYLLORITY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de leña,negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "SR. DE QOYLLORITY” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Urcos, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis, Department of Cusco.

The [featured] member is Benedicta. She is 48 years old and married, with 6 children. She works in her restaurant business. She prepares a variety of dishes, such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and meat stews. She works from 8:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m. She has 10 years already in this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients for cooking, such as chicken, meat and vegetables. 

The member in the photo attached to the group photo was absent from the meeting for work reasons, and thus his photo was taken later. 

The other members dedicate themselves to businesses such as animal sales, firewood sales, grocery store and restaurant. 

The borrower is grateful to those who contribute to making this dream possible, and she is committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Richard, who, as the group leader, is representing his group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to 2 children; he is known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Richard joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has learnt a lot from the farming training. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Richard plans to buy a cow.

Among the 8 farmers in Richard's Group, a total of 3.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a glass display case, and beers to sell.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is a 63-year-old Iraqi client, who is married with 7 children. 

Kareem owns a small auto workshop for changing oil and servicing tires. He established his business in 1999. Since then, he has become well-known in the market and has gained a good reputation. 

Kareem's workshop is the only one in the surrounding area. He is requesting a $1,200 loan in order to renovate his workshop, as it has became very outdated. 

Kareem intends to grow his business and develop his skills so he can provide more services to his customers and earn greater income. He aims to not only meet all of his children needs but also improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his auto service workshop.

loans.name: Sharon Group

texts.en:
Asum and her husband are very hardworking farmers. They live with their only daughter in Thangjing village, which is situated around 17 kilometres from town. Asum is the featured borrower of the group, pictured with her hand raised. 

She and her husband cultivate their village paddy field to get some share of rice grains after harvest, and they also engage in ginger, banana and pineapple plantations for their livelihood. She manages all the household expenses from their cultivation, which is hardly sufficient. They send their daughter to school in a nearby village. 

They also have a fishery pond at home, and she aspires to expand the pond for business purposes. She hopes for a successful fishery business since fish curry is very popular among the Meitei community. Fish curry is preferred instead of meat because they have a cultural belief that fish contains more health benefits than meat. For family functions and festivals, crowds of customers flock to the fish markets. 

The loan will be used to buy raw materials and fishes to raise in their pond to expand the pond and sell the big fishes for income generation. She also aspires to buy a half acre of paddy land for her own cultivation in the near future if the fishery business is successful. With the Kiva loan, she will expand her fishery business and save money to buy her desired paddy land. She is very excited to get the loan and wishes success to the lenders. She says, “Thank you, Kiva.” 

The other group members are engaged in cultivation, piggery and poultry. They are very hardworking women and will use the loan to promote their businesses.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for expanding their fishery pond and small fishes to raise in the pond.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of five children who are all independent and have left home already.  

Since she was born and raised in a village, she never had higher education and getting a decent job without an education is very difficult. She has been working in a grocery store since she was very young and she loves this activity. Her monthly profit from this business is 180 AZN.

At the moment, though, she is having some financial difficulties, which is the reason why she has decided to turn to Aqroinvest CU for financial support. With this money, Dilara plans to buy more products for her store. Please support her

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in Electrical.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 31-year-old married father of one child. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives with his family in a Palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon. 

Because of the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon - especially those who live in camps - Abdullah decided to start distributing water in order to cover his family's needs and expenses.

Today, after two years in business, Abdullah is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development so he can expand his business. With the purchase of a generator Abdullah will be able to better provide his customers with quick service.

Abdullah hopes to further expand his business in the future, increase his income, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator which will facilitate his work distributing water.

loans.name: Donkake Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DONKAKE est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Siemona, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments (pâte d’arachide), de tubercules, de l’argile, de savon et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe DONKAKE sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MINATA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte acheter  du sachet plastique et 2 sacs de grain d’arachide chez les grossistes à Baroueli puis le transforme en pâte d’arachide.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de caprins.
texts.en:
The Donkake group is composed of married women averaging 45 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Siemona, Baroueli Prefecture, Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell cereals, condiments (peanut paste), tubers [such as potatoes], clay, soap and miscellaneous items.

The group members are on the tenth solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting high customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso.
Our client Minata, the first one seated from right to left in the photo, is illiterate. She currently works selling peanut paste. She plans to buy plastic bags and two bags of peanuts from wholesalers in Baroueli and then process the peanuts into paste. She retails at the local market, for cash, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 35,000 West African francs, which will be invested in a goat-raising business.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is 45 years old and  has 5 beautiful children. Her main source of income is growing pears, peaches, apples, pomegranates, and  cherries to sell  at the local bazaar. She has been in this business for 25  years and earns 150 AZN. 

The local demand for fruit is very high and customers buy fruit year-round for everyday use. They eat fresh fruit or prepare different tasty and sweet things.

She requests 1,000 AZN to pay for her children’s education and provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education.

loans.name: Nyomo Bei Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called Nyomo Bei, and they are four in number. On average, they are 32 years old, and have three children each. They all live in the Teshie neighborhood in Accra, Ghana. They are friends or neighbors, and also know one another through their income-generating activities in Teshie.

They are involved in small retail businesses, and sell cooked rice and stew, smoked fish, charcoal, groceries, frozen food and food stuffs. In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group have decided to join ID Ghana. This is their second loan cycle with ID Ghana. 

Grace, the featured borrower, is a well-known cooked rice and stew seller. In the photo, she is standing second from the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy rice, tinned tomatoes, and cooking oil from the market to prepare rice and stew for sale. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her children. She is a single parent with three children.

loans.use: to buy rice, tinned tomatoes, and cooking oil from the market to prepare rice and stew for sale

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 23-year-old woman who lives with her parents-in-law, her husband and their one child in a small village of Deogarh district of Odisha, India. She and her husband engage in paddy cultivation and from this activity they make 6,000 INR per month. 

In her house there is no toilet for safe sanitation. She is very aware of clean sanitation and hygiene, and for this she wants to build a toilet in her house for her family. This is why she has requested this loan.

She is very thankful to Kiva and People's Forum for this support.

loans.use: To build a toilet.

loans.name: Shushik

texts.en:
Shushik is from Davit Bek village, Syunik region. She is a teacher by profession working at local village school. Shushik lives with her retired father and 22-year-old son. Besides her work as a teacher, Shushik is also intensively involved in agriculture. She keeps livestock of three cows, calves, 50 hens and 9 colonies of bees. The meat, milk and honey she gets from her farm, Shushik sells locally.
 
To be able to purchase 18 colonies of bees and for renovation of the barn, Shushik has requested this loan. She will be very thankful if lenders support her  farming business.

loans.use: to pay for 18 colonies of bees and for renovation of the barn

loans.name: Donara

texts.en:
Donara is a student living in the village of Hovq. She lives there with her family. 

Donara's parents work in an electricity station and do their best to earn income for their family.  It is very difficult for them to cover family costs and pay for  Donara's education.  She requests a  loan to pay the  university tuition and continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay  tuition at the university.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Devotha is a 34-year-old married woman with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 8; 2 attend school. 

She has sold food for 5 years and will use the loan to buy more beans to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy beans.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 38-year-old mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in a small village in Deogarh district, Odisha, India. Her children are in school. She spends 40% of her income for her children's education. 

She wants to make a latrine in her house so that her children can access sanitation in the house. She knows the importance of sanitation.

She has requested a loan to build a latrine in her house for her family.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Banita

texts.en:
Banita is a 41-year-old mother of two children, and she lives with them along with her husband. 

She is engaged in paddy and vegetable cultivation. 

She does not have a latrine in her house. Her family members have to go outside for sanitation and it's very difficult and unsafe, especially in night.

She wants to make a latrine, and for this she need a loan from Kiva. She will be thankful for this support.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is a 40-year-old married woman with 2 children. Her husband is a driver. 

Elmira has farmed for 20 years and has  good skills. She grows quince, persimmons and other fruit. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. She earns additional income raising hens and cocks.   Fresh quince and persimmon are very delicious and useful. People like these fruits because of their taste in jams and juices. 

She needs 1,500 AZN  to  buy fertilizer and garden tools. She plans to increase her income and be able to repair her house in the future and make it better. 

This is her 3rd  loan and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and garden tools

loans.name: Ilhama

texts.en:
Ilhama is a single woman who sells seeds at the bazaar. 

She did not receive additional education because she needed to work and help her mother. She lives with her mother and sisters in Fuzuli region. Her father was killed in the war at Karabag. 

She is an IDP(Internally Displaced Persons) from the city of Fuzuli. She needs  2,300 AZN to buy different seeds to sell. She thanks Komak and Kiva organizations for their help. 

In the future she wants to open a store and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Noz

texts.ru:
Ноз замужняя женщина в возрасте 51 года. Она замужем и имеет детей. Ее дети взрослые и имеют свою семью. Ноз с семьей проживает на районе Кубадиён вблизи с городком Шахритус. Она работает в школе преподавателем. Ноз любит свою работу. Она вкладывает душу в свою профессию, и конечно же принимает большое участие в воспитание детей. Ноз старается дать детям все хорошее, как любой настоящий учитель.
  Сейчас у Ноз имеется финансовые затруднения, по который ей не удастся закончить ремонт во время, до прихода холодов. Ноз просит в кредит маленькую, не достающую сумму денег, чтобы приобрести не хватающие стройматериалы и завершить ремонт. Вы можете поддержать Ноз в такую ситуацию.
texts.en: Noz is a married, 51-year-old woman and has children. Her children are grown and have their own families. Noz and her family live in the Qubadiyon district near the town of Shahrituz. She works as a school teacher. Noz loves her work. She devotes her soul to her profession and, of course, takes an active part in the children's upbringing. Noz tries to provide the children with the best, just like any real teacher would. Noz is currently experiencing financial difficulties, due to which she will not be able to complete her repairs in-time, before the onset of the cold weather. Noz is requesting a small amount of money that is short by as a loan in order to buy the remaining construction materials and complete the repair. You can support Noz in this situation.

loans.use: to complete repair and prepare her house for the winter

loans.name: Petronillah's Group

texts.en:
"Petronillah's Group is formed by 9 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Petronillah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. Petronillah has been a farmer for 2 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Petronillah isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Petronillah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Petronillah's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Komal Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Every mother wants to earn at least enough to provide her children with education and facilities, to enable them to stand on their feet and to reach the zenith of success in their life. This hope gets shattered daily because of the lack of knowledge, training and capital in rural areas of India. But this group of ladies from Village Dumurkundi of Deoghar in Jharkhand are fighters and do not give up. 

Manti (the lady who is standing with her hand raised),  is a mother of three children. All of them are studying. Their house is made of mud with asbestos roofing. With the help of her family members, Manti is doing an agriculture and livestock business, and she is a role model for the group members. Still, the income she generates is insufficient to support her family. 

She wants to increase her cultivatable land to have higher earnings. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, etc. She joined this self-help group named “Komal Mahila Samuha” with four other hardworking women. The group, in association with MESP, provides requisite knowledge, training and motivation to women to be independent. This group seeks a loan from the generous investors to see their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Wunitira Sibori-Fong - Bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Fuseina is a 40-year-old hard working woman from Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. Fuseina is married and has 4 children. Fuseina is the individual pictured with her hands on the milled parboiled rice among the members who are squatting.

Fuseina is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 17 years. The name of the group is "Malititi Wunitira Sibori-Fong - Bimbilla." She earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Fuseina and "Wunitira Sibori-Fong - Bimbilla" have asked for a loan of 19,900 GHS.  Fuseina’s share of the loan is 600 GHS, which would be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Fuseina aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food, health care and educational materials.

Fuseina thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing

loans.name: Adom Ra Kwa Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of “Adom Ra Kwa” group. She is 32 years old and lives in Egyirkrom in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married with 3 children, all of whom are in school. 

Harriet is a farmer and has been in the farming business for the past 10 years. She has an 8-acre lime plantation. But Harriet's main priority now is helping her husband not only maintain their farm but also cover their children's school fee payments.

Harriet requires the support of a microloan in order to maintain their farm, gain a good crop yield, and enhance their income. She is optimistic that granting her this loan will be a life-changing support for her and her whole family. 

Harriet thanks her microlenders for their wonderful support in helping her realize all these goals.

loans.use: to weed her farm and buy fertilizer and fruit fly traps.

loans.name: Sahiba

texts.en:
Sahiba is 61 years old, married, and mother of five kids. Her children are all independent and have left home already. Her husband earns money for family, working as a butcher. Sahiba has been working as a farmer for 20 years. She raises fruits (pears, apples, cherries and apricots) and vegetables (greens, green onions, cucumbers, potatoes, and so on). Her elder sons sells her produce, at a local bazaar.

Azerbaijani cuisine is very rich and various. People prepare different national dishes from vegetables with meat. They cook basdirma, bughlama, doghramajh, dovgha and others. They also like fresh fruits for dessert, or they prepare different fruit pies, cakes, and fruit juices for holidays, parties, and ordinary life.

Though Sahiba is old, she is still a very hardworking woman. She loves her job and wants to expand it. She applied for 1,000 AZN in order to supply new fertilizers and build a small greenhouse for her garden. She knows that this will protect her harvest and increase her income. This is going to be her fifth loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to build a small green house and obtain fertilizers, for her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new stylish stove for the house.

loans.name: Ebenezer Our Provider Gtoup Group

texts.en:
Aba is a 43-year-old woman. She is a member of Ebenezer Farms Group located at Egyirkrom in the Abura Asebu Kwamankese District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is married with 6 children. Out of the 6 children, 3 are currently schooling and live with them at Egyirkrom. The first child is 29 years old and the last child is 6 years old.

Aba has been in farming for 20 years. She has 4 acres of orange plantation.  Aba also sells cassava and plantain during market days. Aba wants to see an improvement in her farm in the years to come but due to financial constraint, it is difficult for her to maintain the farm alone as it is physically demanding. Her main challenge now is how to contract a micro loan to finance the cost of weeding, purchasing fertilizer and food fly traps to improve farm hygiene and increase crop yield.

Your generous loan support will help Aba to realize all her aspirations. Aba is very thankful to all her micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to weed the farm, buy fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 45-year-old, married man and a father of five children, living with his family in their own house in Dhamar city, Yemen. Mohammed has a diploma certificate and he is the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he saved an amount of money and he purchased a piece of land. He could build a small house on that land. 

In reality, that house is not large enough for all the members of the family. Mohammed decided to further expand it. He built some rooms, but he couldn't complete them. 

For this reason, Mohammed applied for a loan of YER 500,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to purchase construction materials, such as cement, bricks, iron, steel, and flagstones, to complete the building of the rooms and to renovate them.

Mohammed hopes to purchase new and stylish furniture for all of his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, bricks, iron, steel, and flagstones to complete the building of the rooms.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 33 years old, and she is a married woman. She has 4 children. 

Fozia is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time and to earn a good amount of profit. 

This monetary help can bring Fozia closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time and to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane runs a small, but beautiful, farm. On the farm she organizes the cultivation of a large variety of vegetables, including tomato, eggplant, haricot, peppers, and greens. In her small orchard Gayane also grows apricot trees, and she gathers a good harvest in the season.

Gayane, besides her occupation in agriculture, also works as a teacher in a local village school. Her husband drives a taxi, and her elder son is also teacher.

Realizing how important is agricultural income for her family, Gayane asks lenders to support her to construct a new greenhouse. She will be very grateful for the help and support, and she will be able to enlarge her farming business by cultivating more vegetables.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Рыскан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она с 2000 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Рыскан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы. На участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает огурцы, дыни и арбузы. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). Рыскан является одним из 3 членов группы "Тынар". Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота и семян. Рыскан намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Ryskan is 41 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband. Ryskan has a secondary education, and to provide the primary source of income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry since 2000. Thanks to Ryskan's persistence, drive and hard work, today she has 3 cows. She grows cucumbers, cantaloupe and watermelons on 1.0 hectare of land. The combined monthly income amounts to 25,000 som (KGS). Ryskan is one of the three members of the "Tynar" group. She requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock and seeds. Ryskan intends to expand her business, which will inevitably lead to increasing her family's capital.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and organic vegetables seeds

loans.name: Reuben's Group

texts.en:
Reuben is a 59-year-old, proud father of five children. He is a group leader, and he is often described as a very trustworthy person. Here, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Reuben has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Reuben says his harvest last year was good, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because with the light he will have an improved quality of life, overall. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Reuben’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient, hybrid seeds and fertilizer, for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kunduzkan

texts.ru: Кундузкан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Кундузкан - средне-специальное образование, с 1999 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Кундузкан на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров и 1,3 Га земли, где Кундузкан выращивает арбузы и помидоры для реализации. Кундузкан  является лидером группы "Тынар", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Кундузкан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Кундузкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Kunduzkan is 43 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Kunduzkan has a secondary-specialized education, and to provide the primary source of income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to her hard work, today Kunduzkan's business contains 5 cows and 1.3 hectares of land, where she grows watermelons and tomatoes for sale. Kunduzkan is the leader of the "Tynar" group that, besides her, consists of two more people, with three of them all together. Kunduzkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock.
