Kunduzkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and wants to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Rukshana

texts.en:
Rukshana is a 51-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalo for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

She has 6 children and is a dedicated mother who wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales so as to earn a good amount of income for providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales so as to earn a good amount of income for providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy decoration items to start her business.

loans.name: Qakhcrik

texts.en:
Qakhcrik is from Garnahovit village where she is intensively occupied in agriculture. The farm that she runs includes two cows, calves and 25 hens. Qakhcrik also cultivates wheat. She loves her farm, as it fills all of her day. 

She has requested this loan of USD 600 to purchase forage for feeding the cattle (170 packages). She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her loan.

loans.use: to pay for 170 packages of forage for feeding the cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and six pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes, perfume and incense.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is 30 years old, and she is a married woman. 

She is been in business with her beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials.  

Over the years, she has attained a regular list of customers and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to serve more customers time after time. That is why she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time so she can earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently.  

She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time.

loans.name: Saddique

texts.en:
Saddique is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales so as to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales so as to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Jeremías

texts.es:
Jeremías cuenta con cuatro hijos: el primero ya es casado y tiene familia independiente y los tres últimos son excelentes estudiante de la escuela de su comunidad, el es un hombre emprendedor que no le importa qué actividad realizar sino lo único que a el le importa es tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la compra y venta de ropa típica en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que el a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de jornalero en su comunidad y por medio de esa actividad el puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada  para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

El es muy emprendedor en la vida y es por ello que el se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa típica, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta.

La aspiración más importante de el es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos par que ellos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jeremías has 4 children, the first is already married and has an independent family, and the three youngest are excellent students at their local school. Jeremías is an enterprising man who does not mind what kind of work he does as long as he has an income to benefit his family.

His main source of income is buying and selling traditional clothing in his community, since it is the only way he has found that allows him to earn enough income for his family. He works a second job as a day labourer in his community and through this activity he has another source of income to support his family and give his children decent living conditions so that they will be good professionals in the workforce.

Jeremías is very enterprising in life and this why he decided to apply for a loan in order to buy traditional clothing goods, so that he will have more merchandise available for his customers and so make more sales.

Jeremías' biggest aspiration is to build a better home and give his children a good education so that they will be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing goods.

loans.name: Tiwale Group

texts.en:
Bitilesi is 33 years old and married to Matius, 36 years old. Together, they have two children, who go to school. She owns a market stall, where she sell clothes.

She is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders to bulk buy different kinds of clothes, such as dresses and trousers, in order to satisfy her customers' needs. Her ambition is to expand her business, and with the profits made she is planning to start building a good house for her family. Being a woman, she is able to pay school fees for her children without the husband's involvement.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FOKABEN est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Siemona, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de poisson frais, de savon et de l’argile.
Les femmes du groupe FOKABEN sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente NAH, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson frais. Elle compte acheter des paniers de poissons chez les grossistes à Somo.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Baroueli à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de chèvre.
texts.en:
Fokaben Group is made up of married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Siemona, within Baroueli prefecture in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell cereals, vegetables/spices, fresh fish, soap, and clay.

The women of Fokaben Group are on their tenth group loan. With the goal of meeting enormous customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Nah, the first client from right to left in the seated row, is illiterate and is currently selling fresh fish. She plants to purchase baskets of fish from the wholesalers in Somo.

Nah sells [her fish] at retail prices for cash in Baroueli to a group of customers made up of men and women. Nah expects to see an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in goat farming.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, rushes etc.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Rocil is 18 years old and is the second-oldest of the three children in her family. Her mother Cecelia is a member of NWTF and supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rocil is studying toward her Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently on her second of this four-year course.

Cecelia is borrowing PHP 6,000 to pay tuition fees for her daughter Rocil for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Rocil plans to graduate and to be employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 58 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the store for 28 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, etc. She has borrowed and paid back 9 loans from NWTF before this loan.   

Elvie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is one of seven siblings living in Al Mafraq. His father is an engineer and one of his brothers is serving in the military. Ghassan is now in his first year at university studying for a bachelor's degree. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 23-year-old single man, and he has 5 siblings, all living in Irbid. 

Fadi is a student in the university, majoring in media and communication technology in his fourth year. He also works a part-time job as a paint worker. He gets jobs through his father, who is a builder. 

Fadi is now facing some financial shortage in paying the semester fees, so he is applying for a loan to be able to pay for the university.

loans.use: to pay the university fees

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en:
Burastan lives in Gndevaz village, of Vayots Dzor region, with her husband and daughter. Burastan is a well-known farmer in the region. Her only occupation is in beekeeping, and she gets very tasty and high-quality honey, which is sold locally.

To enable her to enlarge her agribusiness, this hard-working woman asks your support. She hopes to receive 27 colonies of bees, which would give her more honey to sell. The loan is very important for Burastan, and she hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 27 colonies of bees

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old single man. He goes to the university to get a bachelor's degree in public relations and strategic studies. He is still in his second year. His father is retired and his mother is serving in the military. 

Ahmad’s future plan after graduation is to apply in embassies and in the military. He is now applying for an educational loan to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and married; she has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. Marilyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years, and she earns additional income by raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Favour Of God Group

texts.en:
Esther is a 62-year-old single mother with 5 children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her family in Abura Enyinabrim in the Central Region of Ghana.

Esther is the group representative of Favour of God Group. All of the group members belong to a registered local farming association that facilitates marketing of their crops and farmers' capacity building.

Esther cultivates oil palm and orange plantations for a living. She has been growing oranges for the past 20 years and oil palm for 8 years. Esther is also a petty trader. However, her main source of income is from the farming activities.

Esther needs a microloan to hire labourers to weed the farm and to buy a fertilizer and food fly traps. It is difficult for her to obtain a microloan from the local financial institutions to maintain her farms.

The income from her farm will help her support her children at home and through school. Esther also hopes to be able to build a small house for her family in five years if she can improve her income. Esther and her group members thank all their microlenders for their support.

loans.use: to hire labourers weed her farm and to buy a fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en: Hadeel is a 21-year-old, single lady. Her father is a construction contractor, and her sister is a tailor. Hadeel loves animals, so she chose to study veterinary medicine. She is now in her third year and is planning to continue, to get a higher degree, after graduating. But now Hadeel is applying for a loan, to help her pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees, in her veterinary medicine studies.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala, 40 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Ghazala needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 50,000  to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. in order to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin is living in the Fuzuli region with his lovely family--his wife and two children. His son is going to eleventh class; in the future, he wants to be a programmer. His daughter in going to seventh class. The family members are refugees from Fuzuli city; over 22 years they are living like IDP (internally displaced persons).

Aydin has been in the poultry business for many years. He raises turkeys, selling their eggs and meat. Today he needs a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy turkeys. Aydin is very grateful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy turkeys to increase his business so he can expand his poultry farm in the future

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su madre, ella se dedica al cultivo de flores (Ginger) la que muestra en la fotografía desde hace 6 años, comercializa las flores a las floristerías que se encuentran en el mercado municipal y ya tiene clientes establecidos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono y tierra negra por mayor para poder continuar con el cultivo de las flores y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ana is 38 years old and a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children and mother.  She has made a living growing flowers (red Ginger flowers, which you can see in the photo) for six years.  She sells the flowers to the florists in the town market, and already has regular customers.  Ana is asking for the loan so that she can buy wholesale fertilizer and topsoil so that she can continue to grow flowers and also get a better profit.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fertilizer and topsoil.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen is a 19-year-old single lady majoring in English language and translation. She is now in her second year. Niveen has six siblings and working parents. Her father is a taxi driver and her mother is a tailor. 

Due to some financial problems her parents were not able to pay Niveen’s semester fees, so she is requesting a loan to help her pay the semester fee.

loans.use: to help her pay the semester fee.

loans.name: Djaria

texts.fr: Djaria une femme âgée de 30ans se bat chaque fois pour apporter son nécessaire à sa petite famille composée de son mari et de 03 enfants. Les deux premiers sont scolarisés. Elle revend des céréales(mil, sorgho, mais) et des tubercules(ignames...) à domicile.Son approvisionnement se fait dans les villages du TOGO. Elle espère faire fructifier son activité c'est pour cela, Djaria sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. il espère vendre en gros et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Djaria is a 30-year-old woman. She struggles every day to support the needs of her small family, consisting of her husband and three children. The oldest two are in school. She offers grains (millet, sorghum, maize), and tubers (yams, etc.) for resale at home. Her supply is produced in the villages of Togo. 

She hopes to make her business fruitful, which is why Djaria is requesting her first loan in order to buy more goods. She hopes to sell wholesale and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grains and tubers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 41 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She sells motorcycle spare parts, and the business has been profitable. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts to sell. These include rims, tubes and wheels. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest and hardworking. He operates a carpentry shop, where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all types. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of finance.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy carpentry materials. His business goal is to own a big workshop, within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials for building furniture

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 29 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shazia ’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shazia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. 

This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Shala

texts.en:
Shala, age 19, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she has requested a loan of Murabaha of 20,000 PKR to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en: Majed is a 23-year-old, single man. He lives in Al Mafraq, with the rest of his family. Majed is a third-year student at the university, studying to get a bachelor degree in economics. Recently, he faced some financial issues that prevented him from paying all of his semester fees. He is requesting a loan for that purpose.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cafe products to increase sales and income, so she can operate with more credibility and security.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.pt:
A cliente é casada maritalmente e é mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 são do sexo masculino e uma filha com idades compreendidas entre os 12 a 17 anos. A cliente trabalha  no Motel como empregada dos quartos. É cliente da instituição a sensivelmente 2 anos e já levantou 2 empréstimos e com o valor do ultimo empréstimo o cliente comprou sacos de cimento, chapas e pagou a mão de obra. com o presente empréstimo de 30 mil pretende comprar material de construção para terminar a obra da sua casa.
O seu maior desafio do momento é concluir sua obra, e a nível pessoal tem como objectivos futuros construir casas para arrendar e que as mesmas possam servir de fonte para o suportar as despesas da escola dos seus filhos
texts.en:
Claudina is married and has three children, two boys and a girl, ages 12 to 17. She works at a motel as a maid and has been a Hluvuku member for two years and has already taken out two loans. With the last loan, she bought bags of cement, sheet metal, and paid for construction labor. With this new loan, Claudina will purchase more construction material to finish up her house.

Her greatest challenge at the moment is in completing her construction project. At a personal level, her future objectives include building houses to rent out so as to have an extra source of income to help pay for her children's education costs.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, sheet metal, and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he keeps cows. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. 

His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions and animal diseases. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy animal feeds. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more grazing land.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar and materials to partition his shop. His business goal is to be stable within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better future. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar and materials to partition his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small delivery bus.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 46-year-old conservative woman who asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. After her husband's retirement from the military, they saw that they would have to open their own business, as they have 7 children and the retirement salary was not enough. 

So Iman and her husband started a livestock business five years ago with 2 cows, and through those years they were able to increase the number to 15 cows. To make better use of the cows, Iman sells milk and also makes yogurt and cheese to sell. 

Recently the prices of animal feeds have increased, so she is applying for a loan to buy more feed. In the future, Iman is planning to open a dairy products shop to sell milk, yogurt and cheese rather than selling from home.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jeanne Ayabavi

texts.fr: JEANNE est mariée, mère de trois enfants et est âgée de 49 ans, mais vit au quartier Nyékonakpoè puis vend des tissus,des pantalons fripés, des assiettes et gobelets, des serviettes et des sacs qu’elle achète au marché d’Hédzranawoé deux fois par mois. Elle loge dans une chambre qu’elle a louée et a un niveau primaire. Alors, JEANNE sollicite un crédit pour soutenir son activité génératrice de revenu pour s’occuper de la scolarité de son enfant, mieux épargner et améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en: Jeanne is a 49-year-old married mother to three children. She lives in Nyékonakpoè, where she sells fabrics, trousers, towels, bags, plates and plastic cups, which she buys from a local market twice monthly. She lives in a rented ground-floor room. Jeanne is requesting this loan to support her money-generating activities so that she can pay for her children's tuition fees, save more money and have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase 22 towels and 10 bags

loans.name: Ulumba Group

texts.en:
Christina, wearing the red top in the photo, is 29 years old and is married to Patrick, aged 35. With her husband, she owns a market stall where they sell fish. She started her business to reduce poverty levels for her family and to be able to pay school fees for her child and two orphans. 

Christina has requested this loan to buy fish in bulk so she can reach more customers and maximize her profit margins. She is a hard worker and her plan is to open a grocery shop when she has enough capital. As a woman, she is able to support her family and she is independent.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk to sell

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 2 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 52 years old, is married, and has 8 children.

Beatrice likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Beatrice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Beatrice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Elnura

texts.en:
Elnura is 30 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Bala-Bahmanli in the Fuzuli region. Elnura's family have been internally displaced persons (IDPs) from Füzuli city for the past 22 years. Elnura owns cows. She sells their milk and the milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc.) which she and her mother make. 

Elnura now wants to build a stall for her cows which will improve the quality of their products. Therefore, she needs a loan amount of 2,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).

She is thankful to Kiva and the Komak organization for this loan. In the future, to increase her business, Elnura wants to buy more cows.

loans.use: to build a stall for her cows

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Imperio Group

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 14 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas de clima cálido, húmedo y tropical con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Martha es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por el comercio (la primera de la derecha, blusa lila, pantalón jean). Su vida la realiza con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con actividades como; venta de refrescos, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, y librería, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, ella cocina comidas como; Locro de gallina (pollo frito hervido), Majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz amarillo, huevo frito, plátano frito), Lagua de choclo (sopa de choclo con carne), Capirotada (sopa de huesos, con queso rallado),  Masaco de yuca (yuca hervida, carne deshidratada, al horno), entre otros.  Su labor la realiza de lunes a domingo porque en el lugar el comercio es constante y no tiene descanso. Sus clientes con constantes porque conocen el sabor y la buenas recetas de la comida, eso hace que su negocio sea exitoso.  Su sueño es tener un restaurante amplio donde pueda ofrecer variedades de comidas tradicionales. Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de mesas y sillas porque las que tiene están viejas y algunas rotas, y no dan una buena impresión a los clientes. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para cumplir su sueño de tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old and single. She has a fourteen-year-old son and works selling traditional food. She is a good mother and a hard worker. She is independent, persevering, patient, and responsible. She runs her business in the southern area of the city, known for its commercial activity. The weather is warm, humid, and tropical in the city, with year-round constant temperatures of 30 degrees Celsius (86 F).

Martha is the first person from the right in the picture, wearing a pink shirt and jeans. Her skin is dark, her height is average, and she has long black hair. Quechua is her first language, and she speaks Spanish for work. She lives with her son, who is in school. They own a brick house, which has water and electricity. 

The need to expand her business led her to form a communal bank with people in other businesses in order to apply for a loan and meet her goals. The other members work selling soft drinks, selling baby clothes, selling fried potatoes, at a neighborhood store, at a butcher shop, selling sandwiches, making plaster crafts, and at a bookstore. 

Martha works selling traditional food. She makes things like "locro de gallina" (boiled fried chicken), "majadito de charque" (dried meat, yellow rice, fried egg, and fried plantain), "lagua de choclo" (corn soup with meat), "capirotada" (bone soup with grated cheese),  "masaco de yuca" (oven-baked boiled cassava and dried meat), and other dishes. She works Monday through Sunday because her business is constant and she has no rest. Her customers are regulars, because they know the flavor and the good recipes of her food, which make her business successful. 

Her dream is to have a big restaurant where she could offer a wide variety of traditional dishes. She wants to expand her business by purchasing tables and chairs, because the ones she has are old and some of them are broken. This is her fourth loan with this organization and she has been in business for three years. These are the reasons why Martha is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs, so that she can achieve her dream of having a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of pigs so he can earn more money and reinvest it in his business.

loans.name: G.s 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La señora Petrona es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio, su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio que es la venta de pan hornado rosquillas, mazapanes, hojaldras, galletas con piña, etc. su negocio lo realiza desde hace 38 años y se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Doña Petrona su producto lo vende por encargo en los negocios la ciudad, solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de maíz, queso, harina, rapaduras de dulce, leña, etc. para seguir elaborando su productos que es muy vendido y tiene mucha de este, sus clientes le  prefieren por la calidad y el buen sabor de sus rosquillas y mazapanes.
Doña Miriams se dedica a la venta de abarrotera en general desde hace  18 años.
Doña Dilma se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 14 años.
Doña Luz vende granos básicos desde hace 6 años.

Danlí, Honduras -  Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Ms. Petrona is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business. Her store´s primary source of income is the sale of baked bread, doughnuts, marzipan, fried dough, pineapple cookies, and more. She started her business 38 years ago, and it is located in her home. 

Ms. Petrona sells her products by taking orders from stores throughout the city. She is asking for loan support to buy corn, cheese, flour, hard candies, wood, and other items to maintain her supplies and continue producing her products. Her clients prefer her for the quality and good flavor of her doughnuts and marzipan. 

Ms. Miriams has worked in the sales of grocery items for 18 years. 

Ms. Dilma has sold clothing for 14 years. 

Ms. Luz has sold basic grains for 6 years. 

Danlí, Honduras -  November 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, flour, hard candies, wood, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada desde el año 2009, cuando  su madre de actividad comerciante, le entregó unos productos para que los ofreciera y generara ingresos, para apoyar el bienestar de sus hijos en las edades de 14 y 26 años, con quienes habita.  Los productos de la oferta de Roso son la ropa  interior  y exterior además de productos de tocador, perfumería, accesorios femeninos,  juveniles e infantiles.  Rosa para ofrecer sus productos lo hace mediante su teléfono y mediante guías especializadas que usualmente traen muy buenas ofertas, e impactan positivamente la decisión de compra de su clientela. Ella trabaja diariamente sin horario fijo pues lo adapta a los requerimientos de sus compradores, que son principalmente docentes, compañeros de trabajo familiares, vecinos y referidos. .  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa exterior e interior, colonias y en general, artículos que han sido encargados por su clientela, Con esta inversión mejora su negocio en cuanto que aumenta su capital de trabajo y con ello la oferta a su clientela, lo que hace que su credikiva tenga éxito.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old and has been selling various merchandise since 2009 when her mother who is also a merchant gave her some products to sell in order to generate income to support the welfare of her children, aged 14 and 26 years. Her children live with her. The products that Rosa sells are various types of clothing plus toiletries, perfume, and accessories for women, youth, and children. Rosa sells her products through the phone and through catalogs that have very good deals that positively impact the purchase decisions of her customers. She works daily with no fixed schedule as she adapts to the needs of her buyers who are mainly teachers, workers, neighbors, and referrals. 
She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy clothing and items that are ordered by her customers. This investment will improve her business because increasing working capital will allow her to sell more to her clients which will give her success with this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and other products to sell

loans.name: Enyon

texts.fr: ENYON est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère d’un seul enfant, elle habite à Cassablanca et vend des détergents, des sacs et des sachets,des fils et doublures en s’approvisionnant une seule fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé. Elle est aussi maîtresse couturière et a ouvert son atelier de couture depuis l'année 2009 dans son quartier de résidence.  ENYON vit dans une maison qu’elle a loué, dont le toit est en tuile ; elle a un niveau d’étude primaire et se nourrit une fois par jour, aussi se soigne par automédication. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour améliorer son activité parallèle qui est la vente des produits de première nécessite afin d'augmenter sa marge de bénéfices et acheter les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Enyon is a 33-year-old married mother to one child. She lives in Cassablanca and sells detergents, bags, sachets, thread and lining fabrics which she gets from a local market once per month. She also opened a tailor store in 2009. Enyon lives in a rented house which has a tiled roof. She has received a primary level of education and she eats once per day. She also has no access to healthcare. Enyon is requesting this loan so she can sell more stock, increase her profits and meet her child's needs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 rolls of lining fabric,105 packets of thread and four packs of sachets

loans.name: Institut Musaada Group

texts.fr: Madame Cijoli est enseignante et présidente du groupe de crédit Institut MSAADA. Ayant pris connaissance de l'existence d'un nouveau produit credit solidaire aux enseignants disponible à HEKIMA, a retenu son attention. C'est ainsi qu'elle vient solliciter un pret pour réhabiliter sa maison. C’est pourquoi, elle remercie HEKIMA pour ce produit qui soulage les enseignants dans la mise en œuvre des projets d’investissements.
texts.en: Madame Cijoli is a school teacher and the president of the "Institut MSAADA" credit group. Having learned about the existence of a new solidarity loan product made available to teachers through Hekima, she became very interested in this type of loan. She is therefore requesting a loan to renovate his house. She thanks Hekima for providing this loan program, which makes it easier for teaching professionals to implement investment projects.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to establish better pasture and guarantee the feeding of his livestock, principally in the summertime.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires, des céréales et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI  sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. KOROTIMI, 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200Kgs de mil, 200Kgs de riz, 100Kgs de maïs, 50Kgs de haricot et 50Kgs de fonio, 10kgs oignons, 20 litres d'huile alimentaire, 10 paquets de cube Maggi, 2kgs de sels, 10kgs de l’ail, 5kgs de poissons fumé. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are on average 32 years old with three children and all live in extended traditional families in Yangasso/Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali Republic).

These women met through family contacts and trade in food products, cereals and condiments. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, this is the seventh loan for the women of the Tiessiri solidarity group. Korotimi, the second woman from left to right in the photo; plans to use her loan to buy 200kg of millet, 200kg of rice, 100kg of corn, 50 kg of beans, 50 kg of fonio, 10 kg of onions, 20 litres of cooking oil, 10 packets of Maggi cubes, 2 kg of salt, 10 kg of garlic, and 5 kg of smoked fish. She buys her supplies locally and in neighboring villages. She sells her products to a mixed clientele for cash and often for credit.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 FCFA which she will use to pay for health care, food, clothing, and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder in the business.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bibishe est commerçante, membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Alpha», âgée de 32 ans, divorcée, mère de 7 enfants dont 3 étudient et 4 n’étudient pas. La cliente est vendeuse des braises. Elle étale sa marchandise sur la rue dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de sa famille. Il y a 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bibishe is a trader and a member of the Alpha business group. She is 32 years old, divorced, and has seven children, three of whom are in school.

Bibishe sells charcoal, which she lays out on a busy street in her town. She started her business with funds from her family and has been running her business for six years.

This new loan will help her buy three sacks of charcoal. In this way, she hopes to send her children to school, and buy them clothes and food.

Bibishe would like to thank Hekima for its work to ensure the independence of women entrepreneurs without access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 35 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 1.5 years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells posho, maize flour, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, salt, bread, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more inventory and will help Ronald to generate greater profits. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy posho, maize flour, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, salt for his general store

loans.name: Amna Group

texts.en:
Amna is the same group which applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders. This group consists of four women and they applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Amna is the same leader of the group. She applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more fabrics, incense and perfume to sell door to door in her area. That loan helped her very much in increasing and enlarging her business. 

She was able to export her goods (which are perfumes, incense, ready made women's clothes and other goods) to her relatives in Saudi Arabia for them to sell. 

Amna is warmly thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan. In fact, Amna couldn't complete the first loan and applied for a concurrent loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase more goods (fabrics, perfume, incense) to export to Saudi Arabia. Her relatives there sell them and earn a good amount of money.

Amna hopes to be financed in this loan too.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, incense and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est mariée et jeune maman d’un enfant. Elle a 21 ans et habite dans le quartier Adidogomé, coté ouest de Lomé. Pour contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille, Adjovi a commencé depuis 2012 le commerce des sacs de sortie et des bijoux. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et consacre à son activité plus de 6h de temps par jour. Afin d’augmenter son profit, et vu que son stock de bijoux est entièrement épuisé, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter trois douzaines et demi d’ensemble collier et 3 sacs de sortie.
Le profit lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de roulement.
texts.en: Adjovi is married and the young mother of one child. She is 21 years old and lives in Soviépé, a western district of Lomé. Adjovi started selling jewellery and bags in 2012 so that she could contribute to the family expenses. She gets her supplies at a local market and works over 6 hours a day. In order to increase her profits, she is requesting a loan with which to buy 42 necklaces and 3 bags. The profit she makes will increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy necklaces and bags

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgé(e) de 45 ans. Elle est mariée à un soudeur.  Elle a 02 enfants. Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse de jus et eau depuis un certain moment et sollicite un troisième prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle désire créer d'autres points de vente et bien élever les enfants grâce aux profits dégagés.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 45-year-old woman. She is married to a welder. She has two children. Abby has worked as a juice and water reseller for a while, and is requesting her third loan to buy more merchandise. She wants to create new distribution locations and to raise her children well thanks to her profits.

Ablavi requested her first loan from WAGES to purchase mineral water.

loans.use: To buy mineral water for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 46 años tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones donde ofrece prendas de vestir como ropa exterior, gorros, fajones, cojines, articulos de lencería etc; Maria inició su negocio hace 6 años, pues desde muy niña tenia la inclinación por el arte de confeccionar y logró elaborar blusas, faldas, pantalones, etc. Poco a poco desde que inició su negocio, ha logrado tener clientes fijos que la reconocen por la calidad con que elabora las prendas de vestir y porque los fabrica a la medida de los requerimeientos de sus compradores. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito,  trabajando todos los dias, desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche sin cesar, pues su meta es ampliar la infraestructura de su taller y mejorar los ingresos, para apoyar mucho mas, la gestión de bienestar que realiza  su esposo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como telas, hilos, accesorios, con el fin de elaborar diseños adaptados a las festividades de final de año que se acercan y que hacen que su negocio genere mas ventas y con ello nuevos ingresos, pues planea elaborar vestidos para damas a todo costo, con diseños elegantes que realzan la belleza corporal de su clientela, quienes en el mes de Diciembre necesitan lucir elegantes para celebrar las fiestas familiares en navidades y despedida del año, además de asistir a graduaciones, primeras comuniones, bautizos, matrimonios, que en esta época se incrmentan. Con esta inversión logrará impactar a su clientela,  porque sin que tengan que anticiparle dinero, para elaborar sus vestidos, tendran los mas lindos diseños, que comprados por Maria,  a crédito o de contado,  de acuerdo con las solicitudes de sus compradores y esto es justamente lo que beneficia su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and has a small sewing shop where she sells clothing items like outerwear, hats, pillows, lingerie items, etc. She started her business six years ago because ever since she was little she liked sewing and even managed to make blouses, skirts, pants, etc. Ever since she started her business, little by little she has been able  to get regular customers who know her for the quality of her work and because she custom-tailors the clothing items that she makes for her buyers. She charges cash or credit and works every day from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. She doesn't stop because her goal is to increase her shop's infrastructure and improve her income so that she can better support her husband in managing their household. 

Maria is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which will be her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy materials and supplies like fabric, thread, and accessories, in order make items designed for the approaching holidays and the new year, which always generate more sales for her business and in turn, more income. She plans to make all kinds of women's dresses, using elegant designs that enhance the customers' figure. Her customers need to look nice during the month of December in order to celebrate Christmas and New Year's with their families, and must also attend graduations, first communions, baptisms, and weddings, which always become more frequent this time of year. 

This investment will have an effect on her customers, because they won't have to give her money in advance for her to make their dresses, and they will have the most beautiful designs, which Maria will be able to buy in cash or on credit, depending on her buyers' requests, which is precisely what most benefits her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Révolution Group

texts.fr: Zawadi est commerçante, trésorière d’un collectif d’affaires «Révolution», âgée de 30 ans, mariée à un agent d’une organisation de la société civile, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient et 1 est encore bébé. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Elle va acheter 80 sacs de farine de maïs et haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Zawadi is a storekeeper, and treasurer of the business group Revolution. She is 30 years old and married to an agent of a civil society organisation. They have four children of whom three go to school and one is still a baby. This client has been selling food products in a local market for 14 years. She started her business with funds given to her by her husband. She plans to buy 80 sacks of cornflour and beans. In this way she hopes to increase her capital, send her children to school, clothe them, and feed them. Finally, she sends her heartfelt thanks to Hekima for helping non-bankable, but business-minded women to become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 80 sacks of cornflour and beans.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 31 years old and married. Together with his wife, they are blessed with four school going children. 

He has been in farming as a primary business and at the same time runs a transport business for the last two years. He earns a monthly income of 16,000 KES.
	 		
He has applied for his second loan of 67,500 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy animal feed.                                                                                          

Ben will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs and buy more cattle. He hopes to grow his business, and to be stable in his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Daysi Marilu

texts.es:
Daysi, mantiene  el negocio de cultivo de maíz y pipían como su fuente de ingresos, el préstamo anterior le facilito recursos económicos con los que pudo comprar insumos agrícolas para mejorar la cosecha, abastecer a sus clientes y tener mejores ingresos, su familia está siempre unida y con un mejor estilo de vida.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en abono, fertilizantes, semilla y herbicidas para preparar el terreno en el que realizará el cultivo de maíz, se esforzara por sacar el mejor provecho de la nueva inversión.
texts.en:
Daysi continues her business of growing corn and squash, which is her main source of income.  The previous loan gave her the financial resources to buy farming supplies for improving her harvest, supplying her clients, and getting better income.  Her family is always close and now has a better lifestyle.

She is again asking for a loan to invest in manure, fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides so that she can prepare the land where she grows the corn.  She is working hard to get the best advantage out of the new investment.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides to prepare the land where she grows corn.

loans.name: Sandra Enesifora

texts.es:
Sandra, se encuentra acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida, sus hijos de 20, 15 y 12 años de edad; el negocio que ella atiende consiste en una venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, el cual aprendió dentro de su familia y por la necesidad de ayudar en los gastos de su hogar lo tomo como actividad económica, lo atiende sola de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, por el momento no representa dificultades. 
El capital será de utilidad para comprar maíz y gas propano para elaborar la venta de tortillas, ahorrar en la compra de materia prima, mejorara la productividad y utilidades de su negocio, las dificultades son la variación de los precios de los insumos.
Sandra sueña con tener siempre su negocio en el mercado para ayudar a sus hijos a que se superen a académicamente.
texts.en:
Sandra, who is in a relationship, lives with her life partner and their children 20, 15, and 12 years. She has served for two years as a tortilla seller. She learned to make tortillas from her family and began because she needed to help with household expenses. She does this work as an economic activity, working from seven in the morning to five in the evening. At the moment, she reports no difficulties.

The capital will be useful to buy corn and propane gas to produce and sell tortillas. She will save on the purchase of ingredients, improve productivity, and improve the profits of her business. Her challenge is the cost of ingredients. 

Sandra dreams to always have her business in the market and to help her children succeed academically.

loans.use: to purchase corn and propane gas to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su hija de 20 años de edad y su madre, es casada; en su familia aprendió a vender bebidas refrescantes y frutas congeladas cubiertas de chocolate, de manera independiente lo realiza hace 2 años, de ocho de la mañana a siete de la tarde.
Comprará sodas, jugos, agua, boquitas, pasta de chocolate, sandias,  guineos, naranjas, etc., surtirá mejor su negocio, atraerá nuevos clientes, espera mejorar sus ingresos para que le sirvan de respaldo en el pago de su deuda. La dificultad es que el negocio depende del servicio eléctrico.
La visión de Sandra es tener un negocio que abastezca las necesidades de sus clientes, mejorar la situación financiera para disminuir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her 20-year-old daughter and her mother. She is married. Her family taught her to sell soft drinks and frozen chocolate-covered fruits. She has done this work independently for 2 years. She works from 8 am to 7 pm. 

She will buy sodas, juices, water, snacks, chocolate paste, watermelons, bananas, oranges, and more to better stock her business, attract new customers, increase her income, and she expects to repay her debt faithfully. 

Her challenge is that the business depends on the electricity remaining on. 

Sandra’s vision is to have business that caters to the needs of its customers, improve the financial situation of her family and reduce their needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for chocolate-covered frozen fruit

loans.name: Tabith

texts.en:
Tabith is 34 years old, a single mother with two  children one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has been operating a grocery store in Mundri town in South Sudan for the past 4 years.

Tabith has requested a loan 900 SSP through WOYE MFI to purchase items, such as soft drinks, sugar, detergent soap, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Père de famille tous à l’école, Mr Amévi est revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale, des produits divers dans une boutique. Il fait en même temps des photocopies. Il y a un moment où il fait des opérations financières avec WAGES et il sollicite son quatrième crédit pour s’approvisionner en produits d'alimentation générale et machine photocopieuse afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il veut épargner les profits réalisés, devenir grossiste sans oublier que son désir primordial est le bien - être de la famille. Il est à préciser que Mr Amévi est âgé de 54ans et qu’il est dans ce domaine il y a 13ans.
texts.en: Amévi resells general food products and other various goods in a shop. All of his children attend school. Amévi also provides photocopying services. He has been one of WAGES' clients for some time already, and he is taking his fourth loan to buy some general food products as well as a photocopy machine, in order to meet his customers' needs. Amévi wants to save his profits and become a wholesaler, but first and foremost, he wants to ensure the well-being of his family. It should be noted that Amévi is 54 years old and that he has been working in this field for the past 13 years.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products and a copy-machine.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 months and 8 years. The older two go to school. She sells shoes and has been working in a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy bananas and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy bananas and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kyema Kamdin Group

texts.en: Jennifer is a 42-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She wants a loan to buy seeds for planting and pay for labor on weeding and planting. She built rentals to increase his income since agriculture alone cannot yield more income and is not reliable enough. She wishes to expand her business; however, inadequate capital hinders her business' growth.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting and pay for labor on weeding.

loans.name: Oscar Gabriel

texts.es:
Oscar, ofrece los servicios de mecánico y reparación de llantas, desde hace un año que tiene su negocio propio, esta actividad la aprendió al trabajar como empleado en talleres para vehículos, ya con su experiencia decidió independizarse, su horario de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, su mayor ventaja es que en la zona en la que está ubicado su negocio no hay mucha competencia. Oscar es soltero, vive con su madre y tiene la custodia de su hijo de 6 años.
Comprará llantas, neumáticos, parches y otros repuestos que sean de utilidad para mejorar el servicio que brinda a sus clientes, espera poder recuperar la inversión con un margen de ganancias mayor para cancelar su deuda y brindar todo lo necesario a su familia. La dificultad es que está expuesto a un nivel alto de delincuencia.
Sus proyectos son tener un negocio más estable, ofrecer otro tipo de servicios y comprar un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Oscar offers the services of a mechanic and tire repairman. He has had his own business for one year. He learned this activity as a clerk in workshops for vehicles and his dedicated independent experience. His work schedule is 6 am to 7 pm. His biggest advantage is that he does not have much competition where his business is located. 

Oscar is single, lives with his mother, and has custody of his six-year-old son. 

He will buy wheels, tires, tire patches, and other parts that are useful to improve the services he offers to his customers. He hopes to recoup the investment with a greater margin of profits to pay off his debt and provide everything his family needs. His challenge is that he is exposed to high levels of crime.

His goals are to have a more stable business, provide other services, and buy his own car.

loans.use: to purchase tires and equipment for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, tiene una venta de papas fritas, tostadas de plátano y otros antojitos, está acompañada, tiene una hija de 23 años que no depende económicamente de ella; el negocio lo atiende todo el día, tiene su puesto ubicado frente una parada de buses, ahí elabora la venta, por el momento no tiene dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en papas, aderezos, tomates, repollos, condimentos, plátanos, etc., mejorará la productividad y calidad de sus productos, espera tener mejor capacidad de pago y cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
María lucha por tener un negocio más amplio que le genere mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria has a business selling french fries, plantain tostadas, and other street foods. She is married and has a 23-year-old daughter who is not economically dependent on her. She works at her business all day. She has a place located across from a bus stop where she makes her sales. At the moment, she has no difficulties. 

She will invest in potatoes, seasonings, tomatoes, cabbages, spices, plantains, and more to improve productivity and the quality of her products. She hopes she can afford a change in her family’s lifestyle.

Maria works hard to have a larger business that will generate better income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for french fries, tostadas, and other street foods

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, ha utilizado los créditos como herramientas para mejorar la venta de bebidas y fruta picada, su familia se encuentra viviendo en óptimas condiciones, las ventas e ingresos son mayores, ya tiene mejor capacidad de pago.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar gaseosas, gatorade, jugos, sandías, pepinos, etc., al por mayor para mantener la continuidad de su negocio, espera seguir trabajando y progresando con la ayuda de créditos Kiva.
texts.en:
María has used loans as tools to improve her sales of beverages and chopped fruit.  Her family's living conditions are better, her sales and income have increased, and she has a better capacity for repayment.

María decided to get a new loan to buy soda, Gatorade, juice, watermelons, cucumbers,and so forth wholesale to maintain continuity with her business.

She hopes to keep on working and moving forward with the help of Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy soda, Gatorade, juice, watermelons, cucumbers, etc. wholesale to maintain continuity in her business

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, trabaja elaborando y vendiendo pupusas, tortillas y ropa, es casada, vive con su esposo, hijos y nietos, todos colaboran para mantener el negocio funcionando, la venta de ropa la realizan de manera ambulante. La buena administración le da oportunidad de seguir mejorando su negocio.
María invertirá en nuevos estilos de prendas de vestir y calzado, pretende ofrecer mercadería nueva y con mejores opciones de compra para sus clientes, espera fortalecer su negocio para aprovechar las diferentes celebraciones que hay en estos meses.
Anhela tener su negocio con bases más fuertes para tener una mejor situación financiera con la que cumplirá responsablemente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
María works making and selling pupusas, tortillas, and clothing. She is married, lives with her husband, children and grandchildren, and all of them work together to keep the business running. She sells clothing as a street vendor. Good management gives her an opportunity to continue improving her business.

María will invest in new clothing and shoe styles, she plans to offer new merchandise and better choices for her customers to buy. She hopes to strengthen her business to take advantage of the different celebrations that happen this time of year.

loans.use: invest in new clothing and shoe styles, she plans to offer new merchandise and better choices for her customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a young lady who was fired from her previous employee, therefore she started a a small business selling food supplies. She has three boys who depend on her business for support and tuition for their schooling. 

Through the Kiva loan she was able to get ten improved charcoal stoves, which she will sell and the profits will help support her kids and provide school fees.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, administrando bien los créditos que se lo otorgan a mantenido su negocio de venta de calzado en el mercado y estabilidad en los ingresos que necesita para subsistir con su familia y cubrir sus deudas.
Está planificando una renovación de su inventario por lo que necesita un nuevo crédito para comprar calzado para niños y variedad de ropa, seguirá ofreciendo a sus clientes productos de calidad e incluirá la venta de ropa como un nuevo rubro.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is managing his loans well. This allows him to maintain his business selling shoes in the market and income stability needed to support his family and cover his debts. 
He is planning a renovation of his inventory. The new loan is necessary to purchase shoes for children and a variety of clothing. He will continue offering his customers quality products and will include selling clothes as a new category.

loans.use: purchase children's shoes and a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as being loving. 

She operates a retail business, where she sells sugar, flour, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a productive area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as being lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a big shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live well. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Jaen

texts.en:
Jaen is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as being loving. 

She operates a farm, where she keeps goats and sheep and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge as being lack of funds. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more livestock. 

Her business goal is to be the best dairy farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy more livestock.

loans.name: Noelis Maritsenia

texts.es:
Noelis, vive con su hijo de 2 años de edad. Como una manera de tener ingresos con los que cubre los gastos familiares hace un año fundo su propio negocio de atender un chalet en el Centro Escolar de la comunidad y una tienda de productos para usos varios en el hogar la cual está ubicada en su vivienda, sus labores tienen un horario de 5:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., su hermana le apoya en sus actividades.
Invertirá en bebidas, golosinas, aceite, embutidos, aderezos, detergentes, gas propano, etc., le permitirá tener insumos para la venta de meriendas en el chalet y para mejorar el inventario de la tienda, con la compra podrá tener más clientes satisfechos y mejores ganancias.
Los objetivos de Noelis son tener una mejor situación económica con la que pueda cancelar la deuda adquirida, mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en el futuro a su hijo para que estudie y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Noelis lives with her 2-year-old son. As a way to have income to cover the household expenses, a year ago she started her own business running a food stall at the community school and a store with products of various household uses, which is located in her home. She follows a work schedule from 5:00 am to 5:00 pm. Her sister helps her with her work. 

She will invest in drinks, candies, oil, cold cuts, seasonings, detergent, propane gas, etc.; it will allow her to have supplies to sell snacks in the food stall and to improve her store inventory. With the purchases, she will have more satisfied customers and more income. 

Noelis's goals are to have a better economic situation with which she can pay off her acquired loan, improve her home, and support her child in the future so that he goes to school and becomes a professional.

loans.use: to invest in drinks, candies, oil, cold cuts, seasonings, detergent, propane gas, etc., it will allow her to have supplies to sell snacks in the stall.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother with one 7 year-old son. 

In her quest to continue improving her business through Kiva loans, Rose purchased six CH-2300 and four of the CH-2200 improved cookstoves, which she will sell and grow her business with the profit.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Maria Elida

texts.es: María, tiene 52 años de edad,  vive en  unión libre con su esposo, reside en San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida junto a su esposo y sus hijos.  Maria se dedica a la elaboración de arreglos florales y coronas con flores hechas por ella. Este negocio lo tiene hace 4 años en su casa y ya cuenta con buena clientela, y lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios préstamos.  Actualmente solicita otro por 4,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materiales y accesorios como es telas, papel, alambre, color y otros para la elaboración de flores y coronas. Este mismo le ayudará aumentar el negocio y atender la demanda de los clientes en esta época. Tiene planes de seguir trabajando para obtener ingresos y darle bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old, married, and lives in San Juan Pueble, Atlántida with her husband and children. For work, she creates flower arrangements and wreaths, a business she has had for 4 years out of her home. She counts on her clientele, and she has been able to maintain her business through multiple loan investments. Currently she is asking for another $200 to invest in the purchase of materials and accessories, like fabrics, paper, wire, color dye, and other items to produce her arrangements and wreaths. This loan, like the others, will help her increase her business activities and meet client demand during this season. She has plans to continue this work in order to earn an income and give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabrics, wire, paper, color dye, and others to produce flower arrangements and wreaths.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel es un señor que se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria en un colegio del sector donde vive, del cual tiene 17 años de laborar, es casado con 2 hijos pequeños a los que le brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene la necesidad  de mejorar su medio de transporte con el cual se traslada a su centro de trabajo, por eso visito a Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en Reparación de su Motocicleta y de esa  manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en:
Manuel is a man who works as a primary education teacher at a school in the area where he lives.  He has spent 17 years working.  He is married with two small children to whom he offers all the support necessary for their growth.

Right now he needs to improve his means of transportation which he uses to get to his workplace.  This is why he visited Ceprodel to ask for a loan that he will use to repair his motorcycle and thus improve his conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a widowed woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Beth describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more livestock. Her business goal is to be the best dairy farmer within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's living conditions. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is 35 years old and widowed with two school-going children. She has been selling a variety of vegetables to her customers, who are mostly residents. She has been in this business for the last eight years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of vegetables for sale. 

Melda will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted green grocery items for sale

loans.name: Leila Mercy

texts.en:
Leila Mercy is 31 years old and married with six children. With three children currently in school, Leila Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Leila Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like cereals, coffee, milk, chocolate drinks, soft-drinks, sugar, diapers, etc. to sell.

Leila Mercy has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, milk, chocolate drinks, soft-drinks, sugar, diapers, etc. 

In the future, Leila Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cereals, coffee, milk, chocolate drinks, soft-drinks, sugar, diapers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
For most people hitting the 40 year mark will mean a life of absolute reliance on their children or immediate family members for livelihood. However, for Melisa life begins at 40. Melisa owns 2 acres of land in Turbo Village, in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She has no formal education and has been practising mixed farming since 2007. Agriculture is fundamental to Kenya's economy. But it is much more than an economic activity. Farmers like Melisa are stewards of Kenya’s countryside and provide the citizens with the option of buying locally-produced food. 

Melisa started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 2 acres, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines and a Poshomill, to help her run the farm. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population. 

Melisa is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Melisa will have more space to expand her business output. 

The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her children who are in public schools. 

She feels blessed to have the support of her husband, through all her undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Melisa's dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to purchase more land for farming.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. Emelia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Emelia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.  Emelia has been in this business for 24 years now.

Emelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her busines.

loans.name: Makanga

texts.en:
Makanga is single man who has no children. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He mentioned seasonality as his major challenge in his business. Makanga dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
