José, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar semilla de marañón al por mayor, con la inversión pretende abastecer su negocio con materia prima a mejor precio. Espera aprovechar lo que queda del año para seguir trabajando, ya que la temporada de semilla está por finalizar y su valor aumenta.
José manifiesta que el financiamiento anterior le permitió tener producto suficiente para mantener su negocio competitivo, pero fue tanto la demanda que no logro abastecer a todos sus clientes, actualmente su situación económica es un poco más estable y su familia está viviendo en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en:
José decided to get a new loan to buy cashew seeds wholesale.  With the investment he plans to stock his business with raw materials at a better price.  He hopes to make the most of what's left of the year to keep on working, because the seeding season is about to end and the value increases.

José said his previous loan allowed him to have enough crops to keep his business competitive.  Demand was so high, though, that he wasn't able to supply all his customers.  His current economic situation is a bit more stable and his family's living circumstances are better.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds wholesale to stock his business at a better price

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 50 years and has 13 children. He is a coffee trader and also does green banana (matooke) trade. He began the business to earn some income. He will use the loan to buy mulch and agro chemicals. His customers are traders. He hopes to have a better income after this financial boost. His challenge is changes in climate which affects her income. He is hardworking. Pictured is Francis with the UGAFODE credit staff (on the right).

loans.use: to buy mulch and agro chemicals.

loans.name: Komi  Anoumou

texts.fr: KOMI est âgée de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfants; il fait le commerce des bidons d’eau et d’huile depuis 2013, s’approvisionne trois fois par mois dans les boutiques et de maison en maison. KOMI habite au quartier Adidogomé et désire un prêt pour augmenter son stock et appuyer son commerce afin de pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle et aussi plus épargner afin de subvenir à ses besoins qui ne cesse de croître.
texts.en:
Komi is 25 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. 

He has worked selling drums of water and oil since 2013. He procures his goods three times a month in the shops and through door-to-door collections.

Komi is seeking a loan to increase his stock and support his business. He wants to satisfy his customers and also save more, in order to support his ever-growing needs.

loans.use: to buy nine dozen containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his degree fees in the business administration program.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, desempeña las actividades de agricultura y albañilería desde hace ocho años, oficio que aprendió de amistades, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en su negocio; vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos de los cuales el mayor tiene 10 años de edad está estudiando 3° grado, el segundo cuenta con 8 años de edad y asiste a 2° grado y el menor que tiene tres meses de nacido, todos son dependientes de Edwin.
Utilizará el capital para invertir en el pago de mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de maíz y la aporreada (golpear fuerte y repetidamente una cantidad de mazorcas de maíz para lograr desprender el grano), tendrá a tiempo el maíz para venderlo a buen precio.
Las proyecciones de Edwin son sembrar más cantidad de maíz para tener mejores ingresos con los que pueda ir cancelando sus deudas y dando a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin has worked in agricultural activities and masonry for 8 years, trades he learned from friends. His schedule is from 8am-5pm, and he now has lots of experience in his business.

He lives with his wife and three children, the oldest of which is 10 years old and in 3rd grade. His second child is 8 years old and in 2nd grade, and the youngest was born three months ago. They are all his dependents. 

He will use the loan to invest in the payment of a labour force to collect the corn harvest and batter it (hit strong and repeatedly a quantity of corn cobs to knock out the kernels). He will time the corn harvest well to sell it at a good price.

Edwin's plans are to plant greater quantities of corn to have better earnings, with which he will be able to pay off his debts and provide his family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for labour to collect his corn harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be honest. 

Ruth operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food for sale. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro de 22 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada para el hogar y para uso personal; El inició hace 1 año su negocio, pues desde muy temprano trabajó con su padre un experto comerciante quien dio a Álvaro ejemplo con su propia experiencia.  En el año 2013 cuando decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios se inclinó por artículos de plástico, ropa para el hogar, calzado, vestuario entre otros artículos solicitados por su clientela.  Álvaro trabaja 12 horas diarias iniciando su día laboral desde las 8 de la mañana vendiendo de contado y comprando a proveedores, con quienes establece negociaciones-yo gano tus ganas-. Su meta no es otra que alcanzar el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su negocio , para finalmente adquirir su propia vivienda,. Su mayor desafío es lograr a su edad  que es la misma de su esposa, alcanzar sus propósitos, pues su inexperiencia  muchas veces le causa inconvenientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante e cual comprará vestuario, para niños y adultos calzado y accesorios ajustados a la temporada de finalización del año, que llega con muchas fiestas y sus clientes y sus familias requieren estar bien elegantes para celebrarlas unidos y acompañados por sus vecinos mientras se abrazan bailan y cantan para despedir el año 2014.
texts.en: Alvaro is 22 years old and works in the sales of personal and home goods. He started this work one year ago, as he worked with his father, an expert salesman who set an expectation for excellence for Alvaro from a young age. In 2013, when Alvaro decided to found his own business, he opted for plastic goods, home textiles, shoes, clothing, among other goods requested by his clients. Starting at 8 am, Alvaro works 12 hours a day, selling his goods and purchasing from his suppliers--with whom he has negotiated a win-win situation. His goal is to achieve growth for his store and strengthen his position so that he may finally acquire his own home. His main challenge at his age (his wife is the same age) is to complete his objectives, but his inexperience often times causes issues. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the main financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, through which he will buy clothing for children and adults, shoes, and seasonal accessories. As it approaches the end of 2014, this season of celebration leads to high client demand to look elegant while celebrating, dancing, and singing with family, friends, and neighbors

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit avec son conjoint blanchisseur et leurs 04 enfants à Lomé. Pour apporter son aide à son mari, Akossiwa revend des chaussures et sacs au marché depuis 2000. Son sixième prêt lui servira de s'approvisionner en marchandises. Elle souhaite développer son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives with her husband, who is a launderer, and their four children in Lomé.

To support her husband, Akossiwa has been selling shoes and bags at the market since 2000. This sixth loan will serve to procure merchandise.

Akossiwa wishes to develop her business and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Maria Julissa

texts.es:
María, es panificadora, vive en una vivienda familiar, tiene 2 hijos, no recibe ayuda económica del extranjero, su panadería la atiende de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para hacer que su negocio sea más rentable.
Ella comprara harina, manteca, levadura, azúcar, etc., para elaborar variedad de pan, podrá producir y vender mucho más, los ingresos mejoraran y así cubrirá las necesidades básicas de su familia y fortalecerá su negocio.
La visión de María es cancelar su deuda sin problemas y mantener a su familia viviendo en un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
María is a baker. She lives in a family house, has 2 children, and doesn't get any economic help from overseas.  She works in her bakery from seven in the morning to five at night. She has the experience necessary to make her business more profitable. 

She will purchase flour, butter, yeast, sugar, etc., to make a variety of breads. She will be able to produce and sell much more, her income will improve, and in turn she will pay for her family's basic necessities and strengthen her business. 

María's vision is to pay off her debt without any problems and keep her family living in a better life style.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, yeast, sugar, etc., to make a variety of breads.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, con ayuda de los financiamientos Kiva está mejorando su negocio, tiene mayor capacidad de inversión y ha optimizado las circunstancias familiares.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y concentrado para cerdos, espera tener una cosecha abundante de maíz y cuidar bien de sus animales.
texts.en: Rosa, with help from the Kiva lenders, is improving her business.  She has a greater capacity for investment and has optimized her family circumstances.  She is asking for a new loan so that she can buy manure, insecticide, herbicide, and pig feed.    She hopes to have an abundant corn harvest and take good care of her animals.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, herbicide, and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en:
Zaverio is 41 years old and has five children. He sells tomatoes and matooke (green banana), in addition to raising cattle. His other income is from raising pigs. He began the business to support the family and create employment for some of his relatives.

He will use the loan to buy more pigs. His challenge is low prices for the pigs he has raised, especially because he has spent a lot for feeding and fattening them. He is however optimistic that the prices will be higher this season because of the festivals. 

He hopes to see his children prosper. He is hardworking and thanks Kiva lenders, through UGAFODE, for the generous support.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Idris joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Dalladi, Uzaifa and Ummaru.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idris would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs for items such as food, clothing and his children's school fees.  With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Idris spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to  meet expenses like food, clothing and child school fees, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 45 years old and a mother to 5 children presently leaving with her husband at their family compound. Her husband is a brick layer. Stella is very hard working and was a manual palm oil miller worker before she being promoted to a machine operator, a task normally done by men. Her courage to handle this area indicates her ever readiness to do anything to make a living. 

This has also made her income to increase since the past two seasons. Her first child to get to university level got admission this year, this has increase Stella’s family responsibility and because of this, she is requesting for this loan to enable her purchase plastic drums to store clients products during the peak season and also part of it will be used to process her stored kernels.

In the future, Stella hopes to have her own palm kernel cracker machine, considering that she spends a lot annually renting machine for this purpose and this affects her income.
She appreciates all Kiva lenders that support her loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm-oil storage containers.

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en:
Jeanine is 29 years old. She is married with one child who is 3 years old. 

She sells charcoal and has been doing this as a business for 12 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in this same business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, está teniendo mayor demanda de los productos que ofrece en su tienda y como los créditos son herramientas útiles para mejorar su negocio, nuevamente hace solicitud de un financiamiento para comprar azúcar, pastas, especias, bebidas, pan, golosinas, etc., que le permitirán cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
El sr. Pedro invirtió el capital anterior en su negocio, teniendo así la facilidad de mejorar el inventario, cubrir necesidades de sus clientes, la nueva situación económica le permite dar a su familia un mejor entorno y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Pedro is seeing higher demand for the products that he sells in his store. Since loans are useful tools to improve his business, he is again requesting a loan to buy sugar, pastas, spices, beverages, bread, candies, etc. that will allow him to cover the needs of his customers.

Pedro invested the previous loan in his business, which allowed him to have the ability to improve his inventory and cover his customers’ needs. This new economic situation allows him to provide his family with a better environment and to pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pastas, spices, beverages, bread, candies, etc. that will allow him to cover the needs of his customers.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, está enfocado en trabajar para mantener su negocio con vida, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar ropa, calzado y artesanías, de esta manera continuar cubriendo las necesidades de sus clientes y contar con ingresos para subsistir junto a su familia.
Con el préstamo anterior adquirió mercancía nueva para que su negocio sea más competitivo, ha mejorado la situación familiar y cancelo su deuda.
texts.en:
José is focused on working to keep his business alive.  He needs a new loan because he doesn't have enough capital to buy clothing, footwear, and handicrafts.  That way he can keep on covering his customers' needs and have the income to survive with his family.

With the previous loan he acquired new merchandise so his business could be more competitive.  He has improved his family situation and he paid back his debt.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and handicrafts to keep on covering his customers' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits, such as bananas, oranges, apples, grapes, and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Obioma

texts.en:
Obioma is 37 years old; she lives with her husband and their 4 children. She is an evangelist fully engaged in preaching Christian religious teachings to rural dwellers. Her source of survival is palm oil processing and marketing. She has been into this trade for over 6 years now. 

She likes this business because it is one of the means of survival in the rural area and also it is sustainable and also gives her enough time to do her ministerial functions. The income she gets from this business is used for her daily expenses and also used to support her husband who is a motorcycle mechanic in caring for their family.

A portion of this loan will help her buy storage drums and also part of it will be used to process palm product during the peak season. 

She thanks all Kiva lenders that support her loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil storage containers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil processing equipments.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sarah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her 3 children. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sarah had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sarah can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than at harvest. Sarah plans to use the additional income to provide food and clothing for her household, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To meet urgent cash needs, and store her harvest to sell it later for higher profits

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be passionate. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in a favourable location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. 

She hopes that in the future she will open a boutique. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly de 31 años de edad se dedica a l comercio de bolsos y también ofrece sus servicios como estilista, actividades que le permiten genera ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su hogar y poco a poco lograr el bienestar soñado.  Su idea de negocio se materializó hace 2 años pues sintió la necesidad de ocuparse de una actividad que la hiciera sentir útil a si misma y a su familia, aumentando los ingresos familiares. Su motivación fue plena y empezó a trabajar en lo que conocía y estaba a su alcance. Los productos y servicios que ofrece Kelly están dirigidos directamente al consumidor final, y su base de clientes fijos está constituida por sus vecinos, amigos familiares y referidos a quienes les vende mediante los sistemas de crédito y contado, trabajando diariamente durante 6 horas. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio e incrementar su capital de trabajo mejorando la infraestructura física de su negocio, para finalmente brindarle una educación de calidad a sus hijos; su mayor desafío es no contar con el suficiente capital de trabajo que le permita el logro inmediato de sus sueños de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará, un secador, esmalte al por mayor, un equipo de manicure, cepillos de peinar y bolsos. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará en cuanto a que logrará mejorar su infraestructura física y tener capital de trabajo para invertir, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Kelly is 31 years old and works selling bags and as a stylist. These activities generate income to support her household and, little by little, achieve the quality of life she dreams of for her family. She founded her business two years ago because she felt the need to occupy herself with an activity that would be both fulfilling for herself and her family, particularly with respect to increasing the family income. Her motivation was high, and she began working within reach of what she already knew. 

The products and services that Kelly offers are intended for the final consumer, and her fixed clientele are made up of neighbors, family friends, and referrals that she sells to on a cash or account basis. She works 6 hours a day. 

Her goal is to strengthen her business and increase her working capital to improve the physical infrastructure of her business. She would like to provide a quality education to her children. Her main challenge is not being able to count on sufficient capital that would allow her to immediately invest in her dreams of prosperity. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan through which she will purchase a dryer, wholesale nail polish, manicure equipment, hair combs and brushes, and bags. With this investment, her business will improve due to a stronger physical infrastructure and having capital to invest, making her Kiva loan a successful venture.

loans.use: to buy a dryer, wholesale nail polish, manicure equipment, hair combs and brushes, and bags.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Ronillo is 19 years old, and is the second of the four children in the family. His mother, Mary Jane, is a member of NWTF, and supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Ronillo is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology, and is currently in his second year of this four-year course.

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 4,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Ronillo for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Ronillo plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Jyoti Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Mala is in her 40s and hails from Virniya village in Deoghar, Jharkhand. The area where she is stays receives good rainfall and is dotted with ponds. Mala has two children, both of whom are studying. Her husband is working as an assistant teacher. Mala has some agriculture land and also does handloom weaving. Now she wants to improve her agriculture land. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other things that will be used for farming. She hopes to make some profits and save enough for her children’s education. She hopes to bring stability to her life and become a successful rural entrepreneur. 

Mala is a featured borrower of “Jyoti Mahila Samuha” Self-Help Group (SHG), which consists of four other members. The other members are also seeking loans to improve their livelihood. Help these hardworking women to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be self reliant. 

She operates a brick making business where she makes bricks to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy firewood, soil for making bricks, and to pay labor costs. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have an improved business. This is her  first  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy firewood, soil for making bricks, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, soil for making bricks, and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be disciplined. 

Jacob operates a retail business where he sells drinks. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of drinks and to add seats to the business. 

His business goal is to own a big pub in town within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of drinks and to add seats.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, fish container, etc. for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, fish container, etc. for her business

loans.name: Saraswati Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Binwa is a 44-year-old married mother of five children. All of them are studying in school. Binwa is engaged in an agriculture and livestock business. Her husband is a carpenter. 

With this loan, she will buy sand, doors, stones, sheeting and iron rods, which will allow her to repair her house.
Her aims for the future are to extend her house to enable her to have a more comfortable family home and to give a good education to her children. She is committed to repaying this loan and intends to apply for further loans to achieve her dreams.

Binwa is a leader of “Saraswati Mahila Samuha”, which consists of four other members who all are seeking loan to improve their livelihood. Help these hardworking women to secure their families.

loans.use: to buy sand, doors, stones, sheeting and iron rods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and vegetables. Grace is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ghungru Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en: Bharti is based in Bandarbasa village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. A few years back, Bharti joined a local NGO called “MESP.” Earlier, she was hesitant to take a loan from this NGO. After completing the training conducted by them on agriculture, her confidence got a boost and she started farming. Her husband is a small contractor and mason. Bharti is seeking a loan to improve her husband’s business as well as her business. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her agriculture. Bharti (the lady who is standing with a raised hand) is the president of “Ghungru Mahila Samuha” Self-Help Group (SHG), which consists of five other members: Suman, Suma, Suman Sita, and Lalita. They all are toilers like Bharti. They all are seeking additional capital to expand their businesses. Bharti and her fellow group members are hoping to get good profits and that their children get good education and jobs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is a married woman with nine children. She is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fernanda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Fernanda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Fernanda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 8 children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, cooking fat and other items. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, flour and other items. His goal is to have expanded his business within 5 years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be industrious. 

Peris operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are women and children. 

Peris describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better and improved life. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Asunto

texts.es:
Asunto es una persona muy responsable y trabajador, actualmente está laborando como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad natal, Santiago. Él está muy contento porque ha sido bendecido con una familia extraordinaria conformada por su esposa que siempre lo apoya en las buenas y en las malas y su hijo que está por terminar el colegio. Cada mañana Asunto sale muy temprano de su casa con la motivación de poder sacar adelante a sus seres queridos y brindarles todas las comodidades que ellos se merecen.
Asunto quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que con el crédito otorgado piensa comprar una cocina a gas para reemplazar la que tiene porque funciona con kerosene. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que con esto podrá vivir de manera más cómoda y así continuar luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Asunto is a very responsible and hardworking person. He is currently working as a field worker at a farm in his native city, Santiago. He is very happy because he has been blessed with an extraordinary family formed by his wife, who always supports him in things good and bad, and his son, who is about to finish high school. Every morning Asunto leaves home very early with the motivation to be able to get his loved ones ahead and to be able to provide them with all of the comforts that they deserve.

Asunto wants to improve his family's quality of life, so with the loan granted he intends to buy a gas stove to replace the one he has because it functions with kerosene. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, and wants them to know that with their help he will be able to live more comfortably and thus continue striving for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, soil for making bricks, and pay labor costs

loans.name: Judegilda

texts.en:
Johnrey is 19 years old, and is fifth of the three children in the family. His mother, Judegilda, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Johnrey is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology, and is currently in his third year of this four-year course.

Judegilda is borrowing PHP 6,950 to pay for tuition fees of her son Johnrey for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When he graduates, Johnrey plans to to find a job so he could help his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Bhabani Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Soni is a 32-year-old housewife who lives in Jarmundi, Dumka, Jarkhand. She has studied up to eighth grade. She didn't have the opportunity to study further because her family could not afford the school fees. Soni has two daughters, both studying in school. 

Soni and her husband run a grinding machine shop. Soni helps her husband as she wants to work to earn more and to support the family.

Soni is a leader of “Bhabani Mahila Samuha” Self-Help group which consists of four other members. The loan Soni seeks from MESP is to buy spare parts of the grinding mill, as every now and then she has to repair her mill. She wishes her business will flourish as it will help her provide a good life to her family. She even dreams of constructing a house.

The other members are also seeking a loan to improve their livelihood. Help these hardworking women improve their life.

loans.use: to repair her grinding mill

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 62 años, es agricultor, estudió hasta sexto grado ya que para sus padres no era tan importante la educacion, se enfocaban  mas en el trabajo de campo. Actualmente vive solo con su hijo ya que se separó de su esposa cuando su hijo tenia la edad de 5 años, y ahora su hijo es quien le apoya incondicionalmente en la siembra del maíz.


Carlos conoce de la agricultura desde hace 50 años aproximadamente, le ayudaba a su padre y así fue aprendiendo, se dedica a la siembra de maíz.  La cosecha la tiene a unos pasos de su vivienda y eso le ha facilitado estar mas pendiente para el cuido de ésta, ya que para él es importante que su cosecha sea abundante y buena, cuando la cosecha está lista vende el elote y asi le queda el zacate para los animales  ya que también se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 3 vacas lecheras, vende leche y queso y de la ganancia va cubriendo las necesidades diarias, tambien tiene 2 terneros de repasto, que espera venderlos cuando se acerque el tiempo de vencimiento de su crédito. 


El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas, tales como semilla, abono, herbicidas para plaga entre otros, ya que pretende sembrar 16 hectáreas de maíz.

Carlos anhela tener buenos resultados en su cosecha para mejorar el nivel de vida para él y su hijo.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 62, is a farmer. He attended school through the sixth grade, but then left to focus on working in the field since his education was not as important to his parents. He currently lives alone with his son. He and his wife separated when the boy was five years old, and now it is his son who supports him unconditionally in farming corn.

Carlos learned the art of agriculture some fifty years ago helping his father, and his primary work is planting and growing corn. His field is only a few steps from his home and this has helped him stay on top of its care. It's very important to him that the harvest be good and bountiful. When the harvest is ready, he will sell the corn and keep the remaining forage for his cattle. He has three milk cows and sells milk and cheese. His earnings from this cover the everyday expenses. He also has two young steers that he hopes to sell when the time gets closer for him to pay off his loan.

He will his this loan to buy farm supplies like seed, manure, herbicides including antifungals, and more. He intends to plan 16 hectares of corn. Carlos fervently hopes to have a good harvest so that he can improve his and his son's quality of life.

loans.use: buy supplies to plant 16 hectares of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for the supplies and labor to improve her kitchen

loans.name: Manorama

texts.en: Manorama is 31 years old and lives in Deogarh district with her family. Her family consists of her parents-in-laws, husband and two children who are in school. Her family does not have clean and safe water access. Her family has to drink pond water and it is not safe for her family member's health so she decided to buy pipes to have a water connection for drinking and food making and for this reason, she needs this loan.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for a water connection

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is 23 years old and lives with her two children and husband in a small village of Deogarh district of Odisha, India. Lita's family does not have a clean water connection and for this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy pipes for water access. Lita is a housewife and her husband is a farmer and all the family expenses fall on her husband's shoulder. Some months ago, her children faced a disease caused by drinking impure water and it make her aware of the importance of clean and safe water.

loans.use: to buy pipes to access clean water

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Lois joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her three children. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Lois had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lois can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than at harvest. 

Lois hopes to use the additional income to educate her children, and, eventually she hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To meet urgent cash needs, and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Chanda Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en: The Self-Help group “Chanda Mahila Samuha” is taking its first loan with Kiva. This group consists of five members: Talu, Babli, Hasina, Farjana, and Jubeda. The members of this group are engaged in different livelihoods. Talu (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the leader. Talu started a goat farm with a small amount of capital and bought lambs and goats. Talu is married and the mother of two sons who are studying in school. Her husband is a daily wage laborer and earns 150 INR per day. The women in the group consider her as a role model and want to grow with her help. The loan the group is receiving will be used to improve their livelihood. Talu is requesting this loan to buy more goats. She raises them in her community for six to eight months and sells them. This loan will help turn these women into small entrepreneurs in Josidih village, Jharkhand. They are very hardworking and confident that with this loan, they will be able to contribute to their families' incomes and become self-sufficient. They all hope to save enough to send their children to school to educate them and turn them into good human beings.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Lucy, fifty years old, married with four children. She does both dairy and vegetable farming.

Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development, she has been able to manage her enterprises more effectively. She is taking a loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds to boost her business. She believes this will improve both crop yield and milk production. This will increase her income, and, hence, Lucy will be in a position to provide basic needs for her family like school fees and food.

Lucy is happy for the Kiva loan and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be successful. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are schoolchildren. She describes her biggest business challenge to be small business space. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials to expand her business premises. Her business goal is to own a bigger hotel [food business] within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank

loans.use: to buy materials to expand her business premises.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is a 23-year-old. He is one of eight siblings living in Irbid, Jordan. Odai has a part-time job working as a salesman to help pay for his bachelor's degree and to provide some of his pocket money. His parents also help provide for some of his pocket money. Odai is applying for a loan to help him cover the rest of the semester fees at the university.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees at the university.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is an agronomist from the village of Darpas in the Lori region. She lives with her husband, her two sons (20 and 23 years old), her brother-in-law and her mother-in-law. 

To take care of her family Ruzanna is engaged in the cultivation of haricots, potatoes and cabbages as well as in growing different types of fruit trees (cherry, plum, apple, pear and nut). With the help of her family members, she sells agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of income for the family. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Ruzanna currently needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of $800 to purchase fertilizer and new saplings as well as to cover costs associated with tree care. 

Ruzanna and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, new saplings and other costs associated with tree care.

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy de 34 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta cuarto grado, ya que sus padres eran de muy bajos recursos económicos y se le dificultó seguirla mandando a la escuela, creció y ahora está acompañada, es madre de 2 niños que asisten a 6 y 3er grado, su pareja es agricultor y ambos trabajan en conjunto para sacar adelante a sus pequeños.


Elsy trabaja en la agricultura desde que era muy pequeña, su padre le enseñó este trabajo, cuando salió de la escuela, se esforzó en aprenderlo ya que pensó en que sería su fuente de ingreso en un futuro y asi fue,  ya que con esto puede cubrir las necesidades de sus pequeños, su esposo se esfuerza mucho, también para sacar adelante a su familia, siembran maíz, su cultivo esta a una distancia de medio kilómetro de su hogar, pero eso no es una dificultad cuando se trata de obtener buenos resultados, por lo tanto se tienen que ir muy temprano para el campo a trabajar, sus pequeños también les colaboran ya que conocen bastante como se cultiva el maíz.

El préstamo será utilizado para preparar la tierra, comprar una bolsa de semilla de maíz, tres sacos de abono y comprara también herbicidas para la plaga.

El anhelo para Elsy es sacar adelante a sus pequeños, que tengan las oportunidades que ella no tuvo académicamente, asa mismo que la cosecha le de buenos resultados ya que de la ganancia espera mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Elsy, age 34, is a housewife and the mother of two children. She attended school through the fourth grade, when her parents, who did not have much money, found it too hard to keep sending her to school. She grew up, got married, and her two children are now in the 6th and 3rd grade. Her husband is a farmer and together they are working to get their kids ahead.

Elsy learned how to farm as a very young child from her father. When she left school he made her learn it since he thought that it one day might be her main source of income, and so it is, as she is able to meet the needs of her little ones. Her husband also works hard to get the family ahead. He plants corn on a plot about a half a kilometer from their home. This is no burden, though, when it comes to getting a good harvest, even though he has to get up very early to work. The kids also help out and they are learning quite a lot about growing corn. 

The loan will be used to prepare the land, buy a bag of seed corn, three sacks of fertilizer, and fungicides.

Elsy's great dream is to get her children ahead and see them have the kind of academic opportunities that she never had. She also wants a good harvest since she hopes to improve her home from their earnings.

loans.use: buy farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy some household necessities

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 30 years old. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school.

May is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. May has requested a loan of 12,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. May has been in the pig fattening business for four years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

May would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old.  She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Grace has a food vending business in the Philippines. Grace has requested a loan of 12,500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Grace has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Trinity

texts.en:
Livingstone is home to one of the world’s seven natural wonders, Victoria Falls. This magnificent place is where 27-year-old Trinity runs his mobile money transfer business. He lives in a rented house with his two sisters and brother.

Trinity started running his own business three months ago. He believes his business is going to be successful because of his commitment to offer the very best customer service. He is happy to be able to provide a service that makes people’s lives easier.  Before Trinity started his business, he worked as a teller at a Zoona trading booth belonging to Allan. He worked as a teller for two years and because of his good customer service and discipline, his boss Allan connected him to Zoona and helped him set up his own mobile money transfer business. 
 
Running a business comes with many challenges. Trinity’s biggest challenge is that he does not have enough cash in his business to meet his customers’ demands. He is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can boost his working capital and serve more customers, therefore becoming more profitable.

These funds will ensure that Trinity has enough money to fulfill his customers’ transactions.  This then helps to increase his commissions, which he depends on for his income.  This also makes sure he never has to turn away customers who need his services.  He hopes to expand his business to provide for his family and see his siblings through school.

loans.use: To boost his working capital in his mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a 44-year-old married woman. Her husband started working in a security agency after he retired from the military to be able to support his family of eight members. Wedad also works as a tailor to help. Her challenge is working at home where there is no room to show her work. For that, Wedad is trying to expand and make more profit to be able to rent a shop to move the business from home to an independent location. Now Wedad is applying for a loan to buy more fabric and new sewing tools.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and new sewing tools.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José de 64 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta quinto grado ya que sus padres eran de bajos recursos económicos y esto le impidió que continuara. Actualmente vive solo con sus 2 hijos, ya que su esposa murió cuando sus hijos eran muy pequeños, ahora ellos crecieron y son quienes le apoyan en la siembra del maíz y ajonjolí.


José aprendió de la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, sus padres se dedicaban a este trabajo y por ende le enseñaron para que fuera su fuente de ingreso, el cultivo está cerca de la vivienda y junto a sus hijos tiene que estar pendiente para que sea una cosecha buena, la abonan en el tiempo correcto y esto hace que crezca y se desarrolle de una mejor manera.

El préstamo lo utilizará para terminar de cultivar 32 héctareas de ajonjolí, comprara semilla de ajonjolí, abono y herbicidas.

Para José su sueño principal es tener buenos resultados en la cosecha y así poder mejorar el nivel de vida para él y sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, age 64, is a farmer. He attended school through the fifth grade, but his parents were poor and this prevented him from continuing in school. He currently lives with his two children. His wife died when the children were very young. They're grown up now and they help him plant corn and sesame.

José learned farming when he was very young from his parents, who were also farmers and expected that this would be his livelihood. His field is close to his home. He and his sons have to be ready for a good harvest, planting in the right season so that the crop grows and develops in the right way.

This loan will be used to complete the planting of 32 hectares of sesame. He will buy sesame seed, fertilizer, and herbicides. José's main dream is to have a good harvest so that he can improve his and his son's quality of life.

loans.use: grow 32 hectares of sesame and buy supplies for his crop

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, esta dedicado a la fabricación y comercialización de aderezos y vinagres para ensaladas, inició su negocio hace 3 años, pero tiene una amplia experiencia pues era empleado en una empresas de alimentos donde aprendió el oficio y decidió crear su empresa, para ser  independiente y mejorar sus ingresos. Fernando fabrica sus productos con ácido acético, conservantes, saborizantes y agua, produce vinagres de diferentes sabores, y los vende por pedidos o de contado en una localidad  de la capital de Colombia: "Bogotá", distribuyéndolos puerta a puerta o en auto servicios , trabaja 3 días a la semana 12 horas, realiza sus compras de contado a proveedores de insumos alimenticios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financieminto que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar  envases de 50cm  por  5000 unidades y una maquina codificadora, así podrá lograr el stock de productos necesarios para la venta, lo que hace que su credikiva impacte positivamente su negocio.  Fernando desea expandirse a otras localidades de la ciudad en pro de incrmentar, aun mas, sus ingresos y así cumplir con el sueño de tener casa propia y brindar un mejor bienestar a su hijo de 10 años, actualmente vive en arriendo en un barrio de la capital de Colombia:  "Bogotá".  Su desafío a través de los créditos, es invertir para generar más ingresos y aumenten su nivel de ahorro.
texts.en:
Fernando earns a living making and selling salad dressings and vinegars.  He started his business three years ago, but he has wide experience because he was an employee in a food business where he learned the trade.  He decided to found his business so he could be independent and improve his income.

Fernando makes his products with acetic acid, preservatives, flavoring, and water.  He produces different flavors of vinegar and sells them on request or in cash door-to-door or in gas stations in an area of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia.  He works twelve hours a day, three days a week.  He makes his purchases in cash from suppliers of food products.

Currently he's applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy 5,000 50-cm. containers and an encoding machine.  That way he'll be able to stock the products he needs to sell, and his Kiva loan will have a positive impact on his business.  His challenge with the loans is to earn more income and increase his savings.

Fernando wants to expand to other locales in the city so he can increase his income even more and realize his dream of having his own home and giving his 10-year-old son greater well-being.  Currently he's renting in a neighborhood in Bogotá.

loans.use: to buy 5,000 50-cm. containers and an encoding machine

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, her three children and her mother in the Martvili district. The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, they have a cow and a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut trees, selling the harvested nuts locally. 

Ekaterine has decided to purchase a pig and start a husbandry business. The startup loan program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to obtain a loan of 900 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase a pig and will raise it in order to expand the husbandry business in the future. This will increase the family income and, with the increased income, she will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and start a husbandry business.

loans.name: Kima

texts.en: Kima, her husband, son, and daughter-in-law produce bedding products. After 5 years in business, Kima and her family are skilled in this type of trade, and due to their hard work, they receive many orders every month. To be able to fill current orders, Kima has requested this loan to purchase materials for producing linens, blankets, and pillows.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to produce bedding products (linens, blankets, pillows).

loans.name: Erica De La Cruz

texts.es:
Erica de 29 años de edad, es ama de casa, está acompañada,  estudió hasta noveno grado, luego se acompañó y junto a su esposo procrearon 2 hijos que ahora asisten a la escuela de la comunidad, trabaja en la agricultura junto a su esposo, ambos trabajan en conjunto y para beneficio de sus pequeños.

Erica conoce de la agricultura desde que se acompañó eso fué hace 10 años aproximadamente, su esposo le enseñó y ambos han trabajado arduamente para el fortalecimiento de su hogar y para que a sus niños no les falte lo necesario para vivir, también se dedican a la ganadería, tienen 2 vacas con sus terneritos, venden la leche y de ahí compran los alimentos diarios.


El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar 2 novillos para repasto, los cuidará y cuando llegue el vencimiento del crédito los venderá para cancelar la deuda y de la ganancia espera cubrir algunas necesidades.


El sueño para Erica es mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia, así mismo brindarle educación universitaria a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien y tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Erica, 29 years old, is a housewife and she is in a relationship.  She studied until the 9th grade.  Then she entered into a relationship and together with her husband had 2 children who now attend school in the community.  She works in agriculture with her husband.  They work together for the benefit of their little ones.

Erica has been familiar with agriculture since she entered into her relationship.  That was approximately 10 years ago.  Her husband taught her and they have both worked hard to strengthen their home and make it so that their children have everything they need in life.  

They also work in livestock.  They have 2 cows with their calves.  The sell the milk and from that buy their daily food. 

She will use the loan to buy 2 young steers to raise.  She will take care of them and when the loan reaches maturity she will sell them to cancel the debt and from the profit she hopes to meet some needs.

Erica’s dream is to improve her family’s quality of life and also to provide her children with a university education so that they become respectable people and have greater work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy two young steers to raise.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 60 years old. She lives in a small village in the Martvili district with her 40-year-old son. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have hens and a plot of agricultural land where nut trees are grown. Makvala sells the harvested nuts locally. 

Makvala has decided to purchase a cow and expand her agricultural business. The startup loan program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to obtain a loan of 500 GEL in order to purchase a cow. Once the cow is purchased, she will start producing dairy products to sell. In this way, she will increase her family income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine for serving hot drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to construct a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.en:
San Francisco El Alto is a very quiet highland town surrounded by many small villages. On Fridays, many travel from all parts of the area either to sell vegetables or animals or to buy their weekly supplies. Unlike the tourist market in Chichicastenango, the one in San Francisco El Alto is for the locals. 

A group of nine enterprising businesswomen have joined together with the goal of improving their standard of living, educating their children, empowering themselves and eliminating poverty. They have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “San Miguel” and are soliciting a loan from Friendship Bridge, hopefully funded by KIVA investors.

Nicolasa, a widow who is 53 years old and has four children, is part of the Board of Directors of the group. She is a potter and makes ceramic bowls, plates and cups. She works with her children and sells her pottery wholesale (by the dozen) every two weeks. Her ceramic pottery is well known throughout the Western Highlands. In addition, one of her daughters is a seamstress and makes elaborate aprons. Nicolasa is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase clay, wood and other supplies for her ceramic business as well as fabric for the aprons.

In funding these much-needed loans, KIVA investors are greatly appreciated by these women. They face a brighter future and are poised to create more successful lives for themselves, their families and their community!

loans.use: to buy clay, wood and other supplies for her ceramics business as well as fabric for her daughter’s aprons.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 42-year-old married mother of two children. She started 19 years ago working as a tailor in an attempt to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Due to increasing living costs, Elham's income is not enough anymore. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Elham hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Manuel Domingo

texts.es:
Manuel es un joven, humilde que vive en Sincelejo un sector no solo golpeado por la violencia si no pro la pobreza, pero donde hay personas que quieren progresar y demostrar que no tiene que seguir viviendo la misma historia y uno de ellos es Manuel quien con sus ventas de sandalias ha logrado encontrar una ayuda económica para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Manuel tiene que realizar largos desplazamientos para vender sus sandalias y ahora quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar 20 docenas de sandalias y tiene un capital ahorra pero le hace falta la mitad por tal razón el crédito y de verdad vale la pena apoyar a un joven que lucha diariamente por dejar de ser pobre.
texts.en:
Manuel is a humble young man who lives in Sincelejo, an area not only pummeled by violence, but also by poverty.  Nonetheless there are people there who want to make progress and show that they don’t have to keep living that same story; one of these is Manuel, who with his sandal sales has managed to find a means of financial help in order to cover the basic needs of his family.

Manuel has to commute a long way in order to sell his sandals.  At this point he wants to ask for a loan in order to buy 20 dozen pairs of sandals.  He has capital saved up, but he is missing half of what he needs—thus, the loan.  It is truly worth it to support this young man who fights on a daily basis to get out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for 20 dozen sandals and turn his life around, out of poverty and into success.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her inventory; demand has grown, and she needs to offer greater variety to her customers to improve her family finances

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras están en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer en las actividades que cada una hace. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien se dedica a la costura, es una mujer muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo y su sacrificio fue abriéndose camino. Ella se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos que son de agrado de sus clientes. Hoy pide este préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos, de manera a poder seguir con su esfuerzo y luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Las Emprendedoras are in their third loan cycle with the women's committee program, where they are all putting forth their best effort in order to grow in their respective jobs. 

One of the members is Ana, who makes her living as a seamstress. She is a very hardworking woman who, thanks to her efforts and sacrifice, has been paving the way. She has built up a very good clientele due to the fact that she always does great work which her customers love. Now she is requesting this loan to buy thread and fabric so she can continue her efforts and keep fighting to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for sewing

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cover his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Samaila is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to cover his immediate expenses, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay next semester's fees.

loans.name: Ibrahim Mati

texts.en: Ibrahim Mati is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim Mati joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mikah, Aminu and Yakubu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim Mati would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim Mati can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ibrahim Mati  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets his immediate expenses of food and child school fees, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es: Luciana de 53 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos de 18, 16, 15 y 27 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida transitando las calles de su municipio ofreciendo sus salpores y marquesotes, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos por el sabor y lo accesible de los precios. Luciana es una persona que siempre se ha apoyado en  la institución para mejorar su vivienda, ya que anteriormente adquirió un crédito que utilizo para construir una pila y un baño, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: duralita y polines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luciana, age 53, lives in her own home together with her husband and their four children, ages 15, 16, 18, and 27.  She is a hardworking woman who earns her living criss-crossing the streets of her city offering her "salpores" and “marquezotes" [traditional sweet pastries and breads].  She has been doing this for 20 years, so she has a good-sized customer base who always seek out her products for their flavor and reasonable prices.  

Luciana is a person who has always been supported by this institution to improve her home, because previously she took out a loan that she used to build a wash basin and a bathroom.  It is because of this that she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in Duralite roof sheeting and roofing beams in order to change the roof on her home.

loans.use: to invest in Duralite roof sheeting and roofing beams in order to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Mwila

texts.en:
Mwila is 26 years old. She is hardworking, cheerful and generous. She currently operates two Zoona mobile money transfer outlets, providing financial services to people in Chipata and Nyimba. Mwila lives with her mother and has the responsibility of supporting her as well as her four siblings.

Mwila has been running her mobile money transfer business for two years. She has seen her business grow and is very happy with the progress. This is Mwila’s third loan from Kiva. The first loan she got helped her set up her business. She was able to pay for all her set-up costs and quickly start transacting. She has successfully repaid this loan.

Mwila then got a second loan to help her open her second outlet in a small town called Nyimba. With this loan, she was able to purchase a trading booth that she uses to serve her customers who need to send and receive money from her Nyimba outlet.

Despite her business doing well, Mwila has some day-to-day challenges that she encounters. She sometimes lacks adequate float to sustain huge money transfer transactions. This then results in fewer commissions being earned. She has also wanted to grow her business by opening up more outlets within the region, but due to lack of capital, this has not yet materialized.

Mwila hopes that once she gets the Kiva loan, she will be able to increase her daily float to facilitate bigger payments as well as expand her business by opening up more outlets to reach out to distant communities. This will increase her revenue and help Mwila support her family financially, as it is one of her responsibilities. She is optimistic that very soon she will be able to provide adequate upkeep for her family.

loans.use: to grow her mobile money transfer business by increasing her daily float to facilitate bigger payments.

loans.name: Umar Danjuma

texts.en: Umar Danjuma is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Umar Danjuma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Umar Danjuma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Umar Danjuma, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hauwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Agyada, Saduda and Elisha.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hauwa spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to cover immediate expenses like food and child school fees, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cover his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Markus is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children - Sama, Ila and Asidu - are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to cover immedate expenses like child school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Adamu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Jamila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Dauda, Thomas and Ishaya.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Jamila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jamila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Jamila spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like school fees and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: La'A, Irmiya and Tabitha.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to pay for her immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. The loan will be used to meet her current needs until her harvest is sold. When asked, Maryamu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income from selling her harvest when the price is higher to educate her children. Eventually she hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to  meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Siemona, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de charbons, de l’argile, de savon et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente YAH, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon moderne. Elle compte acheter des cartons de savon chez les grossistes à Baroueli.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de chèvre.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is composed of married women. On the average, they are 41 years old, with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Siemona, Baroueli Prefecture, Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell cereals, condiments, charcoal, clay, soap and miscellaneous items.
The group members are on their third solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting high customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso.

Our client Yah, the second one seated from right to left in the photo, is illiterate. At present she works selling commercially produced soap. She plans to buy boxes of soap from wholesalers in Baroueli. She sells retail, for cash, out of her home and at times as a street vendor, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 35,000 West African francs, which will be invested in her goat-raising business.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Halinsa

texts.ru: Халинса 57 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Халинсы среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже много лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Халинсы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы, 18 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,58 ГА, где она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Халинсы составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Халинса обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки коров. Халинса намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота и развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Halinsa is 57 years old, married, and the mother of two. Halinsa has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has been growing farm produce and raising livestock for many years. Thanks to Halinsa's persistence, dedication and hard work, at present she  owns two cows and 18 sheep. She also has a land plot of 0.58 ha [1.4 acres], where she grows corn. Halinsa's monthly income is about 10,000 KGS. Halinsa has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy cattle. Halinsa intends to continue growing her livestock headcount and developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Maria Angela Rubidia

texts.es: María de 32 años de edad es una mujer admirable que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio de venta de hortalizas como: ayote y ejotes la cual realiza de forma ambulante en los lugares cercanos, además presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar obteniendo mejores ingresos. María habita en una vivienda humilde que carece de muchas comodidades pero sobre todo del servicio de agua potable, es por ello que en su preocupación por tener este vital servicio, María adquirió un crédito anteriormente con la institución, el cual le permitió cancelar el derecho de instalación, por lo que actualmente solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos, grifos, codos, regadera, etc. Para realizar la instalación de agua potable en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, age 32, is an admirable woman who works hard to take care of the household finances.  She manages this through her business selling vegetables such as pumpkins and green beans, which she does as a mobile vendor in nearby areas.  She also offers her services as a domestic worker in private homes in order to get more income.  

María lives in a humble home that is missing many conveniences, but above all drinking water.  Because of her concern about getting this important service, she got a previous loan from this institution, which allowed her to pay off the fees associated with gaining permission for the installation.  So, at this point in time she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in pipes, spigots, elbow joints, a shower head, etc. in order to complete the installation of potable water in her home.

loans.use: to invest in pipes, spigots, elbow joints, a shower head, etc., in order to complete the installation of potable water in her home.

loans.name: Wadha

texts.en: Wadha is a 49-year-old Lebanese woman. She is a widow and has one child. She is the sole bread earner of the family. Seven years ago, she started a business based around the production and sale of homemade food and other related products made out of fresh and organic ingredients and produce. Through the Kiva loan and partnership with Vitas sal, she will purchase equipment to increase the capacity of her business, enabling her to handle larger volumes due to potentially increasing demand.

loans.use: to purchase equipment.

loans.name: Nuhu Danjuma

texts.en:
Nuhu Danjuma is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu Danjuma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu Danjuma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Nuhu Danjuma, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses such as food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en: Ado is a maize farmer from the Gangarida village in the Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ado would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cover his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ado can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ado, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to cover immediate expenses like food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.
